 16836                                  
 16837                                  ;***	CtrlCHandler - our own control-c handler
 16838                                  ;
 16839                                  ;	Make sure user's default directory gets restored. See notes
 16840                                  ;	at InstallCtrlCHandler.
 16841                                  ;
 16842                                  ;	ENTRY	control-c
 16843                                  ;
 16844                                  ;	EXIT	to OldCtrlCHandler
 16845                                  ;
 16846                                  ;	USED	DS,flags
 16847                                  ;
 16848                                  ;	EFFECTS
 16849                                  ;
 16850                                  ;	  Restore user's default directory.
 16851                                  ;
 16852                                  ;	NOTES
 16853                                  ;
 16854                                  ;	  This handler is only installed after calling PathCrunch,
 16855                                  ;	  which sets UserDir1, so the restoration will work.
 16856                                  ;
 16857                                  ;	  The original control-c vector will be restored, whether
 16858                                  ;	  or not this one is invoked, in the HeadFix routine.
 16859                                  
 16860                                  	; 19/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 16861                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:1A1Eh
 16862                                  
 16863                                  CtrlCHandler:	;proc	far
 16864                                  
 16865                                  ;SR;
 16866                                  ; Save all registers used: ds, dx, ax. I know ax is being used by the 
 16867                                  ;CtrlC handler, am not sure about ds & dx. Save them to be safe
 16868                                  ;
 16869 00001993 1E                      	push	ds
 16870 00001994 0E                      	push	cs
 16871 00001995 1F                      	pop	ds			; DS = TRANGROUP seg addr
 16872 00001996 50                      	push	ax
 16873 00001997 52                      	push	dx
 16874 00001998 E8FC0A                  	call	RestUDir		; restore user's default directory
 16875 0000199B 5A                      	pop	dx
 16876 0000199C 58                      	pop	ax
 16877 0000199D 1F                      	pop	ds
 16878 0000199E 2EFF2E[C395]            	jmp	far [cs:OldCtrlCHandler]
 16879                                  					; go to previous int 23 handler
 16880                                  
 16881                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16882                                  
 16883                                  ;M010;start
 16884                                  ;***	LowerCase - convert ASCII character in AL to lowercase
 16885                                  ;
 16886                                  ;	ENTRY	AL = character to be displayed
 16887                                  ;
 16888                                  ;	EXIT	AL is lowercase
 16889                                  ;
 16890                                  ;	USED	nothing
 16891                                  
 16892                                  	; 19/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 16893                                  LowerCase:
 16894 000019A3 3C41                    	cmp	al,'A'			; ensure AL is in range 'A'-'Z'
 16895 000019A5 7206                    	jb	short lcRet
 16896 000019A7 3C5A                    	cmp	al,'Z'
 16897 000019A9 7702                    	ja	short lcRet
 16898                                  
 16899 000019AB 0C20                    	or	al,20h			; convert to ASCII lowercase (UpperCase+32)-->LowerCase
 16900                                  lcRet:
 16901 000019AD C3                      	retn
 16902                                  
 16903                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16904                                  
 16905                                  ;***	LowercaseString - convert ASCIIZ string at DS:SI to lowercase
 16906                                  ;
 16907                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:SI points to start of ASCIIZ string
 16908                                  ;		ES = DS
 16909                                  ;
 16910                                  ;	EXIT	nothing
 16911                                  ;	
 16912                                  ;	USED	AL,SI
 16913                                  
 16914                                  	; 19/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 16915                                  LowercaseString:
 16916 000019AE 57                      	push	di			; save di
 16917 000019AF 89F7                    	mov	di,si			; ES:DI --> ASCIIZ string
 16918 000019B1 FC                      	cld
 16919                                  NextChar: 
 16920 000019B2 AC                      	lodsb				; get character from string into al
 16921 000019B3 08C0                    	or	al,al			; are we at end of string?
 16922 000019B5 7406                    	jz	short EndOfString
 16923                                  
 16924 000019B7 E8E9FF                  	call	LowerCase		; convert character to lowercase
 16925 000019BA AA                      	stosb				; store character back into buffer
 16926 000019BB EBF5                    	jmp	short NextChar		; repeat until end of string
 16927                                  
 16928                                  EndOfString:
 16929 000019BD 5F                      	pop	di			; restore di
 16930 000019BE C3                      	retn
 16931                                  
 16932                                  ;M010;end

 16957                                  ;****************************************************************
 16958                                  ;*
 16959                                  ;* ROUTINE:	DEL/ERASE - erase file(s)
 16960                                  ;*
 16961                                  ;* FUNCTION:	PARSE command line for file or path name and /P
 16962                                  ;*		and invoke PATHCRUNCH. If an error occurs, set
 16963                                  ;*		up an error message and transfer control to CERROR.
 16964                                  ;*		Otherwise, transfer control to NOTEST2 if /P not
 16965                                  ;*		entered or SLASHP_ERASE if /P entered.
 16966                                  ;*
 16967                                  ;* INPUT:	command line at offset 81H
 16968                                  ;*
 16969                                  ;* OUTPUT:	if no error:
 16970                                  ;*		FCB at 5ch set up with filename(s) entered
 16971                                  ;*		Current directory set to entered directory
 16972                                  ;*
 16973                                  ;****************************************************************
 16974                                  
 16975                                  	; 20/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 16976                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:1A57h
 16977                                  ERASE:
 16978                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 16979                                  
 16980                                  	;assume	ds:trangroup,es:trangroup
 16981

 17024                                  				;AN000; continue parsing
 17025                                  set_erase_prompt:
 17026 00001A0B 833E[D78A]00            	cmp	word [COMSW],0 	;AN018; was /P already entered?

 17031                                  				;AN018; set up too many arguments
 17032 00001A15 E8B907                  	call	setup_parse_error_msg
 17033                                  				;AN018; set up an error message
 17034 00001A18 EB33                    	jmp	short errj2	;AN018; exit
 17035                                  
 17036                                  ok_to_set_erase_prompt: 	;AN018;
 17037 00001A1A FF06[D78A]              	inc	word [COMSW]	;AN000; indicate /p specified
 17038 00001A1E EBB9                    	jmp	short erase_scan
 17039                                  				;AN000; continue parsing
 17040                                  good_line:			;G  We know line is good
 17041 00001A20 E8630C                  	call	PathCrunch
 17042 00001A23 730D                    	jnc	short checkdr

 17060 00001A3F B80300                  	mov	ax,ERROR_PATH_NOT_FOUND ; 3
 17061                                  				;AN022; set up error number

 17070                                  errj2:				;AC022; exit jump

 17381                                  ;****************************************************************
 17382                                  ;*
 17383                                  ;* ROUTINE:	TYPEFIL - Display the contents of a file to the
 17384                                  ;*		standard output device
 17385                                  ;*
 17386                                  ;* SYNTAX:	TYPE filespec
 17387                                  ;*
 17388                                  ;* FUNCTION:	If a valid filespec is found, read the file until
 17389                                  ;*		1Ah and display the contents to STDOUT.
 17390                                  ;*
 17391                                  ;* INPUT:	command line at offset 81H
 17392                                  ;*
 17393                                  ;* OUTPUT:	none
 17394                                  ;*
 17395                                  ;****************************************************************
 17396                                  
 17397                                  	; 20/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 17398                                  TYPEFIL:
 17399                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 17651                                  			; DS:DX	-> buffer

 17669                                  	dec	cx		;  bytes up to but NOT including the ^Z
 17670                                  	push	cs		;  will be typed.
 17671                                  	pop	es

 17673                                  				;  will quit after this write.

 17679                                  			; BX = file handle, CX = number of bytes to write,
 17680                                  			; DS:DX -> buffer

 17685                                  	dec	cx

 17687                                  	jnz	short ERROR_OUTPUTJ

 17694                                  			; BX = file or device handle

 17696                                  	test	dl,80h
 17697                                  	jnz	short TYPEFIL_RETN ; If device, no error message
 17698                                  	jmp	ERROR_OUTPUT

 17703                                  ; VOLUME command displays the volume ID on the specified drive
 17704                                  
 17705                                  	; 20/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 17706                                  VOLUME:
 17707                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17708 00001C1E BE8100                  	mov	si,81h
 17709 00001C21 BF[2F85]                	mov	di,PARSE_VOL
 17710                                  				;AN000; Get address of PARSE_VOL
 17711 00001C24 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		;AN000; clear cx,dx
 17712 00001C26 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		;AN000;
 17713 00001C28 E89705                  	call	Parse_With_Msg	;AC018; call parser
 17714 00001C2B 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,-1
 17715                                  	;cmp	ax,END_OF_LINE	;AC000; are we at end of line?
 17716 00001C2E 7444                    	je	short OkVolArg	;AC000; Yes, display default volume ID
 17717                                  	;cmp	ax,RESULT_NO_ERROR
 17718                                  	;cmp	ax,0		;AC000; did we have an error?
 17719 00001C30 09C0                    	or	ax,ax ; 0?
 17720 00001C32 750A                    	jnz	short badvolarg	;AC000; Yes, fail.
 17721                                  
 17722                                  ; We have parsed off the drive. See if there are any more chars left
 17723                                  
 17724 00001C34 BF[2F85]                	mov	di,PARSE_VOL
 17725                                  				;AC000; get address of parse_vol
 17726 00001C37 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		;AC000;
 17727 00001C39 E87005                  	call	parse_check_eol ;AC000; call parser
 17728 00001C3C 7436                    	jz	short OkVolArg	;AC000; yes, end of road
 17729                                  
 17730                                  ; The line was not interpretable. Report an error.
 17731                                  
 17732                                  badvolarg:
 17733 00001C3E E91D0D                  	jmp	cerror
 17734                                  
 17735                                  ; 20/02/2023
 17736                                  %if 0
 17737                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 17738                                  	mov	si,81h
 17739                                  	call	SCANOFF		; Skip to first non-delim
 17740                                  	;mov	ah,[5Ch]
 17741                                  	mov	ah,[FCB]
 17742                                  	;mov	byte [5Ch],0
 17743                                  	mov	byte [FCB],0
 17744                                  	cmp	al,0Dh		; are we at end of line?
 17745                                  	jz	short OKVOLARG	; Yes, display default volume ID
 17746                                  	;mov	[5Ch],ah
 17747                                  	mov	[FCB],ah
 17748                                  	lodsb
 17749                                  	lodsb
 17750                                  	cmp	al,':'

 17791                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17792                                  
 17793                                  ;***	DisAppend - disable APPEND
 17794                                  ;
 17795                                  ;	ENTRY	nothing
 17796                                  ;
 17797                                  ;	EXIT	nothing
 17798                                  ;
 17799                                  ;	USED	AX,BX
 17800                                  ;
 17801                                  ;	EFFECTS
 17802                                  ;
 17803                                  ;	  APPEND is disabled. If it was active, it will be re-enabled
 17804                                  ;	  after the command finishes, by the HeadFix routine.
 17805                                  ;
 17806                                  ;	NOTE
 17807                                  ;
 17808                                  ;	  This routine must not be called more than once during a single
 17809                                  ;	  command cycle. The second call would permanently disable APPEND.
 17810                                  
 17811                                  	; 21/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 17812                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:1CDFh
 17813                                  
 17814                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17815                                  DisAppend:
 17816 00001C41 1E                      	push	ds			; save DS
 17817 00001C42 06                      	push	es			; save ES
 17818 00001C43 57                      	push	di
 17819                                  
 17820                                  	;mov	ax,APPENDINSTALL	; AX = Append Installed Check code
 17821 00001C44 B800B7                  	mov	ax,0B700h
 17822 00001C47 CD2F                    	int	2Fh			; talk to APPEND via multiplex
 17823 00001C49 08C0                    	or	al,al
 17824 00001C4B 7423                    	jz	short daRet		; APPEND not installed, return
 17825                                  
 17826                                  	;mov	ax,APPENDDOS		; AX = Get Append Version code
 17827 00001C4D B802B7                  	mov	ax,0B702h
 17828 00001C50 CD2F                    	int	2Fh			; talk to APPEND via multiplex
 17829 00001C52 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 17830 00001C55 7519                    	jne	short daRet		; it's not a local version, return
 17831                                  
 17832                                  	;mov	ax,APPENDGETSTATE	; AX = Get Function State code
 17833 00001C57 B806B7                  	mov	ax,0B706h
 17834 00001C5A CD2F                    	int	2Fh			; talk to APPEND via multiplex
 17835                                  
 17836 00001C5C 8E1E[C08A]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]		; DS = resident seg addr
 17837                                  
 17838 00001C60 891E[C301]              	mov	[Append_State],bx	; Append_State = saved APPEND state
 17839 00001C64 C606[C501]FF            	mov	byte [Append_Flag],-1	; Append_Flag = true, restore state
 17840                                  
 17841 00001C69 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; BX = APPEND state = off
 17842                                  	;mov	ax,APPENDSETSTATE	; AX = Set Append State code
 17843 00001C6B B807B7                  	mov	ax,0B707h
 17844 00001C6E CD2F                    	int	2Fh			; talk to APPEND via multiplex
 17845                                  daRet:	
 17846 00001C70 5F                      	pop	di
 17847 00001C71 07                      	pop	es			; restore ES
 17848 00001C72 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore DS
 17849                                  
 17850 00001C73 C3                      	retn
 17851                                  
 17852                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17853                                  
 17854                                  ; Find the Volume ID on the disk.
 17855                                  
 17856                                  	; 21/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 17857                                  
 17858                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17859                                  OkVolArg:
 17860 00001C74 E8CAFF                  	call	DisAppend		; disable APPEND
 17861 00001C77 E86309                  	call	CRLF2
 17862                                  	;mov	al,blank			
 17863 00001C7A B020                    	mov	al,' ' ; 20h		;AN051; Print out a blank
 17864 00001C7C E87D01                  	call	PRINT_CHAR		;AN051;  before volume message
 17865 00001C7F 1E                      	push	ds
 17866 00001C80 07                      	pop	es
 17867                                  
 17868                                  ; Volume IDs are only findable via extended FCBs or find_first with attributes
 17869                                  ; of volume_id ONLY.
 17870                                  
 17871 00001C81 BF5500                  	mov	di,FCB-7 ; 55h		; Point to extended FCB beginning
 17872 00001C84 B0FF                    	mov	al,-1			; Tag to indicate Extention
 17873 00001C86 AA                      	stosb
 17874 00001C87 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; Zero padding to volume label
 17875 00001C89 AB                      	stosw
 17876 00001C8A AB                      	stosw
 17877 00001C8B AA                      	stosb
 17878 00001C8C B008                    	mov	al,ATTR_VOLUME_ID ; 8	; Look for volume label
 17879 00001C8E AA                      	stosb
 17880 00001C8F 47                      	inc	di			; Skip drive byte; it is already set
 17881 00001C90 B90B00                  	mov	cx,11			; fill in remainder of file
 17882 00001C93 B03F                    	mov	al,'?'
 17883 00001C95 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 17884                                  
 17885                                  ; Set up transfer address (destination of search first information)
 17886

 17891                                  
 17892                                  ; Do the search
 17893

 17895                                  	;mov	ah,Dir_Search_First

 17897 00001CA3 CD21                    	int	21h
 17898                                  
 17899                                  ;********************************
 17900                                  ; Print volume ID info
 17901                                  
 17902 00001CA5 50                      	push	ax			;AC000; AX return from SEARCH_FIRST for VOL ID
 17903 00001CA6 A05C00                  	mov	al,[FCB]  ; [5Ch]	;AC000; get drive letter
 17904 00001CA9 0440                    	add	al,'@'  ; add al,40h
 17905 00001CAB 3C40                    	cmp	al,'@'
 17906 00001CAD 7505                    	jne	short drvok
 17907 00001CAF A0[D48A]                	mov	al,[CURDRV]
 17908                                  	;add	al,capital_A
 17909 00001CB2 0441                    	add	al,'A'
 17910                                  drvok:

 17912 00001CB7 58                      	pop	ax			;AC000; get return code back
 17913 00001CB8 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AC000; volume label found?
 17914 00001CBA 7405                    	jz	short Get_vol_name	;AC000; volume label exists - go get it
 17915 00001CBC BA[5080]                	mov	dx,VolMes_Ptr_2		;AC000; set up no volume message
 17916 00001CBF EB13                    	jmp	short print_serial	;AC000; go print it
 17917                                  
 17918                                  Get_vol_name:
 17919 00001CC1 BF[FA8A]                	mov	di,CHARBUF
 17920 00001CC4 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 17921 00001CC6 BE[D18B]                	mov	si,DIRBUF+8		;AN000;  3/3/KK
 17922 00001CC9 B90B00                  	mov	cx,11			;AN000;  3/3/KK
 17923 00001CCC F3A4                    	rep	movsb			;AN000;  3/3/KK
 17924                                  
 17925 00001CCE 30C0                    	xor	al,al			;AC000; store a zero to terminate the string
 17926 00001CD0 AA                      	stosb
 17927 00001CD1 BA[5E80]                	mov	dx,VolMes_Ptr		;AC000; set up message
 17928                                  
 17929                                  print_serial:
 17930                                  
 17931                                  ; Attempt to get the volume serial number from the disk. If an error
 17932                                  ; occurs, do not print volume serial number.
 17933                                  
 17934 00001CD4 52                      	push	dx			;AN000; save message offset
 17935                                  	;mov	ax,(GetSetMediaID SHL 8)
 17936 00001CD5 B80069                  	mov	ax,6900h		;AC036; Get the volume serial info
 17937 00001CD8 8A1E5C00                	mov	bl,[FCB] ; [5Ch]	;AN000; get drive number from FCB
 17938 00001CDC BA[188E]                	mov	dx,vol_ioctl_buf	;AN000;target buffer
 17939 00001CDF CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000; do the call
 17940                                  			; DOS - 4.0 internal - GET/SET DISK SERIAL NUMBER
 17941                                  			; AL = 00h get serial number / 01h set serial number
 17942                                  			; BL = drive (0=default, 1=A, 2=B, etc)
 17943                                  			; DS:DX -> disk info
 17944 00001CE1 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000; get message offset back
 17945 00001CE2 720B                    	jc	short printvol_end	;AN000; if error, just go print label
 17946 00001CE4 E83C31                  	call	std_printf		;AC000; go print volume message
 17947                                  	;mov	al,blank

 17949 00001CE9 E81001                  	call	PRINT_CHAR		;AN051;  before volume message
 17950 00001CEC BA[7780]                	mov	dx,VolSerMes_Ptr 	;AN000; get serial number message
 17951                                  printvol_end:
 17952 00001CEF E93131                  	jmp	std_printf		;AC000; go print and exit

 17958                                  ;* ROUTINE:	Set_ext_error_msg
 17959                                  ;*
 17960                                  ;* FUNCTION:	Sets up extended error message for printing
 17961                                  ;*
 17962                                  ;* INPUT:	return from INT 21
 17963                                  ;*

 17965                                  ;*		buffer.

 17983                                  ;****************************************************************
 17984                                  ;*
 17985                                  ;* ROUTINE:	Get_ext_error_number
 17986                                  ;*
 17987                                  ;* FUNCTION:	Does get extended error function call
 17988                                  ;*
 17989                                  ;* INPUT:	return from INT 21
 17990                                  ;*
 17991                                  ;* OUTPUT:	AX - extended error number
 17992                                  ;*
 17993                                  ;****************************************************************
 17994                                  
 17995                                  	; 21/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 17996                                  
 17997                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 17998                                  get_ext_error_number:			;AN022;
 17999                                  
 18000                                  	;SaveReg <BX,CX,DX,SI,DI,BP,ES,DS>
 18001                                  					;AN022; save registers
 18002 00001D02 53                      	push	bx
 18003 00001D03 51                      	push	cx
 18004 00001D04 52                      	push	dx
 18005 00001D05 56                      	push	si
 18006 00001D06 57                      	push	di
 18007 00001D07 55                      	push	bp
 18008 00001D08 06                      	push	es
 18009 00001D09 1E                      	push	ds
 18010                                  	;mov	ah,GetExtendedError	;AN022; get extended error
 18011 00001D0A B459                    	mov	ah,59h
 18012 00001D0C 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN022; clear BX
 18013 00001D0E CD21                    	int	21h			;AN022;
 18014                                  			; DOS - 3+ - GET EXTENDED ERROR CODE
 18015                                  			; BX = version code (0000h for DOS 3.x)
 18016                                  
 18017                                  	;RestoreReg  <DS,ES,BP,DI,SI,DX,CX,BX>
 18018                                  					;AN022; restore registers
 18019 00001D10 1F                      	pop	ds
 18020 00001D11 07                      	pop	es
 18021 00001D12 5D                      	pop	bp
 18022 00001D13 5F                      	pop	di
 18023 00001D14 5E                      	pop	si
 18024 00001D15 5A                      	pop	dx
 18025 00001D16 59                      	pop	cx
 18026 00001D17 5B                      	pop	bx
 18027                                  
 18028 00001D18 C3                      	retn				;AN022; return

 18039                                  
 18040                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18041                                  
 18042                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 18043                                  ;***	Version - display DOS version
 18044                                  ;
 18045                                  ;	SYNTAX	ver [/debug]
 18046                                  ;
 18047                                  ;		/debug - display additional DOS configuration info
 18048                                  ;
 18049                                  ;	ENTRY	command-line tail is in PSP
 18050                                  ;
 18051                                  ;	EXIT	if successful, nothing
 18052                                  ;		if parse fails,
 18053                                  ;		  parse error message is set up (for Std_EPrintf)
 18054                                  ;		    AX = system parser error code
 18055                                  ;		    DX = ptr to message block
 18056                                  ;		  we jump to CError
 18057                                  ;
 18058                                  ;	EFFECTS
 18059                                  ;	  If parse fails, a parse error message is displayed.
 18060                                  ;	  Otherwise, version message is displayed.
 18061                                  ;	  If /debug is specified, additional DOS info is displayed.
 18062                                  
 18063                                  	; 21/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 18064                                  VERSION:
 18065                                  	;assume	ds:TRANGROUP,es:TRANGROUP
 18066                                  
 18067                                  ;	Parse command line for /debug switch.
 18068                                  
 18069 00001D19 BE8100                  	mov	si,81h			; DS:SI = ptr to command tail
 18070 00001D1C BF[E785]                	mov	di,PARSE_VER		; ES:DI = ptr to parse block
 18071 00001D1F 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; CX = # positional param's found
 18072 00001D21 E89E04                  	call	Parse_With_Msg
 18073                                  
 18074 00001D24 B301                    	mov	bl,1			; BL = flag = /debug present
 18075                                  	;cmp	ax,RESULT_NO_ERROR
 18076                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 18077                                  	;je	short verPrintVer	; something parsed - must be /debug
 18078 00001D26 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 18079 00001D28 740A                    	jz	short verPrintVer 
 18080 00001D2A FECB                    	dec	bl			; BL = flag = no /debug present
 18081                                  	;cmp	ax,END_OF_LINE ; -1
 18082 00001D2C 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,-1 ; 0FFFFh
 18083 00001D2F 7403                    	je	short verPrintVer	; reached end of line - ok
 18084                                  
 18085                                  ;	The parse failed. Error message has been set up.
 18086                                  
 18087 00001D31 E92A0C                  	jmp	cerror
 18088                                  
 18089                                  verPrintVer:
 18090 00001D34 53                      	push	bx			; save /debug flag
 18091 00001D35 E8A508                  	call	CRLF2
 18092 00001D38 E83F00                  	call	PRINT_VERSION
 18093 00001D3B E89F08                  	call	CRLF2
 18094 00001D3E 5B                      	pop	bx   			; BL = /debug flag
 18095 00001D3F 08DB                    	or	bl,bl
 18096 00001D41 7434                    	jz	short verDone		; /debug is false - we're done
 18097                                  
 18098                                  ;*	For /debug, display DOS internal revision and DOS location
 18099                                  ;	(low memory, HMA, or ROM).
 18100                                  
 18101                                  ;	Bugbug:	use symbols for bitmasks below.
 18102                                  
 18103                                  	;mov	ax,(Set_CTRL_C_Trapping shl 8) + 6 ; M013
 18104 00001D43 B80633                  	mov	ax,3306h
 18105 00001D46 CD21                    	int	21h
 18106                                  		; DOS - 5+ Get TRUE Version Number
 18107                                  		; (BL major, BH minor, DL revision, DH flags)
 18108 00001D48 88D0                    	mov	al,dl			;revision number in dl; M013
 18109 00001D4A 88F7                    	mov	bh,dh			;flags in dh now; M013
 18110                                  ;M032	and	al,7			; AL = DOS internal revision
 18111 00001D4C 3C19                    	cmp	al,'Z'-'A' ; 25	 ;M032	; revision in A-to-Z range?
 18112                                  	;jbe	short @f	 ;M032	; A-to-Z revision ok
 18113 00001D4E 7602                    	jbe	short ver1
 18114 00001D50 B0E9                    	mov	al,'*'-'A' ; -23 ;M032	; beyond Z, just say revision *
 18115                                  ;@@:
 18116                                  ver1:
 18117 00001D52 0441                    	add	al,'A' ; 41h		; AL = DOS internal rev letter
 18118 00001D54 A2[BF8C]                	mov	[One_Char_Val],al
 18119 00001D57 BA[A581]                	mov	dx,dosrev_ptr
 18120 00001D5A E8C630                  	call	std_printf		; print DOS internal revision
 18121                                  
 18122 00001D5D B104                    	mov	cl,4
 18123 00001D5F D2EF                    	shr	bh,cl			; CY = DOS in ROM
 18124 00001D61 7209                    	jc	short verRom
 18125 00001D63 D0EF                    	shr	bh,1			; CY = DOS in HMA
 18126 00001D65 720A                    	jc	short verHma
 18127                                  
 18128                                  ;	DOS isn't in ROM or HMA, so it must be in lower memory.
 18129                                  
 18130                                  	;mov	dx,offset TRANGROUP:DosLow_Ptr
 18131 00001D67 BA[B981]                	mov	dx,DosLow_Ptr
 18132 00001D6A EB08                    	jmp	short verPrintLoc
 18133                                  verRom: 
 18134                                  	;mov	dx,offset TRANGROUP:DosRom_Ptr
 18135 00001D6C BA[B381]                	mov	dx,DosRom_Ptr
 18136 00001D6F EB03                    	jmp	short verPrintLoc
 18137                                  verHma:

 18139 00001D71 BA[B681]                	mov	dx,DosHma_Ptr
 18140                                  verPrintLoc:

 18142                                  verDone:

 18159                                  			; Return: AL = major version number (00h for DOS 1.x)
 18160 00001D7E 50                      	push	ax

 18213 00001DC0 803F00                  	cmp	byte [bx],0

 18344                                  build_dir_for_prompt:

 18583                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 CLS

 18585                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 Clear the screen using INT 10h. If ANSI.SYS is

 18624 00001F36 720A                    	jc	short no_variable	;AN000; function had error, use default
 18625                                  		; 21/02/2023
 18626                                  		; ds:dx = parameter block
 18627                                  		; --- https://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-44-c.html ---
 18628                                  		; offset 00h  byte  level (0 for DOS 4.0)
 18629                                  		;   	 01h  byte  reserved
 18630                                  		;   	 02h  word  length of following data
 18631                                  		;   	 04h  word  control flags
 18632                                  		;	       bit 0 set for blink, clear for intensity
 18633                                  		;	       bits 1 to 15 reserved
 18634                                  		;   	 06h  byte  mode type (1=text, 2=graphics)
 18635                                  		;   	 07h  byte  reserved
 18636                                  		;   	 08h  word  colors; 0=monochrome, n=bits per pixel
 18637                                  		;   	 0Ah  word  pixel columns
 18638                                  		;   	 0Ch  word  pixel rows
 18639                                  		;   	 0Eh  word  character columns
 18640                                  		;   	 10h  word  character rows
 18641                                  	
 18642                                  	;mov	ax,[LinPerPag] ; [Display_Ioctl+10h]
 18643                                  	;				;AN000; get number of rows returned
 18644                                  	;mov	dh,al			;AN000; set number of rows

 18698                                  
 18699                                  ;M01 - INT 10 Function 0F doesn't reliably return the number of rows on some
 18700                                  ;M01   adaptors. We circumvent this by reaching directly into the BIOS data
 18701                                  ;M01   area
 18702                                  ;M01   Commented out code here is the original

 18750                                  			; AL = interrupt number
 18751                                  			; Return: ES:BX	= value	of interrupt vector
 18752                                  	mov	dx,es
 18753                                  	mov	ax,(GET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR<<8)|20h ; 3520h
 18754                                  	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - GET INTERRUPT VECTOR
 18755                                  			; AL = interrupt number
 18756                                  			; Return: ES:BX	= value	of interrupt vector

 18759                                  	ja	short ANSICLS
 18760                                  
 18761                                  	mov	ah,0Fh
 18762                                  	int	10h	; - VIDEO - GET	CURRENT	VIDEO MODE
 18763                                  			; Return: AH = number of columns on screen
 18764                                  			; AL = current video mode
 18765                                  			; BH = current active display page
 18766                                  	cmp	al,3
 18767                                  	jbe	short DOALPHA
 18768                                  	cmp	al,7
 18769                                  	jz	short DOALPHA
 18770                                  	mov	ah,0
 18771                                  	int	10h	; - VIDEO - SET	VIDEO MODE
 18772                                  			; AL = mode
 18773                                  	retn
 18774                                  
 18775                                  DOALPHA:
 18776                                  	mov	ah,0Bh	; Set overscan to black
 18777                                  	xor	bx,bx
 18778                                  	int	10h	; - VIDEO - SET	COLOR PALETTE
 18779                                  			; BH = 00h, BL = border color
 18780                                  			; BH = 01h, BL = palette (0-3)
 18781                                  	mov	ah,0Fh
 18782                                  	int	10h	; - VIDEO - GET	CURRENT	VIDEO MODE
 18783                                  			; Return: AH = number of columns on screen
 18784                                  			; AL = current video mode
 18785                                  			; BH = current active display page
 18786                                  	mov	dl,ah
 18787                                  	dec	dl
 18788                                  	mov	dh,24
 18789                                  	xor	ax,ax
 18790                                  	mov	cx,ax
 18791                                  	mov	bx,700h
 18792                                  	mov	ah,6
 18793                                  	int	10h	; - VIDEO - SCROLL PAGE	UP
 18794                                  			; AL = number of lines to scroll window	
 18795                                  			;	(0 = blank whole window)
 18796                                  			; BH = attributes to be	used on	blanked	lines
 18797                                  			; CH,CL	= row,column of	upper left corner of window 
 18798                                  			;	  to scroll
 18799                                  			; DH,DL	= row,column of	lower right corner of window
 18800                                  	xor	dx,dx
 18801                                  	mov	bh,0
 18802                                  	mov	ah,2
 18803                                  	int	10h	; - VIDEO - SET	CURSOR POSITION
 18804                                  			; DH,DL	= row,column (0,0 = upper left)
 18805                                  			; BH = page number
 18806                                  	retn
 18807                                  
 18808                                  ANSICLS:
 18809                                  	mov	si,CLSSTRING
 18810                                  	lodsb
 18811                                  	mov	cl,al
 18812                                  	xor	ch,ch
 18813                                  	mov	ah,RAW_CON_IO ; 6
 18814                                  CLRLOOP:
 18815                                  	lodsb
 18816                                  	mov	dl,al
 18817                                  	int	21h	; DOS -	DIRECT CONSOLE I/O CHARACTER OUTPUT
 18818                                  			; DL = character <> FFh
 18819                                  			;  Return: ZF set = no character
 18820                                  			;   ZF clear = character recieved, AL = character
 18821                                  	loop	CLRLOOP
 18822                                  	retn
 18823                                  %endif

 19098                                  ;****************************************************************
 19099                                  ;*
 19100                                  ;* ROUTINE:	CHCP - Change code page internal command
 19101                                  ;*		(added DOS 3.30 07/21/86)
 19102                                  ;*
 19103                                  ;* SYNTAX:	CHCP [xxx]
 19104                                  ;*		where xxx is a valid code page
 19105                                  ;*
 19106                                  ;* FUNCTION:	If xxx is specified, CHCP will use INT 21H function
 19107                                  ;*		6402H to set the code page to xxxx. If no parameters
 19108                                  ;*		are specified, CHCP will use INT 21H function 6401H
 19109                                  ;*		to get global code page and display it to the user.
 19110                                  ;*
 19111                                  ;* INPUT:	command line at offset 81H
 19112                                  ;*
 19113                                  ;* OUTPUT:	none

 19118                                  set_global_cp	  equ  2

 19309                                  ; *		 Parses the command line. If a path is found, set

 19534                                  ; ****************************************************************
 19535                                  ; *
 19536                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 PARSE_CHECK_EOL
 19537                                  ; *
 19538                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 Calls parser to see if end of line occurred.
 19539                                  ; *		 If not end of line, set up to print parse
 19540                                  ; *		 error message. ASSUMES NO MORE PARAMETERS ARE
 19541                                  ; *		 EXPECTED!
 19542                                  ; *
 19543                                  ; * INPUT:	 DS:SI	  last output from parser
 19544                                  ; *		 ES:DI	  points to parse block
 19545                                  ; *		 CX	  last output from parser
 19546                                  ; *
 19547                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 AX	  parser return code
 19548                                  ; *
 19549                                  ; *		 if end of line found
 19550                                  ; *		     zero flag set
 19551                                  ; *		 else
 19552                                  ; *		     MSG_DISPLAY_CLASS set to parse error
 19553                                  ; *
 19554                                  ; ****************************************************************
 19555                                  
 19556                                  	; 23/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 19557                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:2270h
 19558                                  
 19559                                  parse_check_eol:
 19560 000021AC 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000;
 19561 000021AE 8936[288C]              	mov	[parse_last],si 	;AN018; save start of parameter
 19562 000021B2 E89B21                  	call	cmd_parse		;AN000; call parser
 19563 000021B5 3CFF                    	cmp	al,-1  ;0FFh
 19564                                  	;cmp	al,END_OF_LINE	; 0FFh	;AN000; Are we at end of line?
 19565 000021B7 7408                    	je	short parse_good_eol	;AN000; yes - no problem
 19566                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 19567                                  	;cmp	ax,RESULT_NO_ERROR	;AN018; was any error found?
 19568 000021B9 21C0                    	and	ax,ax ; ax = 0 ?
 19569 000021BB 7501                    	jnz	short ok_to_setup_pmsg	;AN018; yes - continue
 19570 000021BD 40                      	inc	ax			;AN018; set AX to 1 and turn off zero flag
 19571                                  ok_to_setup_pmsg:
 19572 000021BE E81000                  	call	setup_parse_error_msg	;AN018; go set up error message
 19573                                  parse_good_eol:
 19574                                  parse_msg_good:	; 23/02/2023
 19575 000021C1 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 19589                                  ; *		 CX	  last output from parser

 19592                                  ; *

 19594                                  ; *		     outputs from parser
 19595                                  ; *		 else

 19597                                  ; *		     error message set up for STD_PRINTF

 19599                                  ; ****************************************************************

 19896                                  ;string is deleted and we have an invalid empty environment with only a 
 19897                                  ;single null. To avoid this, we will look for the double null case and then
 19898                                  ;move an extra null char.

 20143                                  
 20144                                  ; ****************************************************************
 20145                                  ; *
 20146                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 UPCONV     (ADDED BY EMG 4.00)
 20147                                  ; *
 20148                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 This routine returns the upper case equivalent of
 20149                                  ; *		 the character in AL from the file upper case table
 20150                                  ; *		 in DOS if character if above  ascii 128, else
 20151                                  ; *		 subtracts 20H if between "a" and "z".
 20152                                  ; *
 20153                                  ; * INPUT:	 AL	      char to be upper cased
 20154                                  ; *		 FUCASE_ADDR  set to the file upper case table
 20155                                  ; *
 20156                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 AL	      upper cased character
 20157                                  ; *
 20158                                  ; ****************************************************************
 20159                                  
 20160                                  	; 24/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 20161                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:24C4h
 20162                                  UPCONV:
 20163 000023F2 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			;AN000;  see if char is > ascii 128
 20164 000023F4 7213                    	jb	short oth_fucase	;AN000;  no - upper case math
 20165 000023F6 2C80                    	sub	al,80h			;AN000;  only upper 128 chars in table
 20166 000023F8 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 20167 000023F9 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 20168 000023FA 8E1E[C08A]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]		;AN000;  get resident data segment
 20169                                  	;lds	bx,dword ptr FUCase_Addr+1
 20170 000023FE C51E[B701]              	lds	bx,[FUCase_Addr+1]	;AN000;  get table address

 20349                                  ; ****************************************************************
 20350                                  ; *
 20351                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 $CHDIR
 20352                                  ; *
 20353                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 Entry point for CHDIR command. Parse the command
 20354                                  ; *		 line. If path is found, CHDIR to path. If a drive
 20355                                  ; *		 letter is found, get and display the current dir
 20356                                  ; *		 of the specified drive. If nothing is found, get
 20357                                  ; *		 and display the current dir of the default drive.
 20358                                  ; *
 20359                                  ; * INPUT:	 command line at offset 81H
 20360                                  ; *
 20361                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 none
 20362                                  ; *
 20363                                  ; ****************************************************************
 20364

 20372 000024AB 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		;AN000;

 20374

 20376                                  	;cmp	ax,END_OF_LINE	;AC000; are we at end of line?
 20377 000024B3 7415                    	je	short bwdj	; No args
 20378                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 20379                                  	;cmp	ax,RESULT_NO_ERROR
 20380                                  				;AC000; did we have an error?
 20381 000024B5 09C0                    	or	ax,ax ; ax = 0 ?

 20383                                  	
 20384                                  	;cmp	byte [PARSE1_TYPE],6
 20385 000024B9 803E[EF95]06            	cmp	byte [PARSE1_TYPE],result_drive
 20386                                  				;AC000; was a drive entered?
 20387 000024BE 7511                    	jne	short REALCD	; no
 20388

 20390

 20392                                  				;AC000; get address of parse_chdir

 20630                                  ;*
 20631                                  ;* ROUTINE:	SETRMMK
 20632                                  ;*
 20633                                  ;* FUNCTION:	Parse routine for the internal MKDIR and RMDIR
 20634                                  ;*		commands. Parses the command line for a required
 20635                                  ;*		filespec.
 20636                                  ;*
 20637                                  ;* INPUT:	command line at offset 81H
 20638                                  ;*
 20639                                  ;* OUTPUT:	carry clear
 20640                                  ;*		    DS:DX points to ASCIIZ argument
 20641                                  ;*		carry set
 20642                                  ;*		    DS:DX has error message pointer
 20643                                  ;*
 20644                                  ;****************************************************************
 20645                                  
 20646                                  	; 24/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1)
 20647                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:2624h
 20648                                  SETRMMK:
 20649                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 20650 00002571 BE8100                  	mov	si,81h
 20651 00002574 BF[4185]                	mov	di,PARSE_MRDIR 	;AN000; Get address of PARSE_MRDIR

 20758                                  
 20759                                  ; SavUDir - move the user's current directory on a drive into UserDir1
 20760                                  ; SavUDir1 - move the user's current directory on a drive into a specified
 20761                                  ;   buffer
 20762                                  ;
 20763                                  ;   Inputs:	DL has 1-based drive number
 20764                                  ;		ES:DI has destination buffer (SavUDir1 only)
 20765                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Clear
 20766                                  ;		    DS = TranGroup
 20767                                  ;		Carry Set
 20768                                  ;		    AX has error code
 20769                                  ;   Registers Modified: AX, SI
 20770

 20970                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 20971                                  
 20972                                  ; PATHCRUNCH -
 20973                                  ;
 20974                                  ; ENTRY FCB (in PSP) contains drive # to crunch on
 20975                                  ;       PathPos = ptr to string with pathname in it
 20976                                  ;       PathCnt = length of string
 20977                                  ;
 20978                                  ; EXIT  PathPos = ptr after pathname (w/ NULL) in string
 20979                                  ;       PathCnt = length left in string
 20980                                  ;       DestIsDir = nonzero if pathname delimiter char's found in pathname
 20981                                  ;       DestInfo<bit1> = set if wildcard char's found in pathname
 20982                                  ;       If path crunched successfully,
 20983                                  ;         CY = clear
 20984                                  ;         Current directory is changed to directory in pathname
 20985                                  ;         UserDir1 contains previous directory for use by RestUDir
 20986                                  ;         RestDir = nonzero to flag later restoration of user's dir
 20987                                  ;         DestTail = ptr to beginning of filename
 20988                                  ;         If filename found in pathname,
 20989                                  ;           ZR = clear
 20990                                  ;           FCB filename fields contain filename
 20991                                  ;         If filename not found (pure directory path),
 20992                                  ;           ZR = set
 20993                                  ;           FCB filename fields are wildcarded with ?'s
 20994                                  ;       If pathcrunch failed (no ChDir's worked),
 20995                                  ;         CY = set
 20996                                  ;         Msg_Numb = extended error code
 20997                                  ;
 20998                                  ; NOTE  DIR asks PathCrunch to forego parsing the filename into the
 20999                                  ;       FCB by setting DirFlag. In this case, the FCB is returned
 21000                                  ;       with the filename wildcarded.
 21001                                  
 21002                                  	; 25/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1)
 21003                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:2767h
 21004                                  
 21005                                  PathCrunch:
 21006                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21007 00002686 C706[338E]0000          	mov     word [Msg_Numb],0
 21008                                  				;AN022; Set up message flag
 21009                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 21010                                  	;mov	dl,[5Ch]
 21011 0000268C 8A165C00                	mov	dl,[FCB]	; DL = drive # (1 = A)
 21012 00002690 E824FF                  	call	SAVUDIR		; save current directory in UserDir1
 21013                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21014 00002693 7233                     	jc	short pcrunch_cderrj
 21015                                  				;AN022; if error on current dir - report
 21016 00002695 E86004                  	call	SETPATH		; scan past switches, whitespace
 21017                                  
 21018                                  ;       DX = ptr to pathname, NULL-terminated
 21019                                  ;       PathPos = ptr to byte after NULL at end of pathname
 21020                                  
 21021                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 21022 00002698 F606[CB8C]02            	test	byte [DestInfo],2 ; test if wildcards (? or *) seen
 21023 0000269D 752C                    	jnz	short trypeel	; wildcard seen, peel filename
 21024                                  
 21025                                  	;mov	ah,CHDir ; 3Bh
 21026 0000269F B43B                    	mov	ah,3Bh
 21027 000026A1 CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - CHANGE THE	CURRENT	DIRECTORY (CHDIR)
 21028                                  			; DS:DX	-> ASCIZ directory name	(may include drive)
 21029                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21030 000026A3 7313                    	jnc	short chdir_worked	;AN022; no error - continue
 21031                                  	
 21032 000026A5 E85AF6                  	call	get_ext_error_number    ;AN022; get the extended error
 21033 000026A8 83F803                  	cmp	ax,ERROR_PATH_NOT_FOUND ;AN022; if path not found
 21034 000026AB 741E                    	je	short trypeel		;AC022;    keep trying
 21035 000026AD 83F805                  	cmp	ax,ERROR_ACCESS_DENIED  ;AN022; if access denied
 21036 000026B0 7419                    	je	short trypeel		;AC022;    keep trying
 21037 000026B2 A3[338E]                	mov	[Msg_Numb],ax           ;AN022; set up message flag
 21038 000026B5 E99C00                  	jmp	peelfail                ;AN022; exit with other error
 21039                                  
 21040                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 21041                                  	;jc	short trypeel
 21042                                  chdir_worked:
 21043                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 21044 000026B8 E83B06                  	call	SetRest1	; set 'Restore Directory' flag true
 21045 000026BB B03F                    	mov	al,'?'		; if pure dir, wildcard filename in FCB
 21046 000026BD BF5D00                  	mov	di,5Dh  ; FCB+1
 21047 000026C0 B90B00                  	mov	cx,11
 21048 000026C3 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 21049 000026C5 30C0                    	xor	al,al		; return carry clear, zero set
 21050 000026C7 C3                      	retn
 21051                                  
 21052                                  pcrunch_cderrj: 		;AN022; need this for long jmp
 21053 000026C8 E98100                  	jmp	pcrunch_cderr	;AN022;
 21054                                  
 21055                                  trypeel:
 21056 000026CB 8B36[1F8C]              	mov	si,[PathPos]
 21057 000026CF 4E                      	dec	si		; SI = ptr to NULL at end of pathname
 21058 000026D0 8A44FF                  	mov	al,[si-1]	; AL = last char of pathname
 21059                                  	; 25/02/2023
 21060                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 (& 6.0)
 21061 000026D3 803E[4E8E]00            	cmp	byte [KPARSE],0
 21062 000026D8 7505                    	jnz	short delstrt	; Last char is 2nd KANJI byte, might be '\'
 21063                                  	
 21064 000026DA E89BFF                  	call	pathchrcmp
 21065 000026DD 7475                    	jz	short peelfail	; Trailing '/'
 21066                                  delstrt:
 21067 000026DF 89F1                    	mov	cx,si		; CX = ptr to NULL at end of pathname
 21068 000026E1 89D6                    	mov	si,dx		; SI = ptr to start of pathname
 21069 000026E3 52                      	push	dx		; save ptr to pathname
 21070                                  delloop:
 21071 000026E4 39CE                    	cmp	si,cx
 21072                                  	;jz	short BADRET
 21073                                  	; 25/02/2023
 21074 000026E6 7413                    	je	short gotdele	; no char's left, we have what we have
 21075 000026E8 AC                      	lodsb			; AL = next char of pathname
 21076 000026E9 E8DCFC                  	call	testkanj
 21077 000026EC 7403                    	jz	short notkanj8	; not Kanji, move along
 21078 000026EE 46                      	inc	si
 21079 000026EF EBF3                    	jmp	short delloop	
 21080                                  
 21081                                  	; 25/02/2023
 21082                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 21083                                  	;mov	al,[si]
 21084                                  	;call	PATHCHRCMP
 21085                                  	;jz	short TRYCD
 21086                                  	;dec	si
 21087                                  	;jmp	short delloop
 21088                                  
 21089                                  notkanj8:
 21090 000026F1 E884FF                  	call	pathchrcmp
 21091 000026F4 75EE                    	jnz	short delloop	; not a path delimiter, keep looking
 21092 000026F6 89F2                    	mov	dx,si
 21093 000026F8 4A                      	dec	dx		; DX = ptr to last delimiter found	
 21094 000026F9 EBE9                    	jmp	short delloop	; go look for more
 21095                                  
 21096                                  	; 25/02/2023
 21097                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 (& 6.0)
 21098                                  gotdele:
 21099 000026FB 89D6                    	mov	si,dx		; SI = ptr to pathname or last delim
 21100 000026FD 5A                      	pop	dx		; DX = ptr to pathname
 21101 000026FE 39D6                    	cmp	si,dx
 21102 00002700 7454                    	je	short badret	; didn't find path delim
 21103 00002702 89F1                    	mov	cx,si		; CX = ptr to last path delimiter
 21104 00002704 89D6                    	mov	si,dx		; SI = ptr to pathname
 21105                                  delloop2:			; Set value of KPARSE
 21106 00002706 39CE                    	cmp	si,cx
 21107 00002708 7412                    	je	short trycd	; roll up till SI meets CX
 21108 0000270A C606[4E8E]00            	mov	byte [KPARSE],0
 21109 0000270F AC                      	lodsb
 21110 00002710 E8B5FC                  	call	testkanj
 21111 00002713 74F1                    	jz	short delloop2
 21112 00002715 46                      	inc	si
 21113 00002716 FE06[4E8E]              	inc	byte [KPARSE]
 21114 0000271A EBEA                    	jmp	short delloop2
 21115                                  
 21116                                  trycd:
 21117 0000271C 50                      	push	ax
 21118                                  	; 25/02/2023
 21119 0000271D B02E                    	mov	al,'.'
 21120                                  	;mov	al,[DOT_CHR]	; AL = '.'
 21121                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21122 0000271F 384401                  	cmp	[si+1],al	; check for '.' after path delim
 21123                                  				;M019; allow continuation if '. ' or 
 21124                                  				;M019; '..' is not found.

 21254                                  	; 25/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 COMMAND.COM
 21255                                  SWITCH:
 21256 00002788 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; Initialize - no switches set
 21257                                  SWLOOP:
 21258 0000278A E85DFE                  	call	scanoff		; Skip any delimiters
 21259 0000278D 3A06[C48A]              	cmp	al,[SWITCHAR]	; Is it a switch specifier?
 21260 00002791 75F3                    	jnz	short RETSW	; No -- we're finished
 21261 00002793 81CB0080                	or	bx,8000h
 21262                                  	;or	bx,FSWITCH	; Indicate there is a switch specified
 21263 00002797 46                      	inc	si		; Skip over the switch character
 21264 00002798 E84FFE                  	call	scanoff
 21265 0000279B 3C0D                    	cmp	al,0Dh
 21266 0000279D 74E7                    	je	short RETSW	; Oops
 21267 0000279F 46                      	inc	si
 21268                                  
 21269                                  	; Convert lower case input to upper case
 21270                                  
 21271 000027A0 E84FFC                  	call	UPCONV
 21272                                  	;call	UPCONV_MAPCALL	; MSDOS 3.3
 21273                                  
 21274 000027A3 BF[8B84]                	mov	di,switch_list	; "?VBAPW" (for MSDOS 6.0)
 21275                                  				; ("VBAPW" (for MSDOS 3.3))
 21276 000027A6 B90600                  	mov	cx,6  ; MSDOS 6.0
 21277                                  	;mov	cx,5  ; MSDOS 3.3
 21278                                  	;mov	cx,SWCOUNT ; 5 (for MSDOS 3.3), (6 (for MSDOS 6.0))
 21279                                  		
 21280                                  	;nop
 21281                                  		
 21282 000027A9 F2AE                    	repne	scasb		; Look for matching switch
 21283 000027AB 7507                    	jnz	short BADSW
 21284 000027AD B80100                  	mov	ax,1
 21285 000027B0 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; Set a bit for the switch
 21286 000027B2 09C3                    	or	bx,ax

 21293                                  ;	jmp	cerror

 21296                                  FNDCOM:				; search the internal command table
 21297 000027B9 08C0                    	or	al,al		; Get real length of first arg

 21299                                  				;  to be external.
 21300                                  ; barryf code starts here
 21301

 21305                                  APPEND_INTERNAL:
 21306 000027C2 8A0E[4A8B]              	mov	cl,[IDLEN]
 21307 000027C6 B500                    	mov	ch,0
 21308 000027C8 890E[1F8C]              	mov	[PathPos],cx
 21309                                  	
 21310                                  	; 25/02/2023	
 21311                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21312 000027CC FE06[358E]              	inc 	byte [append_exec]
 21313                                  				;AN041; set APPEND to ON
 21314 000027D0 E8BD03                  	call	IOSET		; re-direct the o'l io
 21315                                  
 21316 000027D3 BE[4A8B]                	mov	si,IDLEN	; address command name, DS already set	
 21317 000027D6 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,-1 ; 0FFFFh	; set invoke function
 21318                                  		
 21319                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21320 000027D9 BF[0D4E]                	mov	di,append_parse
 21321                                  				;AN010; Get the entry point for PARSE for APPEND
 21322                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 21323 000027DC B801AE                  	mov	ax,0AE01h
 21324 000027DF CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; - Multiplex -	DOS 3.3+ internal
 21325                                  			; - INSTALLABLE	COMMAND	- EXECUTE
 21326                                  			; DX = FFFFh, DS:SI -> buffer
 21327                                  			; Return: buffer at DS:SI filled with a	length byte
 21328                                  			; followed by the uppercase internal command
 21329                                  			; to execute (if length not 0)
 21330                                  	; 25/02/2023
 21331                                  	; INT 2Fh
 21332                                  	; 	AX = AE01h
 21333                                  	; entry:
 21334                                  	; 	DX = magic value FFFFh
 21335                                  	; 	CH = 00h
 21336                                  	; 	CL = length of command name
 21337                                  	; 	DS:BX -> command line buffer  -- (offset COMBUF)
 21338                                  	; 	DS:SI -> command name buffer  -- (offset IDLEN)
 21339                                  	; return:
 21340                                  	;	DS:SI buffer updated
 21341                                  	;	if length byte is nonzero, the following bytes contain
 21342                                  	;	the uppercase internal command to execute and the command line
 21343                                  	; 	buffer contains the command's parameters
 21344                                  	;	(the first DS:[SI] bytes are ignored)
 21345                                  	;
 21346                                  	; Format of COMMAND.COM command line buffer:
 21347                                  	;	Offset  Size    Description
 21348                                  	;	00h     BYTE    max length of command line, as in INT 21/AH=0Ah
 21349                                  	;	01h     BYTE    count of bytes to follow, excluding terminating 0Dh
 21350                                  	;	N BYTEs command line text, terminated by 0Dh
 21351                                  	;
 21352                                  	; Format of command name buffer:
 21353                                  	;	Offset  Size    Description
 21354                                  	;	00h     BYTE    length of command name
 21355                                  	;	01h    N BYTEs  uppercased command name (blank-padded to 11 chars)
 21356                                  
 21357 000027E1 803E[4A8B]00            	cmp	byte [IDLEN],0 ; execute requested
 21358 000027E6 7503                    	jne	short CONTCOM
 21359 000027E8 E9A300                  	jmp	CMD_DONE
 21360                                  
 21361                                  	;nop
 21362                                  CONTCOM:			; continue with internal scan
 21363 000027EB BF[0A83]                	mov	di,COMTAB
 21364 000027EE 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21365                                  FINDCOM:
 21366 000027F0 BE[4B8B]                	mov	si,ID		; pointer to command argument
 21367 000027F3 8A0D                    	mov	cl,[di]		; load length of internal command
 21368 000027F5 47                      	inc	di		; advance past length
 21369 000027F6 E3BE                    	jcxz	EXTERNALJ 	; if it's zero, we're out of internals
 21370 000027F8 3A0E[4A8B]              	cmp	cl,[IDLEN]	; that of the command argument
 21371 000027FC 7506                    	jne	short ABCD	; lengths not equal ==> strings not eq
 21372 000027FE 890E[1F8C]              	mov	[PathPos],cx	; store length of command
 21373 00002802 F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb
 21374                                  ABCD:					
 21375 00002804 9F                      	lahf			; save the good ol' flags

 21377 00002807 8A05                    	mov	al,[di]		; load drive-check indicator byte (DCIB)
 21378 00002809 A2[D28A]                	mov	[CHKDRV],al	; save command flag byte in chkdrv
 21379 0000280C 47                      	inc	di		; increment DI (OK, OK, I'll stop)
 21380 0000280D 8B1D                    	mov	bx,[di]		; load internal command address
 21381 0000280F 47                      	inc	di		; skip over the puppy
 21382 00002810 47                      	inc	di
 21383                                  		
 21384                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 21385 00002811 8B15                    	mov	dx,[di]		; load ptr to help msg #s

 21389 00002816 75D8                    	jnz	short FINDCOM	; well, if all the cmps worked...

 21398

 21400

 21402                                  ; respond to /? only if it is the only command-line argument.

 21415

 21418                                  				; /? not only arg - ignore
 21419                                  
 21420                                  ; Note: this is all the check we need, even against things like /??.
 21421                                  ; Our argv parser breaks /?? into two args, /? and ?.

 21425

 21604                                  EXECUTE:
 21605                                  NEOEXECUTE:
 21606 00002908 E88502                  	call	IOSET
 21607                                  
 21608                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 21609                                  ;M051
 21610                                  ; Previously LoadHigh was jumping to the execute label above. This was wrong
 21611                                  ;because IOSET was getting invoked twice resulting in 2 sets of redirections.
 21612                                  ;After a close, this would still leave one open active resulting in sharing
 21613                                  ;errors on subsequent opens of the redirected file.
 21614                                  
 21615                                  LH_EXECUTE:			;M051	
 21616 0000290B 8E06[D08A]              	mov	es,[TRAN_TPA]
 21617                                  	;mov	ah,DEALLOC ; 49h
 21618 0000290F B449                    	mov	ah,49h
 21619 00002911 CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - FREE MEMORY
 21620                                  			; ES = segment address of area to be freed
 21621                                  				; Now running in "free" space

 21626                                  				; this flag value for re-entry to COMMAND
 21627                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 21633 0000292C F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; copy program pathname to resident
 21634

 21636 0000292E BF5C00                  	mov	di,FCB ; 5Ch
 21637 00002931 89FE                    	mov	si,di
 21638                                  	;mov	cx,82 ; 52h	; moving (100h-5Ch)/2 = 80h-2Eh

 21640 00002935 F3A5                    	rep	movsw		; Transfer parameters to resident header
 21641                                  	
 21642                                  	; 25/02/2023
 21643                                  	;mov	dx,EXECPATH  ; MSDOS 3.3
 21644                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& 5.0)

 21659                                  OK_EXEC:

 21685                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 21686                                  
 21687                                  ; Prescan converts the input buffer into a canonicalized form.
 21688                                  ; All redirections and pipes are removed.
 21689                                  
 21690                                  	; 26/02/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 21691                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:2A51h
 21692                                  
 21693                                  PRESCAN:
 21694 00002964 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21695 00002966 8E06[C08A]              	mov	es,[RESSEG]
 21696 0000296A BE[2189]                	mov	si,COMBUF+2
 21697 0000296D 89F7                    	mov	di,si
 21698                                  COUNTQUOTES:
 21699 0000296F AC                      	lodsb			; get a byte
 21700 00002970 3C22                    	cmp	al,22h	; '"'	; is it a quote?
 21701 00002972 7504                    	jne	short COUNTEND	; no, try for end of road
 21702 00002974 FEC5                    	inc	ch		; bump count
 21703 00002976 EBF7                    	jmp	short COUNTQUOTES
 21704                                  				; go get next char
 21705                                  COUNTEND:
 21706 00002978 3C0D                    	cmp	al,0Dh	; 13	; end of road?
 21707 0000297A 75F3                    	jne	short COUNTQUOTES
 21708                                  				; no, go back for next char
 21709                                  	; 26/02/2023
 21710                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 (& 6.0)
 21711 0000297C 51                      	push	cx		; save count
 21712 0000297D 89FE                    	mov	si,di		; restore pointer to begining
 21713                                  KanjiScan:
 21714 0000297F AC                      	lodsb			; get a byte
 21715 00002980 E845FA                  	call	testkanj	; is it a leadin byte
 21716 00002983 740F                    	jz	short KanjiQuote
 21717                                  				; no, check for quotes
 21718 00002985 88C4                    	mov	ah,al		; save leadin
 21719 00002987 AC                      	lodsb			; get trailing byte
 21720 00002988 3D2020                  	cmp	ax,2020h
 21721                                  	;cmp	ax,DB_SPACE	; is it Kanji space
 21722 0000298B 75F2                    	jne	short KanjiScan	; no, go get next
 21723 0000298D C744FE2020              	mov	word [si-2],2020h
 21724                                  				; replace with spaces
 21725 00002992 EBEB                    	jmp	short KanjiScan	; go get next char
 21726                                  	
 21727                                  KanjiQuote:
 21728 00002994 3C22                    	cmp	al,22h	; '"'	; beginning of quoted string
 21729 00002996 750D                    	jne	short KanjiEnd	; no, check for end
 21730 00002998 FECD                    	dec	ch		; drop count
 21731 0000299A 74E3                    	jz	short KanjiScan	; if count is zero, no quoting
 21732                                  KanjiQuoteLoop:

 21734 0000299D 3C22                    	cmp	al,22h	; '"'	; is it another quote
 21735 0000299F 75FB                    	jne	short KanjiQuoteLoop
 21736                                  				; no, get another
 21737 000029A1 FECD                    	dec	ch		; yes, drop count
 21738 000029A3 EBDA                    	jmp	short KanjiScan	; go get next char
 21739                                  KanjiEnd:
 21740 000029A5 3C0D                    	cmp	al,13 ; 0Dh	; end of line character?
 21741 000029A7 75D6                    	jne	short KanjiScan	; go back to beginning
 21742 000029A9 59                      	pop	cx		; get back original count
 21743                                  	; 26/04/2023
 21744 000029AA 89FE                    	mov	si,di		; restore pointer to beginning
 21745                                  	
 21746                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 21747                                  PRESCANLP:
 21748 000029AC AC                      	lodsb
 21749                                  	; 26/02/2023
