 24039                                  ;============================================================================
 24040                                  ; PARSE2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 24041                                  ;============================================================================
 24042                                  ; 03/10/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 24043                                  
 24044                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24045                                  ; PARSELINE takes an MSDOS command line and maps it into a UNIX-style
 24046                                  ; argv[argvcnt] array. The most important difference between this array and
 24047                                  ; the tradition UNIX format is the extra cparse information included with
 24048                                  ; each argument element.
 24049                                  ;---------------
 24050                                  ; ENTRY:
 24051                                  ;	BL	     special delimiter for cparse -- not implemented)
 24052                                  ;---------------
 24053                                  ; EXIT:
 24054                                  ;	CF	    set if error
 24055                                  ;	AL	    error code (carry set). Note AH clobbered in any event.
 24056                                  ;	argv[]	    array of cparse flags and pointers to arguments
 24057                                  ;	argvcnt     argument count
 24058                                  ;---------------
 24059                                  ; NOTE(S):
 24060                                  ;	*   BL (special delimiter) is ignored, for now (set to space).
 24061                                  ;	*   Parseflags record contains cparse flags, as follows:
 24062                                  ;		sw_flag 	--	was this arg a switch?
 24063                                  ;		wildcard	--	whether or not it contained a * or ?
 24064                                  ;		path_sep	--	maybe it was a pathname
 24065                                  ;		unused		--	for future expansion
 24066                                  ;		special_delim	--	was there an initial special delimiter?
 24067                                  ;	*   argv[] and argvcnt are undefined if CF/AL indicates an error.
 24068                                  ;	*   Relationship between input, cparse output, and comtail can be
 24069                                  ;	    found in the following chart. Despite the claim of the cparse
 24070                                  ;	    documentation that, "Token buffer always starts d: for non switch
 24071                                  ;	    tokens", such is not the case (see column two, row two).
 24072                                  ;	    Similarly, [STARTEL] is not null when the command line is one of
 24073                                  ;	    the forms, "d:", "d:\", or "d:/". In fact, *STARTEL (i.e., what
 24074                                  ;	    STARTEL addresses) will be null. This is clearly just a
 24075                                  ;	    documentation error.
 24076                                  ;	*   cparse also returns a switch code in BP for each switch it
 24077                                  ;	    recognizes on the command line.
 24078                                  ;	*   arglen for each token does NOT include the terminating null.
 24079                                  ;	*   Finally, note that interesting constructions like 'foodir/*.exe'
 24080                                  ;	    parse as three separate tokens, and the asterisk is NOT a wildcard.
 24081                                  ;	    For example, 'for %i in (foodir/*.exe) do echo %i' will first
 24082                                  ;	    echo 'foodir', then '*', then '.exe'. Using cparse for command-
 24083                                  ;	    line parsing may result in slightly different behavior than
 24084                                  ;	    previously observed with the old COMMAND.COM command-line parser.
 24085                                  ;
 24086                                  ;	    Input		    Cparse		Command Line (80H)
 24087                                  ;	\alan\foo.bat		c:\alan\foo.bat 	\alan\foo.bat
 24088                                  ;	alan\foo.bat		alan\foo.bat		alan\foo.bat
 24089                                  ;	foo.bat 		foo.bat 		foo.bat
 24090                                  ;	c:\alan\foo.bat 	c:\alan\foo.bat 	c:\alan\foo.bat
 24091                                  ;	c:alan\foo.bat		c:alan\foo.bat		c:alan\foo.bat
 24092                                  ;	c:foo.bat		c:foo.bat		c:foo.bat
 24093                                  
 24094                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24095                                  
 24096                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 23D0h
 24097                                  
 24098                                  ; 01/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 24099                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 319Bh
 24100                                  
 24101                                  PARSELINE:
 24102 00003056 50                      	push	ax			; most of these are clobbered
 24103 00003057 53                      	push	bx			; by cparse...
 24104 00003058 51                      	push	cx
 24105 00003059 52                      	push	dx
 24106 0000305A 57                      	push	di
 24107 0000305B 56                      	push	si
 24108 0000305C 9C                      	pushf
 24109 0000305D C606[B48C]00            	mov	byte [cpyflag],0  ; Turn "CPARSE called from COPY flag" off
 24110 00003062 C706[1594]FFFF          	mov	word [LASTARG],-1 ; last argument at which to accumulate
 24111 00003068 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 24112                                  	;mov	cx,1348
 24113 0000306A B94405                  	mov	cx,ARG_UNIT.SIZE
 24114 0000306D BF[4F8E]                	mov	di,ARG
 24115 00003070 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 24116                                  	;mov	word [ARGBUF_PTR],ARG_ARGBUF
 24117 00003072 C706[9393][1391]        	mov	word [ARGBUF_PTR],ARG+ARG_UNIT.argbuf
 24118                                  	;mov	word [ARG_ARGSWINFO],0 ; switch information, and info to date
 24119 00003078 C706[1191]0000          	mov	word [ARG+ARG_UNIT.argswinfo],0
 24120                                  	;mov	word [ARG_ARGVCNT],0 ; initialize argvcnt/argv[]
 24121 0000307E C706[0F91]0000          	mov	word [ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt],0
 24122 00003084 BE[2189]                	mov	si,COMBUF+2	; prescan leaves cooked input in combuf
 24123                                  
 24124                                  ; This next section of code (up to pcont:)  makes sure that si is set up for
 24125                                  ; parsing. It should point at COMBUF if FORFLAG is set and arg.argforcombuf
 24126                                  ; otherwise. This is done so that commands can get arg pointers into their
 24127                                  ; original command line (or an exact copy of it) in arg_ocomptr.
 24128                                  ; Arg.argforcombuf is used so that the for loop processor will always be able
 24129                                  ; to get a hold of its original command line; even after COMBUF is blasted by
 24130                                  ; the command to be repeated or the transient part of command has been
 24131                                  ; reloaded.
 24132                                  
 24133 00003087 1E                      	push	ds
 24134 00003088 8E1E[C08A]              	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 24135 0000308C 803E[AC01]00            	cmp	byte [ForFlag],0
 24136 00003091 1F                      	pop	ds
 24137 00003092 7510                    	jnz	short PCONT
 24138                                  	;mov	di,ARG_ARGFORCOMBUF
 24139 00003094 BF[1393]                	mov	di,ARG+ARG_UNIT.argforcombuf 
 24140 00003097 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24141 00003099 8A0E[2089]              	mov	cl,[COMBUF+1]
 24142 0000309D FEC1                    	inc	cl
 24143 0000309F F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 24144                                  	;mov	si,ARG_ARGFORCOMBUF
 24145 000030A1 BE[1393]                	mov	si,ARG+ARG_UNIT.argforcombuf 
 24146                                  PCONT:
 24147 000030A4 BF[9593]                	mov	di,TPBUF	; destination is temporary token buffer	
 24148 000030A7 B320                    	mov	bl,' '		; no special delimiter, for now
 24149                                  PARSELOOP:
 24150 000030A9 8936[1794]              	mov	[COMPTR],si	; save ptr into original command buffer
 24151 000030AD 31ED                    	xor	bp,bp		; switch information put here by cparse
 24152 000030AF C606[318E]00            	mov	byte [expand_star],0 ; don't expand *'s to ?'s
 24153 000030B4 E833F5                  	call	scanoff		; skip leading blanks...
 24154 000030B7 E8D110                  	call	cparse		; byte off a token (args in SI, DI, BL)
 24155 000030BA 730B                    	jnb	short MORE_PRSE
 24156 000030BC 09ED                    	or	bp,bp		; Check for trailing switch character
 24157 000030BE 7403                    	jz	short PARSEDONE
 24158 000030C0 E81700                  	call	newarg		; We hit CR but BP is non-zero. The
 24159                                  				;   typical cause of this is that a
 24160                                  				;   switch char IMMEDIATELY preceeds
 24161                                  				;   the CR. We have an argument, but it
 24162                                  				;   is sort of an error.
 24163                                  	;jmp	short PARSEDONE	; We're done (found the CR).
 24164                                  	; 01/03/2023
 24165                                  PARSEDONE:
 24166 000030C3 9D                      	popf
 24167 000030C4 F8                      	clc
 24168 000030C5 EB0C                    	jmp	short PARSE_EXIT
 24169                                  
 24170                                  MORE_PRSE:
 24171 000030C7 C606[B48C]02            	mov	byte [cpyflag],2
 24172                                  				; tell CPARSE that 1st token is done
 24173 000030CC E80B00                  	call	newarg		; add to argv array (CX has char count)
 24174 000030CF 73D8                    	jnb	short PARSELOOP	; was everything OK?
 24175                                  	;jmp	short PARSE_ERROR ; NO, it wasn't -- bug out (CF set)
 24176                                  	; 01/03/2023
 24177                                  ;PARSEDONE:
 24178                                  	;popf
 24179                                  	;clc
 24180                                  	;jmp	short PARSE_EXIT
 24181                                  
 24182                                  PARSE_ERROR:			; error entry (er, exit) point
 24183 000030D1 9D                      	popf
 24184 000030D2 F9                      	stc
 24185                                  PARSE_EXIT:			; depend on not changing CF
 24186 000030D3 5E                      	pop	si
 24187 000030D4 5F                      	pop	di
 24188 000030D5 5A                      	pop	dx
 24189 000030D6 59                      	pop	cx
 24190 000030D7 5B                      	pop	bx
 24191 000030D8 58                      	pop	ax
 24192 000030D9 C3                      	retn
 24193                                  
 24194                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24195                                  
 24196                                  ; NEWARG adds the supplied argstring and cparse data to arg.argv[].
 24197                                  ;
 24198                                  ; ENTRY:
 24199                                  ;   BH			argflags
 24200                                  ;   CX			character count in argstring
 24201                                  ;   DI			pointer to argstring
 24202                                  ;   comptr		ptr to starting loc of current token in original command
 24203                                  ;   [STARTEL]		cparse's answer to where the last element starts
 24204                                  ; EXIT:
 24205                                  ;   argbufptr		points to next free section of argbuffer
 24206                                  ;   arg.argbuf		contains null-terminated argument strings
 24207                                  ;   arg.argvcnt 	argument count
 24208                                  ;   arg.argv[]		array of flags and pointers
 24209                                  ;   arg.arg_ocomptr	ptr to starting loc of current token in original command
 24210                                  ;   CF			set if error
 24211                                  ;   AL			carry set:  error code; otherwise, zero
 24212                                  
 24213                                  	; 01/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 24214                                  newarg:
 24215 000030DA 53                      	push	bx
 24216 000030DB 51                      	push	cx
 24217 000030DC 52                      	push	dx
 24218 000030DD 57                      	push	di
 24219 000030DE 56                      	push	si
 24220 000030DF 9C                      	pushf
 24221 000030E0 E86600                  	call	arg_switch		; if it's a switch, record switch info
 24222                                  					; LEAVE SWITCH ON COMMAND LINE!!
 24223                                  	;;;jc	short newarg_done 	; previous arg's switches -- and leave
 24224                                  
 24225                                  	;cmp	word [ARG_ARGVCNT],64	; check to ensure we've not
 24226 000030E3 833E[0F91]40            	cmp	word [ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt],ARGMAX ; 64
 24227 000030E8 7D4F                    	jge	short to_many_args	; exceeded array limits
 24228 000030EA 88FE                    	mov	dh,bh			
 24229                                  	;mov	bx,[ARG_ARGVCNT]	; save argflags	
 24230 000030EC 8B1E[0F91]              	mov	bx,[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt] ; argv[argvcnt++] = arg data
 24231                                  	;inc	word [ARG_ARGVCNT]
 24232 000030F0 FF06[0F91]              	inc	word [ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt]
 24233                                  	;mov	ax,ARG_ARGV
 24234 000030F4 B8[4F8E]                	mov	ax,ARG+ARG_UNIT.argv
 24235 000030F7 E88200                  	call	argv_calc		; convert offset to pointer
 24236                                  	;mov	[BX].argsw_word,0 	; no switch information, yet...
 24237                                  	;mov	word [bx+7],0
 24238 000030FA C747070000              	mov	word [bx+ARGV_ELE.argsw_word],0
 24239                                  	;mov	[BX].arglen,CX		; argv[argvcnt].arglen = arg length
 24240                                  	;mov	[bx+5],cx
 24241 000030FF 894F05                  	mov	[bx+ARGV_ELE.arglen],cx 
 24242                                  	;mov	[BX].argflags,DH 	; argv[argvcnt].argflags = cparse flags
 24243                                  	;mov	[bx+2],dh
 24244 00003102 887702                  	mov	[bx+ARGV_ELE.argflags],dh
 24245 00003105 8B36[9393]              	mov	si,[ARGBUF_PTR]
 24246                                  	;mov	[BX].argpointer,SI 	; argv[argvcnt].argpointer = [argbufptr]
 24247                                  	;mov	[bx+ARGV_ELE.argpointer],si
 24248 00003109 8937                    	mov	[bx],si			
 24249 0000310B 0336[F68D]              	add	si,[STARTEL]		; save startel from new location
 24250 0000310F 29FE                    	sub	si,di			; form pointer into argbuf
 24251                                  	;mov	[BX].argstartel,SI ; argv[argvcnt].argstartel = new [STARTEL]
 24252                                  	;mov	[bx+3],si
 24253 00003111 897703                  	mov	[bx+ARGV_ELE.argstartel],si
 24254 00003114 8B36[1794]              	mov	si,[COMPTR]
 24255                                  	;mov	[BX].arg_ocomptr,si ; arg_ocomptr = ptr into original com line
 24256                                  	;mov	[bx+9],si
 24257 00003118 897709                  	mov	[bx+ARGV_ELE.arg_ocomptr],si
 24258 0000311B 89FE                    	mov	si,di			; now save argstring in argbuffer
 24259 0000311D 8B3E[9393]              	mov	di,[ARGBUF_PTR]		; load the argbuf pointer and make
 24260 00003121 01CF                    	add	di,cx			; sure we're not about to run off
 24261                                  	;cmp	DI,OFFSET TRANGROUP:arg.argbuf+ARGBLEN-1
 24262                                  	;cmp	di,ARG_ARGBUF+255
 24263 00003123 81FF[1292]              	cmp	di,ARG+ARG_UNIT.argbuf+ARGBLEN-1
 24264 00003127 7D15                    	jge	short buf_oflow		; the end of the buffer (plus null byte)	
 24265 00003129 29CF                    	sub	di,cx
 24266 0000312B FC                      	cld
 24267 0000312C F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 24268 0000312E B000                    	mov	al,ANULL ; 0		; tack a null byte on the end
 24269 00003130 AA                      	stosb
 24270 00003131 893E[9393]              	mov	[ARGBUF_PTR],di		; update argbufptr after copy
 24271                                  newarg_done:
 24272 00003135 9D                      	popf
 24273 00003136 F8                      	clc
 24274 00003137 EB0A                    	jmp	short newarg_exit
 24275                                  to_many_args:
 24276 00003139 B80100                  	mov	ax,1
 24277 0000313C EB03                    	jmp	short newarg_error
 24278                                  buf_oflow:
 24279 0000313E B80200                  	mov	ax,2
 24280                                  newarg_error:
 24281 00003141 9D                      	popf
 24282 00003142 F9                      	stc
 24283                                  newarg_exit:
 24284 00003143 5E                      	pop	si
 24285 00003144 5F                      	pop	di
 24286 00003145 5A                      	pop	dx
 24287 00003146 59                      	pop	cx
 24288 00003147 5B                      	pop	bx
 24289 00003148 C3                      	retn
 24290                                  
 24291                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24292                                  
 24293                                  ; ARG_SWITCH decides if an argument might really be a switch. In the
 24294                                  ; event that it is, and we can recognize
 24295                                  ;
 24296                                  ; ENTRY:
 24297                                  ;   As in <newarg>.
 24298                                  ; EXIT:
 24299                                  ;   CF	    --	    clear (wasn't a switch); set (was a switch)
 24300                                  ; NOTE(S):
 24301                                  ;   *	The mechanism mapping a switch into a bit-value depends entirely
 24302                                  ;	on the order of definition in the <switch_list> variable and the
 24303                                  ;	values chosen to define the bits in CMDT:COMEQU.ASM. Change either
 24304                                  ;	<switch_list> or the definitions in CMDT:COMEQU.ASM -- and rewrite
 24305                                  ;	this mechanism. This code taken from CMDT:TCODE.ASM.
 24306                                  ;   *	The <switch_list> declared below is redundant to one declared in
 24307                                  ;	TDATA.ASM, and used in TCODE.ASM.
 24308                                  ;   *	An ugly routine.
 24309                                  
 24310                                  	; 01/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 COMMAND.COM
 24311                                  arg_switch:
 24312 00003149 50                      	push	ax
 24313 0000314A 53                      	push	bx
 24314 0000314B 51                      	push	cx
 24315 0000314C 57                      	push	di
 24316 0000314D 9C                      	pushf
 24317 0000314E F6C701                  	test	bh,1 ; sw_flag		; is it a switch? (preserve flag word)
 24318 00003151 741C                    	jz	short arg_no_switch0
 24319 00003153 833E[1594]FF            	cmp	word [LASTARG],-1 	; have we encountered any REAL args yet?
 24320 00003158 741B                    	je	short arg_no_switch1 	; no, so leading switches don't matter
 24321 0000315A 8B1E[1594]              	mov	bx,[LASTARG]		; yes, add switch info to last REAL arg
 24322                                  	;mov	ax,offset TRANGROUP:arg.argv
 24323                                  	;mov	ax,ARG_ARGV
 24324 0000315E B8[4F8E]                	mov	ax,ARG+ARG_UNIT.argv  ; ARG+0
 24325 00003161 E81800                  	call	argv_calc
 24326                                  	;or	[BX].argsw_word,BP
 24327                                  	;or	[bx+7],bp
 24328 00003164 096F07                  	or	[bx+ARGV_ELE.argsw_word],bp
 24329                                  	;or	arg.argswinfo,BP
 24330                                  	;or	[ARG_ARGSWINFO],bp
 24331 00003167 092E[1191]              	or	[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argswinfo],bp
 24332                                  arg_yes_switch:
 24333 0000316B 9D                      	popf
 24334 0000316C F9                      	stc
 24335 0000316D EB08                    	jmp	short arg_switch_exit
 24336                                  
 24337                                  arg_no_switch0:
 24338                                  	;mov	ax,[ARG_ARGVCNT]
 24339 0000316F A1[0F91]                	mov	ax,[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt]
 24340 00003172 A3[1594]                	mov	[LASTARG],ax
 24341                                  arg_no_switch1:
 24342 00003175 9D                      	popf
 24343 00003176 F8                      	clc
 24344                                  arg_switch_exit:
 24345 00003177 5F                      	pop	di
 24346 00003178 59                      	pop	cx
 24347 00003179 5B                      	pop	bx
 24348 0000317A 58                      	pop	ax
 24349 0000317B C3                      	retn
 24350                                  
 24351                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24352                                  
 24353                                  ; ARGV_CALC maps an array index into a byte-offset from the base of
 24354                                  ; the supplied array.  Method used for computing the address is:
 24355                                  ;	Array Index * Array Elt Size + Base Addr = Elt Addr
 24356                                  ; ENTRY:
 24357                                  ;   AX	    --	    base of array
 24358                                  ;   BX	    --	    array index
 24359                                  ; EXIT:
 24360                                  ;   BX	    --	    byte offset
 24361                                  
 24362                                  	; 01/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 COMMAND.COM
 24363                                  argv_calc:
 24364 0000317C 50                      	push	ax		; Save base
 24365 0000317D 88D8                    	mov	al,bl		; al = array index
 24366                                  	;mov	bl,11
 24367 0000317F B30B                    	mov	bl,ARGV_ELE.SIZE ; bl = size of an argv element
 24368 00003181 F6E3                    	mul	bl		; ax = base offset
 24369 00003183 5B                      	pop	bx		; Get base
 24370 00003184 01D8                    	add	ax,bx		; Add in base offset
 24371 00003186 93                      	xchg	ax,bx		; Restore ax and put byte offset in bx
 24372 00003187 C3                      	retn
 24373                                  
 24374                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24375                                  	
 24376                                  	;db 0Ah dup(0)
 24377                                  	;times 10 db 0
 24378                                  
 24379 00003188 90<rep 8h>              align 16

 24381                                  ;============================================================================
 24382                                  ; PATH1.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 24383                                  ;============================================================================
 24384                                  ; 03/10/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 24385                                  
 24386                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24387                                  ;    PATH.ASM contains the routines to perform pathname incovation. Path and
 24388                                  ;    Parse share a temporary buffer and argv[] definitions. <Path_Search>,
 24389                                  ;    given a pathname, attempts to find a corresponding executable or batch
 24390                                  ;    file on disk. Directories specified in the user's search path will be
 24391                                  ;    searched for a matching file, if a match is not found in the current
 24392                                  ;    directory and if the pathname is actually only an MSDOS filename.
 24393                                  ;    <Path_Search> assumes that the parsed command name can be found in
 24394                                  ;    argv[0] -- in other words, <Parseline> should be executed prior to
 24395                                  ;    <Path_Search>. Alternatively, the command name and appropriate
 24396                                  ;    information could be placed in argv[0], or <Path_Search> could be
 24397                                  ;    (easily) modified to make no assumptions about where its input is found.
 24398                                  ;    Please find enclosed yet another important routine, <Save_Args>, which
 24399                                  ;    places the entire arg/argv[]/argbuf structure on a piece of newly
 24400                                  ;    allocated memory. This is handy for for-loop processing, and anything
 24401                                  ;    else that wants to save the whole shebang and then process other command
 24402                                  ;    lines.
 24403                                  ;
 24404                                  ; Alan L, OS/MSDOS				    August 15, 1983
 24405                                  ;
 24406                                  ; ENTRY:
 24407                                  ;   <Path_Search>:	    argv[0].
 24408                                  ;   <Save_Args>:	    bytes to allocate in addition to arg structure
 24409                                  ; EXIT:
 24410                                  ;   <Path_Search>:	    success flag, best pathname match in EXECPATH.
 24411                                  ;   <Save_Args>:	    success flag, segment address of new memory
 24412                                  ; NOTE(S):
 24413                                  ;   *	<Argv_calc> handily turns an array index into an absolute pointer.
 24414                                  ;	The computation depends on the size of an argv[] element (arg_ele).
 24415                                  ;   *	<Parseline> calls <cparse> for chunks of the command line. <Cparse>
 24416                                  ;	does not function as specified; see <Parseline> for more details.
 24417                                  ;   *	<Parseline> now knows about the flags the internals of COMMAND.COM
 24418                                  ;	need to know about. This extra information is stored in a switch_flag
 24419                                  ;	word with each command-line argument; the switches themselves will not
 24420                                  ;	appear in the resulting arg structure.
 24421                                  ;   *	With the exception of CARRY, flags are generally preserved across calls.
 24422                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24423                                  
 24424                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24425                                  
 24426                                  ; PATH_SEARCH tries to find the file it's given, somewhere. An initial value
 24427                                  ; of *argv[0].argstartel == 0 implies that there is no command (empty line
 24428                                  ; or 'd:' or 'd:/'). This check is done in strip; otherwise, strip formats
 24429                                  ; the filename/pathname into tpbuf. Search(tpbuf) is executed to see if we
 24430                                  ; have a match, either in the current working directory if we were handed
 24431                                  ; a filename, or in the specified directory, given a pathname. If this call
 24432                                  ; fails, and we were given a pathname, then Path_Search fails. Otherwise,
 24433                                  ; Path_Crunch is repeatedly invoked on tpbuf[STARTEL] (if there's a drive
 24434                                  ; prefix, we want to skip it) for each pathstring in userpath. Success on
 24435                                  ; either the first invocation of search or on one of the succeeding calls
 24436                                  ; sets up the appropriate information for copying the successful pathname
 24437                                  ; prefix (if any) into the result buffer, followed by the successful filename
 24438                                  ; match (from [search_best_buf]). The result is returned in in EXECPATH.
 24439                                  ;
 24440                                  ; ENTRY:
 24441                                  ;   argv[0]		--	command name and associated information
 24442                                  ; EXIT:
 24443                                  ;   AX			--	non-zero indicates type of file found
 24444                                  ;   EXECPATH		--	successful pathname (AX non-zero)
 24445                                  ; NOTE(S):
 24446                                  ;   1)	Uses the temporary buffer, tpbuf, from the parse routines.
 24447                                  ;   2)	Some files are more equal than others.	See search: for rankings.
 24448                                  ;   3)	Path_Search terminates as soon as a call to search succeeds, even
 24449                                  ;	if search returns an .exe or .bat.
 24450                                  ;   5)	Clobbers dma address.
 24451                                  
 24452                                  PBUFLEN 	EQU	128		; length of EXECPATH
 24453                                  PATH_SEP_CHAR	EQU	';'
 24454                                  
 24455                                  ;parseflags RECORD special_delim:1, unused:4, path_sep:1, wildcard:1, sw_flag:1
 24456                                  
 24457                                  	;special_delim equ 128
 24458                                  	;path_sep equ 4
 24459                                  	;wildcard equ 2
 24460                                  	;sw_flag  equ 1
 24461                                  
 24462                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24463                                  
 24464                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 2510h
 24465                                  
 24466                                  ; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 24467                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 32D1h
 24468                                  
 24469                                  path_search:
 24470 00003190 53                      	push	bx
 24471 00003191 51                      	push	cx
 24472 00003192 52                      	push	dx		; could use a "stack 'em" instruction
 24473 00003193 56                      	push	si
 24474 00003194 57                      	push	di
 24475 00003195 55                      	push	bp
 24476 00003196 9C                      	pushf
 24477                                  
 24478                                  	;test	ds:arg.argv[0].argflags, (MASK wildcard) + (MASK sw_flag)
 24479                                  	;test	byte [ARGV0_ARG_FLAGS],3
 24480 00003197 F606[518E]03            	test	byte [ARG+ARGV_ELE.argflags],3 ; wildcard+sw_flag
 24481 0000319C 7403                    	jz	short path_search_ok
 24482                                  path_failure_jmp:
 24483 0000319E E9C100                  	jmp	path_failure	; ambiguous commands not allowed
 24484                                  
 24485                                  path_search_ok:
 24486 000031A1 E85201                  	call	STORE_PCHAR	; figure out the pathname separator
 24487 000031A4 BA[1994]                	mov	dx,FBUF		; clobber old dma value with
 24488 000031A7 B8001A                  	mov	ax,Set_DMA*256 ; 1A00h ; a pointer to our dma buffer
 24489 000031AA CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	SET DISK TRANSFER AREA ADDRESS
 24490                                  			; DS:DX	-> disk	transfer buffer
 24491 000031AC 06                      	push	es
 24492 000031AD E866F1                  	call	find_path	; get a handle (ES:DI) on user path
 24493 000031B0 8C06[4494]              	mov	[pathinfo+0],es	; and squirrel it away
 24494 000031B4 893E[4694]              	mov	[pathinfo+2],di	; "old" pathstring pointer
 24495 000031B8 893E[4894]              	mov	[pathinfo+4],di	; "new" pathstring pointer
 24496 000031BC 07                      	pop	es
 24497                                  	
 24498 000031BD BB8000                  	mov	bx,PBUFLEN ; 128 ; copy/format argv[0] into temp buffer
 24499 000031C0 BE[E889]                	mov	si,EXECPATH
 24500 000031C3 E88002                  	call	STRIP
 24501 000031C6 72D6                    	jc	short path_failure_jmp ; if possible, of course
 24502                                  		
 24503 000031C8 89F2                    	mov	dx,si		; search (EXECPATH, error_message)
 24504 000031CA C706[9994][B17F]        	mov	word [search_error],baddrv_ptr
 24505 000031D0 E89F01                  	call	PSEARCH		; must do at least one search
 24506 000031D3 09C0                    	or	ax,ax		; find anything?
 24507 000031D5 7469                    	jz	short path_noinit
 24508                                  				; failure ... search farther	
 24509 000031D7 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax		; success... save filetype code	
 24510 000031D9 BF[E889]                	mov	di,EXECPATH
 24511                                  	;mov	si,ds:arg.argv[0].argpointer
 24512                                  	;mov	si,[ARG_ARGV]
 24513 000031DC 8B36[4F8E]              	mov	si,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.argpointer]
 24514                                  	;mov	cx,ds:arg.argv[0].argstartel
 24515                                  	;mov	cx,[ARGV0_ARGSTARTEL]
 24516 000031E0 8B0E[528E]              	mov	cx,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.argstartel]
 24517 000031E4 29F1                    	sub	cx,si		; compute prefix bytes to copy
 24518                                  
 24519                                  ; We have the number of bytes in the prefix (up to the final component).
 24520                                  ; We need to form the complete pathname including leading drive and current
 24521                                  ; directory.
 24522                                  ;
 24523                                  ; Is there a drive letter present?
 24524                                  
 24525 000031E6 B43A                    	mov	ah,':'
 24526 000031E8 83F902                  	cmp	cx,2		; room for drive letter?
 24527 000031EB 7205                    	jb	short adddrive	; no, stick it in
 24528 000031ED 386401                  	cmp	[si+1],	ah	; colon present?
 24529 000031F0 7408                    	je	short movedrive	; yes, just move it
 24530                                  adddrive:
 24531 000031F2 A0[D48A]                	mov	al,[CURDRV]	; get current drive
 24532 000031F5 0441                    	add	al,'A'		; convert to uppercase letter
 24533 000031F7 AB                      	stosw			; store d:
 24534 000031F8 EB05                    	jmp	short checkpath
 24535                                  
 24536                                  movedrive:
 24537 000031FA AD                      	lodsw			; move d:
 24538 000031FB AB                      	stosw
 24539 000031FC 83E902                  	sub	cx,2		; 2 bytes less to move
 24540                                  checkpath:
 24541 000031FF 0C20                    	or	al,20h
 24542 00003201 88C2                    	mov	dl,al		
 24543                                  	;sub	dl,60h
 24544 00003203 80EA60                  	sub	dl,'a'-1	; convert to 1-based for current dir
 24545                                  
 24546                                  ; Stick in beginning path char
 24547                                  
 24548 00003206 A0[4A94]                	mov	al,[psep_char]
 24549 00003209 AA                      	stosb
 24550                                  
 24551                                  ; Is there a leading /? If so, then no current dir copy is necessary.
 24552                                  ; Otherwise, get current dir for DL.
 24553                                  
 24554 0000320A 83F901                  	cmp	cx,1		; is there room for path char?
 24555 0000320D 720A                    	jb	short addpath	; no, go add path
 24556 0000320F AC                      	lodsb
 24557 00003210 49                      	dec	cx
 24558 00003211 3A06[4A94]              	cmp	al,[psep_char]	; is there a path separator?
 24559 00003215 741C                    	je	short movepath	; yes, go move remainder of path
 24560 00003217 41                      	inc	cx
 24561 00003218 4E                      	dec	si		; undo the lodsb
 24562                                  addpath:
 24563 00003219 56                      	push	si
 24564 0000321A 89FE                    	mov	si,di		; remainder of buffer
 24565 0000321C B80047                  	mov	ax,Current_Dir*256 ; 4700h
 24566 0000321F CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - GET CURRENT DIRECTORY
 24567                                  			; DL = drive (0=default,1=A,etc.)
 24568                                  			; DS:SI	points to 64-byte buffer area
 24569                                  
 24570                                  ; The previous current dir will succeed a previous find_first already worked.
 24571                                  ;
 24572                                  ; Find end of string.
 24573                                  
 24574 00003221 89F7                    	mov	di,si
 24575 00003223 5E                      	pop	si
 24576 00003224 A0[4A94]                	mov	al,[psep_char]
 24577 00003227 803D00                  	cmp	byte [di],0	; root (empty dir string)?
 24578 0000322A 7407                    	jz	short movepath	; yes, no need for path char
 24579                                  scanend:
 24580                                  	;cmp	byte [di],0	; end of string?
 24581                                  	;jz	short foundend
 24582                                  	;inc	di
 24583                                  	;jmp	short scanend
 24584                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 COMMAND.COM
 24585 0000322C 47                      	inc	di
 24586 0000322D 803D00                  	cmp	byte [di],0
 24587 00003230 75FA                    	jnz	short scanend
 24588                                  
 24589                                  ; Stick in a trailing path char.
 24590                                  
 24591                                  foundend:
 24592 00003232 AA                      	stosb
 24593                                  
 24594                                  ; Move remaining part of path. Skip leading path char if present.
 24595                                  
 24596                                  movepath:
 24597 00003233 3804                    	cmp	[si],al		; first char a path char?
 24598 00003235 7502                    	jne	short copypath
 24599                                  	; 26/04/2023
 24600 00003237 46                      	inc	si		; move past leading char
 24601 00003238 49                      	dec	cx		; drop from count
 24602                                  copypath:
 24603 00003239 E302                    	jcxz	_copydone	; no chars to move!	
 24604 0000323B F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 24605                                  _copydone:
 24606 0000323D E9A100                  	jmp	path_success
 24607                                  				; run off and form complete pathname
 24608                                  path_noinit:
 24609                                  	;test	ds:arg.argv[0].argflags, MASK path_sep
 24610                                  	;test	byte [ARGV0_ARG_FLAGS],4
 24611 00003240 F606[518E]04            	test	byte [ARG+ARGV_ELE.argflags],4 ; path_sep
 24612 00003245 751B                    	jnz	short path_failure
 24613                                  				; complete pathname specified ==> fail
 24614                                  	;mov	bh,';'
 24615 00003247 B73B                    	mov	bh,PATH_SEP_CHAR
 24616                                  				; semicolon terminates pathstring
 24617                                  	;mov	dx,ds:arg.argv[0].argstartel
 24618                                  				; this is where the last element starts
 24619                                  	;mov	dx,[ARGV0_ARGSTARTEL]
 24620 00003249 8B16[528E]              	mov	dx,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.argstartel]
 24621                                  	;sub	dx,ds:arg.argv[0].argpointer
 24622                                  				; form pointer into EXECPATH,
 24623                                  	;sub	dx,[ARG_ARGV]
 24624 0000324D 2B16[4F8E]              	sub	dx,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.argpointer]
 24625 00003251 81C2[E889]              	add	dx,EXECPATH	; skipping over drive spec, if any
 24626                                  path_loop:
 24627 00003255 E8AD00                  	call	path_crunch	; pcrunch (EXECPATH, pathinfo)
 24628 00003258 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax		; save filetype code
 24629 0000325A 9F                      	lahf			; save flags, just in case
 24630 0000325B 09ED                    	or	bp,bp		; did path_crunch find anything?		
 24631 0000325D 7508                    	jnz	short path_found 
 24632 0000325F 9E                      	sahf			; see? needed those flags, after all!
 24633 00003260 73F3                    	jnc	short path_loop	; is there anything left to the path?
 24634                                  path_failure:
 24635 00003262 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 24636 00003264 E98700                  	jmp	path_exit
 24637                                  
 24638                                  path_found:				; pathinfo[] points to winner
 24639 00003267 BF[E889]                	mov	di,EXECPATH
 24640                                  	;mov	cx,pathinfo[4] 
 24641 0000326A 8B0E[4894]              	mov	cx,[pathinfo+4]	; "new" pointer -- end of string
 24642                                  	;mov	si,pathinfo[2]
 24643 0000326E 8B36[4694]              	mov	si,[pathinfo+2]	; "old" pointer -- beginning of string
 24644                                  
 24645                                  ;	BAS Nov 20/84
 24646                                  ;   Look at the pathname and expand . and .. if they are the first element
 24647                                  ;   in the pathname (after the drive letter)
 24648                                  
 24649 00003272 06                      	push	es
 24650                                  	;push	pathinfo[0]
 24651 00003273 FF36[4494]              	push	word [pathinfo+0]
 24652 00003277 07                      	pop	es
 24653                                  ;SR;
 24654                                  ; Oops! Gets fooled if path= \;..
 24655                                  ; We should also check if a drive letter is really present
 24656                                  ;
 24657 00003278 26807C022E              	cmp	byte [es:si+2],'.'
 24658                                  				; Look for Current dir at start of path
 24659 0000327D 7534                    	jne	short path_cpy
 24660                                  
 24661                                  	; 18/03/2023
 24662                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24663 0000327F 26807C013A              	cmp	byte [es:si+1],':'
 24664                                  				; does path have drive letter?
 24665 00003284 752D                    	jne	short path_cpy	; no, copy the path string
 24666                                  
 24667 00003286 51                      	push	cx		; Save pointer to end of string
 24668                                  	;mov	al,[es:si]
 24669                                  	;mov	[di],al		; Copy drive letter, :, and root char
 24670                                  	;mov	al,[es:si+1]	; to EXECPATH
 24671                                  	;mov	[di+1],al
 24672                                  	; 05/05/2023
 24673 00003287 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]
 24674 0000328A 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 24675 0000328C A0[4A94]                	mov	al,[psep_char]
 24676 0000328F 884502                  	mov	[di+2],al
 24677 00003292 56                      	push	si		; Save pointer to begining of string
 24678 00003293 268A14                  	mov	dl,[es:si]	; Convert device letter for cur dir
 24679 00003296 80CA20                  	or	dl,20h
 24680                                  	;sub	dl,60h
 24681 00003299 80EA60                  	sub	dl,'a'-1
 24682 0000329C 89FE                    	mov	si,di		; pointer to EXECPATH
 24683 0000329E 83C603                  	add	si,3		; Don't wipe out drive and root info
 24684 000032A1 B80047                  	mov	ax,Current_Dir*256 ; 4700h
 24685 000032A4 CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - GET CURRENT DIRECTORY
 24686                                  			; DL = drive (0=default,1=A,etc.)
 24687                                  			; DS:SI	points to 64-byte buffer area
 24688 000032A6 E8D8F9                  	call	dstrlen		; Determine length of present info
 24689 000032A9 01CE                    	add	si,cx		; Don't copy over drive and root info
 24690 000032AB 4E                      	dec	si
 24691 000032AC 89F7                    	mov	di,si		; Point to end of target string
 24692 000032AE 5E                      	pop	si		; Restore pointer to begining of string
 24693 000032AF 83C603                  	add	si,3		; Point past drive letter, :, .
 24694 000032B2 59                      	pop	cx		; Restore pointer to end of string
 24695                                  path_cpy:
 24696 000032B3 07                      	pop	es
 24697 000032B4 29F1                    	sub	cx,si		; yields character count
 24698 000032B6 1E                      	push	ds		; time to switch segments
 24699 000032B7 FF36[4494]              	push	word [pathinfo+0]
 24700                                  				; string lives in this segment
 24701 000032BB 1F                      	pop	ds
 24702 000032BC FC                      	cld
 24703                                  
 24704                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 24705                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 (& MSDOS 5.0)
 24706                                  	;;rep	movsb ; 3/3/KK	; copy the prefix path into EXECPATH
 24707                                  kloop:
 24708 000032BD AC                      	lodsb			;AN000;  3/3/KK
 24709 000032BE AA                      	stosb			;AN000;  3/3/KK
 24710 000032BF E806F1                  	call	testkanj	;AN000;  3/3/KK
 24711 000032C2 7410                    	jz	short _notkanj1	;AN000;  3/3/KK
 24712 000032C4 49                      	dec	cx		;AN000;  3/3/KK
 24713 000032C5 E307                    	jcxz	popdone		;AN000;  Ignore boundary error 3/3/KK
 24714 000032C7 A4                      	movsb			;AN000;  3/3/KK
 24715 000032C8 49                      	dec	cx		;AN000;  3/3/KK
 24716 000032C9 83F901                  	cmp	cx,1		;AN000;  One char (the terminator) left ? 3/3/KK
 24717 000032CC 77EF                    	ja	short kloop	;AN000;  no.  3/3/KK
 24718                                  popdone:			;AN000;  3/3/KK
 24719 000032CE 1F                      	pop	ds		;AN000;  Yes ES:DI->terminator, last char is 3/3/KK
 24720 000032CF A0[4A94]                	mov	al,[psep_char]	;AN000;  KANJI 3/3/KK
 24721 000032D2 EB0C                    	jmp	short path_store
 24722                                  				;AN000;  3/3/KK
 24723                                  _notkanj1:
 24724                                  	; 26/04/2023
 24725 000032D4 E2E7                    	loop	kloop
 24726 000032D6 1F                      	pop	ds		; return to our segment
 24727 000032D7 4F                      	dec	di		; overwrite terminator
 24728 000032D8 A0[4A94]                	mov	al,[psep_char]	; with a pathname separator
 24729 000032DB 3A45FF                  	cmp	al,[di-1]
 24730 000032DE 7401                    	je	short path_success
 24731                                  path_store:
 24732 000032E0 AA                      	stosb
 24733                                  path_success:
 24734 000032E1 BE[4C94]                	mov	si,search_best_buf
 24735 000032E4 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 24736                                  path_succ_loop:
 24737 000032E6 AC                      	lodsb			; append winning filename to path
 24738 000032E7 AA                      	stosb			; (including terminating null)	
 24739 000032E8 08C0                    	or	al,al
 24740 000032EA 75FA                    	jnz	short path_succ_loop
 24741 000032EC 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp		; retrieve filetype code
 24742                                  path_exit:
 24743 000032EE 9D                      	popf
 24744 000032EF 5D                      	pop	bp
 24745 000032F0 5F                      	pop	di
 24746 000032F1 5E                      	pop	si		; chill out...
 24747 000032F2 5A                      	pop	dx
 24748 000032F3 59                      	pop	cx
 24749 000032F4 5B                      	pop	bx
 24750 000032F5 C3                      	retn
