 24752                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24753                                  
 24754                                  ; STORE_PCHAR determines the pathname-element separator and squirrels
 24755                                  ; it away. In other words, must we say '/bin/ls' or '\bin\ls'?
 24756                                  ;
 24757                                  ; ENTRY:
 24758                                  ; EXIT:
 24759                                  ; NOTE(S):
 24760                                  ;   *	Uses <psep_char>, defined in <path_search>.
 24761                                  
 24762                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 24763                                  STORE_PCHAR:
 24764 000032F6 50                      	push	ax
 24765 000032F7 B02F                    	mov	al,'/'		; is the pathname-element separator
 24766 000032F9 E87CF3                  	call	pathchrcmp	; a regular slash?
 24767 000032FC 7402                    	jz	short STORE_SLASH
 24768                                  				; if yes, remember slash
 24769 000032FE B05C                    	mov	al,'\'
 24770                                  	; 18/03/2023
 24771                                  	;mov	[psep_char],al	; otherwise, remember back-slash
 24772                                  	;pop	ax
 24773                                  	;retn
 24774                                  STORE_SLASH:
 24775 00003300 A2[4A94]                	mov	[psep_char],al
 24776 00003303 58                      	pop	ax
 24777 00003304 C3                      	retn
 24778                                  
 24779                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24780                                  
 24781                                  ; PATH_CRUNCH takes a prefix from a prefix string, and a suffix from
 24782                                  ; EXECPATH, and smooshes them into tpbuf. The caller may supply an
 24783                                  ; additional separator to use for breaking up the path-string. Null is the
 24784                                  ; default. Once the user-string has been formed, search is invoked to see
 24785                                  ; what's out there.
 24786                                  ;
 24787                                  ; ENTRY:
 24788                                  ;   BH			--	additional terminator character
 24789                                  ;   SI			--	pointer into pathstring to be dissected
 24790                                  ;   DX			--	pointer to stripped filename
 24791                                  ; EXIT:
 24792                                  ;   AX			--	non-zero (file type), zero (nothing found)
 24793                                  ;   SI			--	moves along pathstring from call to call
 24794                                  ;   [search_best_buf]	--	name of best file (AX non-zero)
 24795                                  ;   [tpbuf]		--	clobbered
 24796                                  ; NOTE(S):
 24797                                  ;   *	Implicit in this code is the ability to specify when to search
 24798                                  ;	the current directory (if at all) through the PATH defined by
 24799                                  ;	the user, a la UNIX (e.g., PATH=;c:\bin;c:\etc searches the
 24800                                  ;	current directory before the bin and etc directories of drive c).
 24801                                  
 24802                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 24803                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:3454h
 24804                                  	
 24805                                  path_crunch:
 24806 00003305 53                      	push	bx
 24807 00003306 51                      	push	cx
 24808 00003307 52                      	push	dx
 24809 00003308 57                      	push	di
 24810 00003309 56                      	push	si
 24811                                  	;pushf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 24812 0000330A E8E9FF                  	call	STORE_PCHAR	; figure out pathname separator
 24813 0000330D BF[9593]                	mov	di,TPBUF	; destination of concatenated string
 24814 00003310 8B36[4894]              	mov	si,[pathinfo+4]	; "new" pointer to start with
 24815 00003314 8936[4694]              	mov	[pathinfo+2],si	; becomes "old" pointer
 24816 00003318 1E                      	push	ds		; save old segment pointer
 24817 00003319 FF36[4494]              	push	word [pathinfo+0]
 24818                                  				; replace with pointer to userpath's
 24819 0000331D 1F                      	pop	ds		; segment
 24820                                  	; 26/04/2023
 24821 0000331E 30C9                    	xor	cl,cl		;AN000; clear flag for later use 3/3/KK	
 24822                                  path_cr_copy:
 24823 00003320 AC                      	lodsb			; get a pathname byte
 24824 00003321 08C0                    	or	al,al		; check for terminator(s)
 24825 00003323 7414                    	jz	short path_seg	; null terminates segment & pathstring
 24826 00003325 38F8                    	cmp	al,bh
 24827 00003327 7410                    	je	short path_seg	; BH terminates a pathstring segment
 24828                                  	;
 24829                                  	; 18/03/2023
 24830                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& 5.0) COMMAND.COM
 24831 00003329 E89CF0                  	call	testkanj	;AN000; 3/3/KK
 24832 0000332C 7406                    	jz	short _notkanj2	;AN000; 3/3/KK
 24833 0000332E AA                      	stosb			;AN000; 3/3/KK
 24834 0000332F A4                      	movsb			;AN000; 3/3/KK
 24835 00003330 B101                    	mov	cl,1 ; *	;AN000; CL=1 means latest stored char is DBCS 3/3/KK	
 24836 00003332 EBEC                    	jmp	short path_cr_copy
 24837                                  _notkanj2:
 24838 00003334 30C9                    	xor	cl,cl ; *	;AN000; CL=0 means latest stored char is SBCS 3/3/KK
 24839                                  	;
 24840 00003336 AA                      	stosb
 24841 00003337 EBE7                    	jmp	short path_cr_copy
 24842                                  
 24843                                  path_seg:
 24844 00003339 1F                      	pop	ds		; restore old data segment
 24845 0000333A 8936[4894]              	mov	[pathinfo+4],si	; save "new" pointer for next time
 24846 0000333E 88C3                    	mov	bl,al		; remember if we saw null or not...
 24847                                  				;;; REMOVE NEXT 3 LINES FOR CURDIR SPEC
 24848 00003340 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax		; in case nothing in pathstr...
 24849 00003342 81FF[9593]              	cmp	di,TPBUF	; was there really anything in pathstr?		
 24850 00003346 7421                    	je	short path_cr_leave
 24851                                  				; if nothing was copied, pathstr empty
 24852                                  path_cr_look:
 24853 00003348 A0[4A94]                	mov	al,[psep_char]	; form complete pathname
 24854                                  	;
 24855                                  	; 18/03/2023
 24856                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24857 0000334B 08C9                    	or	cl,cl ; *	;AN000; 3/3/KK
 24858 0000334D 7505                    	jnz	short path_cr_store
 24859                                  				;AN000; this is a trailing byte of ECS code 3/3/KK
 24860                                  	;
 24861 0000334F 3A45FF                  	cmp	al,[di-1]	; add pathname separator for suffix
 24862 00003352 7401                    	je	short path_cr_l1
 24863                                  path_cr_store:
 24864 00003354 AA                      	stosb
 24865                                  path_cr_l1:
 24866 00003355 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 24867                                  path_cr_l2:
 24868 00003357 AC                      	lodsb			; tack the stripped filename onto
 24869 00003358 AA                      	stosb			; the end of the path, up to and
 24870 00003359 08C0                    	or	al,al		; including the terminating null
 24871 0000335B 75FA                    	jnz	short path_cr_l2
 24872 0000335D BA[9593]                	mov	dx,TPBUF	; and look for an appropriate file...	
 24873 00003360 C706[9994][AD80]        	mov	word [search_error],BADPMES_PTR
 24874                                  	;invoke search
 24875 00003366 E80900                  	call	PSEARCH		; results are in AX & search_best_buf
 24876                                  
 24877                                  	; 18/03/2023
 24878                                  ;path_cr_leave:
 24879                                  	;or	bl,bl		; did we finish off the pathstring?
 24880                                  	;jz	short path_cr_empty
 24881                                  	;			; null in BL means all gone...
 24882                                  	;popf	; **		; otherwise, plenty left
 24883                                  	;clc
 24884                                  	;jmp	short path_cr_exit
 24885                                  ;path_cr_empty:
 24886                                  	;popf	; **
 24887                                  	;stc
 24888                                  ;path_cr_exit:
 24889                                  
 24890                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 24891                                  path_cr_leave:
 24892                                  	;popf ; ** ; 18/03/2023
 24893 00003369 80FB01                  	cmp	bl,1	; if bl = 0 -> cf = 1 (path_cr_empty:)
 24894                                  	
 24895                                  path_cr_exit:
 24896 0000336C 5E                      	pop	si
 24897 0000336D 5F                      	pop	di
 24898 0000336E 5A                      	pop	dx
 24899 0000336F 59                      	pop	cx
 24900 00003370 5B                      	pop	bx
 24901 00003371 C3                      	retn
 24902                                  
 24903                                  ;============================================================================
 24904                                  ; PATH2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 24905                                  ;============================================================================
 24906                                  ; 02/10/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 24907                                  
 24908                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24909                                  ;   SEARCH, when given a pathname, attempts to find a file with
 24910                                  ; one of the following extensions: .com, .exe, .bat (highest to
 24911                                  ; lowest priority). Where conflicts arise, the extension with
 24912                                  ; the highest priority is favored.
 24913                                  ; ENTRY:
 24914                                  ;   DX		--	pointer to null-terminated pathname
 24915                                  ;   fbuf	--	dma buffer for findfirst/next
 24916                                  ; EXIT:
 24917                                  ;   AX		--	8)  file found with .com extension
 24918                                  ;			4)  file found with .exe extension
 24919                                  ;			2)  file found with .bat extension
 24920                                  ;			0)  no such file to be found
 24921                                  ;   (if AX is non-zero:)
 24922                                  ;   [search_best]	identical to AX
 24923                                  ;   [search_best_buf]	null-terminated filename
 24924                                  ; NOTES:
 24925                                  ;   1) Requires caller to have allocated a dma buffer and executed a setdma.
 24926                                  ;---------------
 24927                                  ; CONSTANTS:
 24928                                  ;---------------
 24929                                  SEARCH_FILE_NOT_FOUND	EQU	0
 24930                                  SEARCH_COM		EQU	8
 24931                                  SEARCH_EXE		EQU	4
 24932                                  SEARCH_BAT		EQU	2
 24933                                  FNAME_LEN		EQU	8
 24934                                  FNAME_MAX_LEN		EQU	13
 24935                                  DOT			EQU	'.'
 24936                                  WILDCHAR		EQU	'?'
 24937                                  
 24938                                  
 24939                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 24940                                  
 24941                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 26D6h
 24942                                  
 24943                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 24944                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:34C9h
 24945                                  	
 24946                                  PSEARCH:
 24947 00003372 51                      	push	cx
 24948 00003373 52                      	push	dx
 24949 00003374 57                      	push	di
 24950 00003375 56                      	push	si
 24951                                  	;pushf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 24952 00003376 52                      	push	dx		; check drivespec (save pname ptr)
 24953 00003377 89D7                    	mov	di,dx		; working copy of pathname
 24954 00003379 BE[5994]                	mov	si,search_curdir_buf
 24955 0000337C 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; zero means current drive
 24956 0000337E 807D013A                	cmp	byte [di+1],':'	; is there a drive spec?
 24957 00003382 7508                    	jne	short SEARCH_DIR_CHECK
 24958 00003384 8A15                    	mov	dl,[di]		; get the drive byte
 24959 00003386 80E2DF                  	and	dl,0DFh ; ~20h	; uppercase the sucker
 24960 00003389 80EA40                  	sub	dl,'@' ; 40h	; and convert to drive number
 24961                                  SEARCH_DIR_CHECK:
 24962 0000338C B80047                  	mov	ax,Current_Dir*256 ; 4700h
 24963 0000338F CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - GET CURRENT DIRECTORY
 24964                                  			; DL = drive (0=default,1=A,etc.)
 24965                                  			; DS:SI	points to 64-byte buffer area
 24966 00003391 5A                      	pop	dx		; directory? If we can't we'll		
 24967 00003392 724C                    	jc	short SEARCH_INVALID_DRIVE
 24968                                  				; assume it's a bad drive...
 24969 00003394 B91300                  	mov	cx,search_attr	; 13h
 24970                                  				; filetypes to search for
 24971 00003397 B8004E                  	mov	ax,Find_First*256 ; 4E00h ; request first match, if any
 24972 0000339A CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - FIND FIRST	ASCIZ (FINDFIRST)
 24973                                  			; CX = search attributes
 24974                                  			; DS:DX	-> ASCIZ filespec
 24975                                  			; (drive,path, and wildcards allowed)
 24976 0000339C 7249                    	jc	short SEARCH_NO_FILE
 24977 0000339E C606[4B94]00            	mov	byte [search_best],SEARCH_FILE_NOT_FOUND ; 0
 24978 000033A3 C606[4C94]00            	mov	byte [search_best_buf],ANULL
 24979                                  				; 0 ; nothing's been found, yet
 24980                                  SEARCH_LOOP:
 24981 000033A8 E84300                  	call	SEARCH_FTYPE	; determine if .com, &c...
 24982 000033AB 3A06[4B94]              	cmp	al,[search_best]
 24983                                  				; better than what we've found so far?
 24984 000033AF 7E13                    	jle	short SEARCH_NEXT
 24985                                  				; no, look for another	
 24986 000033B1 A2[4B94]                	mov	[search_best],al
 24987                                  				; found something... save its code	
 24988                                  	;mov	si,offset TRANGROUP:fbuf.find_buf_pname
 24989                                  	;mov	si,FBUF_PNAME
 24990 000033B4 BE[3794]                	mov	si,FBUF+FIND_BUF.PNAME ; FBUF+30
 24991 000033B7 BF[4C94]                	mov	di,search_best_buf
 24992 000033BA B90D00                  	mov	cx,FNAME_MAX_LEN ; 13
 24993 000033BD FC                      	cld
 24994 000033BE F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; save complete pathname representation
 24995 000033C0 3C08                    	cmp	al,SEARCH_COM	; 8
 24996                                  				; have we found the best of all?	
 24997 000033C2 740A                    	je	short SEARCH_DONE
 24998                                  SEARCH_NEXT:			; keep on looking
 24999 000033C4 B91300                  	mov	cx,search_attr ; 13h
 25000 000033C7 B8004F                  	mov	ax,Find_Next*256 ; 4F00h ; next match
 25001 000033CA CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS -	2+ - FIND NEXT ASCIZ (FINDNEXT)
 25002                                  			; [DTA]	= data block from
 25003                                  			; last AH = 4Eh/4Fh call
 25004 000033CC 73DA                    	jnc	short SEARCH_LOOP
 25005                                  SEARCH_DONE:			; it's all over with...
 25006 000033CE A0[4B94]                	mov	al,[search_best]
 25007                                  				; pick best to return with
 25008                                  	; 18/03/2023
 25009                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 25010 000033D1 803E[058E]01            	cmp	byte [ext_entered],1
 25011                                  				;AN005; Did user request a specific ext?
 25012 000033D6 7411                    	je	short SEARCH_EXIT
 25013                                  				;AN005; no - exit
 25014 000033D8 A0[058E]                	mov	al,[ext_entered]
 25015                                  				;AN005; yes - get the real file type back
 25016 000033DB A2[4B94]                	mov	[search_best],al
 25017                                  				;AN005; save the real file type
 25018                                  	;
 25019 000033DE EB09                    	jmp	short SEARCH_EXIT
 25020                                  
 25021                                  SEARCH_INVALID_DRIVE:		; Tell the user path/drive
 25022 000033E0 8B16[9994]              	mov	dx,[search_error]
 25023                                  				; appropriate error message
 25024 000033E4 E83C1A                  	call	std_printf	; and pretend no file found
 25025                                  
 25026                                  SEARCH_NO_FILE:			; couldn't find a match
 25027                                  	;mov	ax,SEARCH_FILE_NOT_FOUND ; 0
 25028                                  	; 18/03/2023
 25029 000033E7 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 25030                                  SEARCH_EXIT:
 25031                                  	;popf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 25032 000033E9 5E                      	pop	si
 25033 000033EA 5F                      	pop	di
 25034 000033EB 5A                      	pop	dx
 25035 000033EC 59                      	pop	cx
 25036 000033ED C3                      	retn
 25037                                  
 25038                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 25039                                  
 25040                                  ; SEARCH_FTYPE determines the type of a file by examining its extension.
 25041                                  ;
 25042                                  ; ENTRY:
 25043                                  ;   fbuf    --	dma buffer containing filename
 25044                                  ; EXIT:
 25045                                  ;   AX	    --	file code, as given in search header
 25046                                  ; NOTE(S):
 25047                                  ;   *	Implicit assumption that NULL == search_file_not_found
 25048                                  
 25049                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 25050                                  
 25051                                  SEARCH_FTYPE:
 25052 000033EE 57                      	push	di
 25053 000033EF 56                      	push	si
 25054                                  	;mov	ax,ANULL ; 0	; find the end of the filename
 25055                                  	; 18/02/2023
 25056 000033F0 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; ax = 0		
 25057                                  	;mov	di,offset TRANGROUP:fbuf.find_buf_pname
 25058                                  	;mov	di,FBUF_PNAME
 25059 000033F2 BF[3794]                	mov	di,FBUF+FIND_BUF.PNAME ; FBUF+1Eh
 25060 000033F5 B90D00                  	mov	cx,FNAME_MAX_LEN ; 13
 25061 000033F8 FC                      	cld
 25062 000033F9 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb		; search for the terminating null
 25063 000033FB 7535                    	jnz	short FTYPE_EXIT
 25064                                  				; weird... no null byte at end
 25065 000033FD 83EF05                  	sub	di,5		; . + E + X + T + NULL
 25066                                  
 25067                                  	; Compare .COM
 25068                                  
 25069 00003400 BE[7F84]                	mov	si,comext ; ".COM"
 25070 00003403 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 25071 00003405 A7                      	cmpsw
 25072 00003406 7508                    	jnz	short FTYPE_EXE
 25073 00003408 A7                      	cmpsw
 25074 00003409 7505                    	jnz	short FTYPE_EXE
 25075                                  	;mov	ax,8
 25076 0000340B B80800                  	mov	ax,SEARCH_COM	; success!
 25077 0000340E EB22                    	jmp	short FTYPE_EXIT
 25078                                  
 25079                                  	; Compare .EXE
 25080                                  FTYPE_EXE:			; still looking... now for '.exe'
 25081 00003410 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 25082 00003412 BE[8384]                	mov	si,exeext ; ".EXE"
 25083 00003415 A7                      	cmpsw
 25084 00003416 7508                    	jnz	short FTYPE_BAT
 25085 00003418 A7                      	cmpsw
 25086 00003419 7505                    	jnz	short FTYPE_BAT
 25087                                  	;mov	ax,4
 25088 0000341B B80400                  	mov	ax,SEARCH_EXE	; success!
 25089 0000341E EB12                    	jmp	short FTYPE_EXIT
 25090                                  
 25091                                  	; Compare .BAT
 25092                                  FTYPE_BAT:			; still looking... now for '.bat'
 25093 00003420 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 25094 00003422 BE[8784]                	mov	si,batext ; ".BAT"
 25095 00003425 A7                      	cmpsw
 25096 00003426 7508                    	jnz	short FTYPE_FAIL
 25097 00003428 A7                      	cmpsw
 25098 00003429 7505                    	jnz	short FTYPE_FAIL
 25099                                  	;mov	ax,2
 25100 0000342B B80200                  	mov	ax,SEARCH_BAT	; success!
 25101 0000342E EB02                    	jmp	short FTYPE_EXIT
 25102                                  
 25103                                  FTYPE_FAIL:			; file doesn't match what we need
 25104                                  	;mov	ax,ANULL ; 0
 25105                                  	; 18/03/2023
 25106 00003430 29C0                    	sub	ax,ax  ; ax = 0
 25107                                  FTYPE_EXIT:
 25108                                  	; 18/03/2023
 25109                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 25110 00003432 803E[058E]01            	cmp	byte [ext_entered],1
 25111                                  				;AN005; was an extension entered?
 25112 00003437 740A                    	jz	short FTYPE_DONE
 25113                                  				;AN005; no - exit
 25114                                  	;cmp	ax,ANULL	;AN005; was any match found
 25115 00003439 21C0                    	and	ax,ax  ; ax = 0 ?
 25116 0000343B 7406                    	jz	short FTYPE_DONE
 25117                                  				;AN005; no - exit
 25118 0000343D A2[058E]                	mov	[ext_entered],al
 25119                                  				;AN005; save the match type found
 25120 00003440 B80800                  	mov	ax,SEARCH_COM	;AN005; send back best was found to stop search
 25121                                  FTYPE_DONE:
 25122 00003443 5E                      	pop	si
 25123 00003444 5F                      	pop	di
 25124 00003445 C3                      	retn
 25125                                  
 25126                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 25127                                  
 25128                                  ; STRIP copies the source string (argv[0]) into the destination buffer,
 25129                                  ; replacing any extension with wildcards.
 25130                                  ;
 25131                                  ; ENTRY:
 25132                                  ;	BX	--	maximum length of destination buffer
 25133                                  ;	DS:SI	--	address of destination buffer
 25134                                  ;	argv[0] --	command name to be stripped
 25135                                  ; EXIT:
 25136                                  ;	CF	--	set if failure, clear if successful
 25137                                  ; NOTE(S):
 25138                                  
 25139                                  	; 18/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 25140                                  
 25141                                  STRIP:
 25142 00003446 50                      	push	ax
 25143 00003447 53                      	push	bx
 25144 00003448 51                      	push	cx
 25145 00003449 52                      	push	dx
 25146 0000344A 57                      	push	di
 25147 0000344B 56                      	push	si
 25148                                  	;pushf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 25149                                  		
 25150                                  	; 05/05/2023
 25151                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 25152 0000344C C606[058E]01            	mov	byte [ext_entered],1
 25153                                  				;AN005; assume no extension on file name
 25154                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 25155                                  	;mov	dx,[ARG_ARGV]
 25156                                  	;mov	dx,ds:arg.argv[0].argpointer
 25157                                  				; save pointer to beginning of argstring
 25158                                  	;mov	dx,[ARGV0_ARGPOINTER]
 25159 00003451 8B16[4F8E]              	mov	dx,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.argpointer]
 25160                                  	;mov	di,ds:arg.argv[0].argstartel
 25161                                  				; beginning of last pathname element
 25162                                  	;mov	di,[ARGV0_ARGSTARTEL] ; beginning of last pathname element
 25163 00003455 8B3E[528E]              	mov	di,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.argstartel]
 25164 00003459 803D00                  	cmp	byte [di],0	; *STARTEL == NULL means no command
 25165 0000345C 743D                    	je	short STRIP_ERROR
 25166 0000345E 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx		; compute where end of argstring lies
 25167                                  	;add	cx,ds:arg.argv[0].arglen
 25168                                  	;add	cx,[ARGV0_ARGLEN]
 25169 00003460 030E[548E]              	add	cx,[ARG+ARGV_ELE.arglen]
 25170 00003464 29F9                    	sub	cx,di		; and then find length of last element
 25171 00003466 41                      	inc	cx		; include null as well
 25172 00003467 B02E                    	mov	al,'.'
 25173                                  	;mov	al,DOT		; let's find the filetype extension
 25174 00003469 FC                      	cld
 25175 0000346A F2AE                    	repnz	scasb		; wind up pointing to either null or dot
 25176                                  
 25177                                  	; 18/03/2023
 25178                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 25179 0000346C E307                    	jcxz	PROCESS_EXT	;AN005; if no extension found, just continue
 25180 0000346E B000                    	mov	al,0 ; 18/03/2023
 25181                                  	;mov	byte [ext_entered],0
 25182 00003470 A2[058E]                	mov	[ext_entered],al
 25183                                  				;AN005; we found an extension
 25184                                  	;;mov	al,ANULL	;AN005; continue scanning until the
 25185                                  	;mov	al,0
 25186 00003473 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb		;AN005; end of line is reached.
 25187                                  PROCESS_EXT:
 25188                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 25189 00003475 89F9                    	mov	cx,di		; pointer to end of argstring yields
 25190 00003477 29D1                    	sub	cx,dx		; number of bytes to be copied
 25191 00003479 83EB04                  	sub	bx,4		; can argstring fit into dest. buffer?
 25192 0000347C 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx
 25193 0000347E 7F1B                    	jg	short STRIP_ERROR
 25194                                  				; if not, we must have a bad pathname
 25195 00003480 89F7                    	mov	di,si		; destination buffer
 25196 00003482 89D6                    	mov	si,dx		; source is beginning of pathname
 25197 00003484 FC                      	cld
 25198 00003485 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; SI=arg,DI=buffer,CX=argend-argbeg
 25199                                  
 25200                                  	; 18/03/2023
 25201                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 25202 00003487 803E[058E]01            	cmp	byte [ext_entered],1
 25203                                  				;AN005; if an extension was entered
 25204 0000348C 750A                    	jne	short SKIP_WILDS
 25205                                  				;AN005;    don't set up wildcard ext.
 25206                                  
 25207                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 25208 0000348E 4F                      	dec	di		; overwrite null or dot
 25209 0000348F AA                      	stosb			; with a dot
 25210 00003490 B03F                    	mov	al,'?'
 25211                                  	;mov	al,WILDCHAR	; now add wildcards
 25212 00003492 AA                      	stosb
 25213 00003493 AA                      	stosb
 25214 00003494 AA                      	stosb
 25215 00003495 B000                    	mov	al,0
 25216                                  	;mov	al,ANULL	; and a terminating null	
 25217 00003497 AA                      	stosb
 25218                                  SKIP_WILDS:
 25219                                  	;popf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 25220 00003498 F8                      	clc
 25221 00003499 EB01                    	jmp	short STRIP_EXIT ; chill out...
 25222                                  
 25223                                  STRIP_ERROR:
 25224                                  	;popf	; ** ; 18/03/2023
 25225 0000349B F9                      	stc
 25226                                  STRIP_EXIT:
 25227 0000349C 5E                      	pop	si
 25228 0000349D 5F                      	pop	di
 25229 0000349E 5A                      	pop	dx
 25230 0000349F 59                      	pop	cx
 25231 000034A0 5B                      	pop	bx
 25232 000034A1 58                      	pop	ax
 25233 000034A2 C3                      	retn
 25234                                  
 25235                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 25236                                  
 25237                                  ; SAVE_ARGS attempts to preserve the existing argv[]/argvcnt/argbuffer
 25238                                  ;
 25239                                  ; structure in newly allocated memory. The argv[] structure is found at the
 25240                                  ; beginning of this area. The caller indicates how much extra space is
 25241                                  ; needed in the resulting structure; Save_Args returns a segment number and
 25242                                  ; an offset into that area, indicating where the caller may preserve its own
 25243                                  ; data. Note that <argvcnt> can be found at <offset-2>.
 25244                                  ; ENTRY:
 25245                                  ;   BX	    --	size (in bytes) of extra area to allocate
 25246                                  ; EXIT:
 25247                                  ;   AX	    --	segment of new area.
 25248                                  ;   CF	    --	set if unable to save a copy.
 25249                                  ; NOTE(S):
 25250                                  ;   1)	The allocated area will be AT LEAST the size requested -- since
 25251                                  ;	the underlying MSDOS call, <alloc> returns an integral number of
 25252                                  ;	paragraphs.
 25253                                  ;   2)	It is an error if MSDOS can't allocate AT LEAST as much memory
 25254                                  ;	as the caller of Save_Args requests.
 25255                                  ;   3)	AX is undefined if CF indicates an error.
 25256                                  
 25257                                  	; 19/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 25258                                  
 25259                                  SAVE_ARGS:

 25897                                  ; ****************************************************************
 25898                                  ; *
 25899                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 ON_OFF
 25900                                  ; *
 25901                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 Parse the command line for an optional ON or
 25902                                  ; *		 OFF string for the BREAK, VERIFY, and ECHO
 25903                                  ; *		 routines.
 25904                                  ; *
 25905                                  ; * INPUT:	 command line at offset 81H
 25906                                  ; *		 PARSE_BREAK control block
 25907                                  ; *
 25908                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 If carry is clear
 25909                                  ; *		    If ON is found
 25910                                  ; *		       Zero flag set
 25911                                  ; *		    If OFF is found
 25912                                  ; *		       Zero flag clear
 25913                                  ; *		 If carry set
 25914                                  ; *		    If nothing on command line
 25915                                  ; *		       CL set to zero
 25916                                  ; *		    If error
 25917                                  ; *		       CL contains error value from parse

 26249                                  ; TENV.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 26250                                  ;============================================================================
 26251                                  ; 02/10/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 26252                                  
 26253                                  ;	Environment utilities and misc. routines
 26254                                  
 26255                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 26256                                  ; ****************************************************************
 26257                                  ; *
 26258                                  ; * ROUTINE:	 UPCONV     (ADDED BY EMG 4.00)
 26259                                  ; *
 26260                                  ; * FUNCTION:	 This routine returns the upper case equivalent of
 26261                                  ; *		 the character in AL from the file upper case table
 26262                                  ; *		 in DOS if character if above  ascii 128, else
 26263                                  ; *		 subtracts 20H if between "a" and "z".
 26264                                  ; *
 26265                                  ; * INPUT:	 AL	      char to be upper cased
 26266                                  ; *		 FUCASE_ADDR  set to the file upper case table
 26267                                  ; *
 26268                                  ; * OUTPUT:	 AL	      upper cased character
 26269                                  ; *
 26270                                  ; ****************************************************************
 26271                                  ;
 26272                                  ;assume	ds:trangroup				;AN000;
 26273                                  ;
 26274                                  ;upconv	proc	near				;AN000;
 26275                                  ;
 26276                                  ;	cmp	al,80h				;AN000;  see if char is > ascii 128
 26277                                  ;	jb	oth_fucase			;AN000;  no - upper case math
 26278                                  ;	sub	al,80h				;AN000;  only upper 128 chars in table
 26279                                  ;	push	ds				;AN000;
 26280                                  ;	push	bx				;AN000;
 26281                                  ;	mov	ds,[resseg]			;AN000;  get resident data segment
 26282                                  ;assume	ds:resgroup				;AN000;
 26283                                  ;	lds	bx,dword ptr FUCase_Addr+1	;AN000;  get table address
 26284                                  ;	add	bx,2				;AN000;  skip over first word
 26285                                  ;	xlat	ds:byte ptr [bx]		;AN000;  convert to upper case
 26286                                  ;	pop	bx				;AN000;
 26287                                  ;	pop	ds				;AN000;
 26288                                  ;assume	ds:trangroup				;AN000;
 26289                                  ;	jmp	short upconv_end		;AN000;  we finished - exit
 26290                                  ;
 26291                                  ;oth_fucase:					;AN000;
 26292                                  ;	cmp	al,small_a			;AC000; if between "a" and "z",
 26293                                  ;	jb	upconv_end			;AC000;     subtract 20h to get
 26294                                  ;	cmp	al,small_z			;AC000;    upper case equivalent.
 26295                                  ;	ja	upconv_end			;AC000;
 26296                                  ;	sub	al,20h				;AC000; Change lower-case to upper
 26297                                  ;
 26298                                  ;upconv_end:					;AN000;
 26299                                  ;	ret
 26300                                  ;
 26301                                  ;upconv	endp					;AN000;
 26302                                  
 26303                                  
 26304                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 26305                                  
 26306                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - COMMAND.COM, transient portion/segment offset 29F2h
 26307                                  
 26308                                  ; 21/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 26309                                  %if 0
 26310                                  
 26311                                  UPCONV:
 26312                                  	cmp	al,80h
 26313                                  	jb	short OTH_UCASE
 26314                                  	sub	al,80h
 26315                                  	push	ds
 26316                                  	push	bx
 26317                                  	mov	ds,[RESSEG]
 26318                                  	lds	bx,[UPPERCASETBL]
 26319                                  	add	bx,2
 26320                                  	xlat
 26321                                  	pop	bx
 26322                                  	pop	ds
 26323                                  	jmp	short UPCONV_RETN
 26324                                  
 26325                                  OTH_UCASE:
 26326                                  	cmp	al,'a'
 26327                                  	jb	short UPCONV_RETN
 26328                                  	cmp	al,'z'
 26329                                  	ja	short UPCONV_RETN
 26330                                  	sub	al,20h
 26331                                  
 26332                                  UPCONV_RETN:
 26333                                  	retn
 26334                                  
 26335                                  %endif

 26355                                  ;***	MODIFICATION HISTORY
 26356                                  
 26357                                  ;11/01/83 EE  Added a few lines at the end of SCANSRC2 to get multiple
 26358                                  ;	     file concatenations (eg copy a.*+b.*+c.*) to work properly.
 26359                                  ;11/02/83 EE  Commented out the code in CPARSE which added drive designators
 26360                                  ;	     to tokens which begin with path characters so that PARSELINE
 26361                                  ;	     will work correctly.
 26362                                  ;11/04/83 EE  Commented out the code in CPARSE that considered paren's to be
 26363                                  ;	     individual tokens. That distinction is no longer needed for
 26364                                  ;	     FOR loop processing.
 26365                                  ;11/17/83 EE  CPARSE upper case conversion is now flag dependent. Flag is
 26366                                  ;	     1 when Cparse is called from COPY.
 26367                                  ;11/17/83 EE  Took out the comment chars around code described in 11/04/83
 26368                                  ;	     mod. It now is conditional on flag like previous mod.
 26369                                  ;11/21/83 NP  Added printf
 26370                                  ;12/09/83 EE  CPARSE changed to use CPYFLAG to determine when a colon should
 26371                                  ;	     be added to a token.
 26372                                  ;05/30/84 MZ  Initialize all copy variables. Fix confusion with destclosed
 26373                                  ;	     NOTE: DestHand is the destination handle. There are two
 26374                                  ;	     special values: -1 meaning destination was never opened and
 26375                                  ;	     0 which means that the destination has been openned and
 26376                                  ;	     closed.
 26377                                  ;06/01/84 MZ  Above reasoning totally specious. Returned things to normal
 26378                                  ;06/06/86 EG  Change to fix problem of source switches /a and /b getting
 26379                                  ;	     lost on large and multiple file (wildcard) copies.
 26380                                  ;06/09/86 EG  Change to use xnametrans call to verify that source and
 26381                                  ;	     destination are not equal.
 26382                                  ;
 26383                                  ;06/24/90 DO  If the destination of a file concatenation is the same as
 26384                                  ;	     first source file AND we run out of disk space before
 26385                                  ;	     completing the concatenation, restore the first source
 26386                                  ;	     file as best we can. See SeekEnd and CopErr. Bug #859.
 26387                                  ;
 26388                                  ;M031 SR 10/11/90  Bug #3069. Use deny write sharing mode to open files
 26389                                  ;		instead of compatibility mode. This gives lesser sharing
 26390                                  ;		violations when files are opened for read on a copy.

 26532                                  					;  destination path buffer

 26544                                  
 26545                                  	;	Disallow "copy file1+" as file overwriting itself.
 26546                                  	;

 26548                                  	;	equivalent to "copy file1+file2".)

 27256                                  	; 26/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 27257                                  CLOSEDEST:
 27258                                  
 27259                                  	;	We are called to close the destination.
 27260                                  	;	We need to note whether or not there is any internal data left
 27261                                  	;	to be flushed out.
 27262                                  
 27263 00003C2F 803E[E08A]00            	cmp	byte [DestClosed],0

 27267 00003C3C 742E                    	jz	short BINCLOS		;   on destination
 27268 00003C3E 8B1E[E38A]              	mov	bx,[NXTADD]
 27269                                  ;
 27270                                  ;M048 -- TryFlush changes the state of ConCat flag. So, before we append a
 27271                                  ;^Z, let's always flush out. This way if the ConCat flag changes, we will
 27272                                  ;just return without appending a ^Z incorrectly for the first file (since we
 27273                                  ;are concatenating now). Also, in case it is a single file copy, we will
 27274                                  ;anyway write the ^Z out separately. The only drawback is that there is a
 27275                                  ;performance overhead on single ASCII file copies which now always involve
 27276                                  ;2 writes instead of 1 before. Is this really that important?
 27277                                  ;
 27278                                  ;M048;	cmp	bx,[BYTCNT]		; is memory full?
 27279                                  ;M048;	jne	short PutZ
 27280                                  
 27281                                  	; 26/03/2023
 27282                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 27283                                  	;cmp	bx,[BYTCNT]		; is memory full?
 27284                                  	;jne	short PUTZ
 27285                                  
 27286                                  	; 26/03/2023

 27718

 27720                                  ;	on first destination create otherwise), and user trying to specify

 27741 00003E4D 7514                    	jnz	short SeekEnd

 27770                                  ;	with in case the copy should fail.

 27776                                  	; MSDOS 3.3  MSDOS 6.0
 27777                                  
 27778 00003E73 803E[D38A]00            	cmp	byte [RDEOF],0

 27782                                  ;	file pointer location

 27840                                  
 27841                                  ;	Destination was also the first source. Do the best we can to
 27842                                  ;	restore it. Truncate it back to the size we took from it (which
 27843                                  ;	may have been due to a Ctrl-Z, so may not have included the whole
 27844                                  ;	file). If a Ctrl-Z was originally read, put it back.

 27855 00003EDC 41                      	inc	cx			; CX = # bytes to write = 1

 27857 00003EE0 B440                    	mov	ah,Write ; 40h
 27858 00003EE2 CD21                    	int	21h			; write ctrl-z
 27859                                  ceClose0:

 27865                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 27866                                  ceClose:

 27869                                  				; BX = file handle
 27870                                  NoClose:

 27872 00003EF2 B441                    	mov	ah,Unlink ; 41h 	; and delete it
 27873 00003EF4 CD21                    	int	21h		; DOS -	2+ - DELETE A FILE (UNLINK)
 27874                                  				; DS:DX	-> ASCIZ pathname of file to delete (no	wildcards allowed)
 27875 00003EF6 C606[DF8A]00            	mov	byte [CFLAG],0
 27876                                  EndCopyJ:
 27877 00003EFB E96DFA                  	jmp	ENDCOPY

 27892                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 27893                                  
 27894                                  ;***	SetAsc - set Ascii, Binary, Inexact flags based on switches
 27895                                  ;
 27896                                  ;	Given switch vector in AX,
 27897                                  ;	  Set Ascii flag if /a is set
 27898                                  ;	  Clear Ascii flag if /b is set
 27899                                  ;	  Binary set if /b specified
 27900                                  ;	  Leave Ascii unchanged if neither or both are set
 27901                                  ; 	Also sets Inexact if Ascii is ever set. 
 27902                                  ;	AL = Ascii on exit, flags set
 27903                                  
 27904                                  	; 26/03/2023
 27905                                  SETASC:
 27906                                  	;and	al,SWITCHA+SWITCHB ; 0Ch ; AL = /a, /b flags
 27907 00003F01 240C                    	and	al,0Ch ; 4+8
 27908 00003F03 7A10                    	jpe	short LOADSW	; even parity - both or neither
 27909 00003F05 50                      	push	ax
 27910                                  	;and	al,SWITCHB  ; 8
 27911 00003F06 2408                    	and	al,8
 27912 00003F08 A2[E48D]                	mov	[BINARY],al
 27913 00003F0B 58                      	pop	ax
 27914                                  	;and	al,SWITCHA
 27915 00003F0C 2404                    	and	al,4	
 27916 00003F0E A2[E88D]                	mov	[ASCII],al
 27917 00003F11 0806[E28D]              	or	[INEXACT],al
 27918                                  LOADSW:
 27919 00003F15 A0[E88D]                	mov	al,[ASCII]
 27920 00003F18 08C0                    	or	al,al
 27921 00003F1A C3                      	retn
 27922                                  
 27923                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 27924                                  
 27925                                  	; 27/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 27926                                  BUILDDEST:
 27927 00003F1B 803E[C78C]FF            	cmp	byte [DestIsDir],-1 ; 0FFh
 27928 00003F20 750C                    	jnz	short KNOWABOUTDEST	; figuring already done
 27929 00003F22 BF[A289]                	mov	di,USERDIR1
 27930 00003F25 BD[C78C]                	mov	bp,DestVars
 27931 00003F28 E8DF00                  	call	BUILDPATH
 27932 00003F2B E85CE5                  	call	RestUDir1
 27933                                  
 27934                                  ;	We now know all about the destination
 27935                                  
 27936                                  KNOWABOUTDEST:
 27937 00003F2E 30C0                    	xor	al,al
 27938 00003F30 8606[268D]              	xchg	al,[FIRSTDEST]
 27939 00003F34 08C0                    	or	al,al
 27940 00003F36 7503                    	jnz	short FIRSTDST
 27941 00003F38 E98C00                  	jmp	NOFIRSTDEST
 27942                                  
 27943                                  FIRSTDST:
 27944                                  ;	Create an fcb of the original dest.
 27945                                  
 27946 00003F3B 8B36[C98C]              	mov	si,[DestTail]
 27947 00003F3F BF[868B]                	mov	di,DestFcb
 27948 00003F42 B80029                  	mov	ax,Parse_File_Descriptor*256 ; 2900h
 27949 00003F45 CD21                    	int	21h		; DOS -	PARSE FILENAME
 27950                                  				; DS:SI	-> string to parse
 27951                                  				; ES:DI	-> buffer to fill with unopened	FCB
 27952                                  				; AL = bit mask	to control parsing
 27953 00003F47 803C00                  	cmp	byte [si],0
 27954 00003F4A 7406                    	jz	short GOODPARSE
 27955                                  
 27956                                  	; 27/03/2023	
 27957                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 27958                                  	;mov	byte [di+1],"|"	;AD052; must be illegal file name character
 27959                                  	
 27960 00003F4C BA[6F7F]                	mov	dx,FULLDIR_PTR		;AN052; issue "file creation error"
 27961 00003F4F E953FF                  	jmp	COPYERR			;AN052;
 27962                                  GOODPARSE:
 27963 00003F52 A1[CC8C]                	mov	ax,[DestBuf]		; AX = possible "d:"
 27964 00003F55 80FC3A                  	cmp	ah,':'
 27965 00003F58 7402                    	jz	short DRVSPEC4
 27966 00003F5A B040                    	mov	al,'@'  ; 40h
 27967                                  DRVSPEC4:
 27968                                  ;	AX = "d:" for following FCB drive computation
 27969                                  
 27970 00003F5C 8A0E[E88D]              	mov	cl,[ASCII]		; CL = saved Ascii flag
 27971 00003F60 0C20                    	or	al,20h
 27972 00003F62 2C60                    	sub	al,60h
 27973 00003F64 A2[868B]                	mov	[DestFcb],al		; store drive # in FCB
 27974                                  
 27975                                  ;*	Figure out what copy mode we're in.
 27976                                  ;	Letters stand for unambiguous, * for ambiguous pathnames.
 27977                                  ;	+n stands for additional sources delimited by +'s.
 27978                                  ;
 27979                                  ;	copy a b	not concatenating
 27980                                  ;	copy a *	not concatenating
 27981                                  ;	copy * a	concatenating
 27982                                  ;	copy * *	not concatenating
 27983                                  ;	copy a+n b	concatenating
 27984                                  ;	copy *+n a	concatenating
 27985                                  ;	copy *+n *	concatenating, Mel Hallerman style
 27986                                  
 27987                                  ;	Bugbug:  copy *.a+a.b *.t  picks up only 1st *.a file.. Why?
 27988                                  ;		 copy a.b+*.a *.t  picks up all *.a files.
 27989                                  
 27990 00003F67 A0[CB8C]                	mov	al,[DestInfo]		; AL = destination CParse flags
 27991 00003F6A 8A26[2E8D]              	mov	ah,[SrcInfo]		; AH = source CParse flags
 27992 00003F6E 250202                  	and	ax,202h			; AH,AL = source,dest wildcard flags
 27993 00003F71 08C0                    	or	al,al
 27994 00003F73 7413                    	jz	short NOTMELCOPY 	; no destination wildcard
 27995                                  
 27996                                  ;	Destination is wildcarded.
 27997                                  	
 27998 00003F75 38E0                    	cmp	al,ah
 27999 00003F77 750F                    	jnz	short NOTMELCOPY ; no source wildcard
 28000                                  
 28001                                  ;	Source and destination are both wildcarded.
 28002                                  
 28003 00003F79 803E[E98D]00            	cmp	byte [PLUS],0
 28004 00003F7E 7408                    	jz	short NOTMELCOPY	; no +'s in source
 28005                                  
 28006                                  ;	Source and destination are wildcarded, and source includes +'s.
 28007                                  ;	It's Mel Hallorman copy time.
 28008                                  
 28009 00003F80 FE06[278D]              	inc	byte [MELCOPY]		; 'Mel copy' = true
 28010 00003F84 30C0                    	xor	al,al
 28011 00003F86 EB06                    	jmp	short SETCONC
 28012                                  
 28013                                  NOTMELCOPY:
 28014 00003F88 3402                    	xor	al,2			; AL=0 -> ambiguous destination, 2 otherwise
 28015 00003F8A 20E0                    	and	al,ah
 28016 00003F8C D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; AL=1 -> ambiguous source, unambiguous dest
 28017                                  					;   (implies concatenation)
 28018                                  SETCONC:
 28019 00003F8E 0A06[E98D]              	or	al,[PLUS]		; "+" always infers concatenation
 28020                                  
 28021                                  ;	Whew. AL = 1 if concatenating, 0 if not.
 28022                                  
 28023 00003F92 A2[D58A]                	mov	[Concat],al
 28024 00003F95 D0E0                    	shl	al,1
 28025 00003F97 D0E0                    	shl	al,1
 28026 00003F99 A2[E28D]                	mov	[INEXACT],al		; concatenation -> inexact copy
 28027 00003F9C 803E[E48D]00            	cmp	byte [BINARY],0
 28028 00003FA1 7524                    	jne	short NOFIRSTDEST 	; explicit binary copy	
 28029                                  
 28030 00003FA3 A2[E88D]                	mov	[ASCII],al		; otherwise, concatenate in ascii mode	
 28031 00003FA6 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 28032 00003FA8 751D                    	jnz	short NOFIRSTDEST 	; Ascii flag set before, data read correctly	
 28033 00003FAA 08C0                    	or	al,al
 28034 00003FAC 7419                    	jz	short NOFIRSTDEST 	; Ascii flag did not change state
 28035                                  
 28036                                  ;	At this point there may already be binary read data in the read
 28037                                  ;	buffer. We need to find the first ^Z (if there is one) and trim the
 28038                                  ;	amount of data in the buffer correctly.
 28039                                  
 28040 00003FAE 8B0E[E38A]              	mov	cx,[NXTADD]
 28041 00003FB2 E313                    	jcxz	NOFIRSTDEST		; no data, everything ok
 28042 00003FB4 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah
 28043 00003FB6 06                      	push	es
 28044 00003FB7 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 28045 00003FB9 8E06[C28A]              	mov	es,[TPA]
 28046 00003FBD F2AE                    	repne	scasb			; scan for EOF
 28047 00003FBF 07                      	pop	es
 28048 00003FC0 7505                    	jnz	short NOFIRSTDEST 	; no ^z in buffer, everything ok
 28049 00003FC2 4F                      	dec	di			; point at ^z
 28050 00003FC3 893E[E38A]              	mov	[NXTADD],di		; new buffer length
 28051                                  
 28052                                  NOFIRSTDEST:
 28053 00003FC7 BB[CA8B]                	mov	bx,DIRBUF+1		; Source of replacement chars
 28054 00003FCA 803E[D58A]00            	cmp	byte [Concat],0
 28055 00003FCF 7403                    	jz	short GOTCHRSRC		; Not a concat
 28056 00003FD1 BB[108C]                	mov	bx,SDIRBUF+1		; Source of replacement chars
 28057                                  GOTCHRSRC:
 28058 00003FD4 BE[878B]                	mov	si,DestFcb+1		; Original dest name
 28059 00003FD7 8B3E[C98C]              	mov	di,[DestTail]		; Where to put result
 28060

 28063                                  	; 27/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 28064                                  BUILDNAME:
 28065 00003FDB B90800                  	mov	cx,8
 28066                                  BUILDMAIN:
 28067 00003FDE AC                      	lodsb
 28068 00003FDF 3C3F                    	cmp	al,'?'
 28069 00003FE1 7502                    	jne	short NOTAMBIG
 28070 00003FE3 8A07                    	mov	al,[bx]
 28071                                  NOTAMBIG:

 28084                                  	;mov	al,[DOT_CHR]
 28085                                  	; 27/03/2023
 28086 00003FF4 B02E                    	mov	al,'.' ; 2Eh ; dot_chr
 28087 00003FF6 AA                      	stosb
 28088                                  BUILDEXT:
 28089 00003FF7 AC                      	lodsb
 28090 00003FF8 3C3F                    	cmp	al,'?'
 28091 00003FFA 7502                    	jne	short NOTAMBIGE
 28092 00003FFC 8A07                    	mov	al,[bx]
 28093                                  NOTAMBIGE:
 28094 00003FFE 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '
 28095 00004000 7401                    	je	short NOSTOREE
 28096 00004002 AA                      	stosb
 28097                                  NOSTOREE:

 28410                                  ;============================================================================
 28411                                  ; CPARSE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 28412                                  ;============================================================================
 28413                                  ; 30/09/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28414                                  ; 28/03/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 28415                                  
 28416                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------;
 28417                                  ; ENTRY:								;
 28418                                  ;	DS:SI	Points input buffer					;
 28419                                  ;	ES:DI	Points to the token buffer				;
 28420                                  ;	BL	Special delimiter for this call 			;
 28421                                  ;		    Always checked last 				;
 28422                                  ;		    set it to space if there is no special delimiter	;
 28423                                  ; EXIT: 								;
 28424                                  ;	DS:SI	Points to next char in the input buffer 		;
 28425                                  ;	ES:DI	Points to the token buffer				;
 28426                                  ;	[STARTEL] Points to start of last element of path in token	;
 28427                                  ;		points to a NUL for no element strings 'd:' 'd:/'       ;
 28428                                  ;	CX	Character count 					;
 28429                                  ;	BH	Condition Code						;
 28430                                  ;			Bit 1H of BH set if switch character		;
 28431                                  ;				Token buffer contains char after	;
 28432                                  ;				switch character			;
 28433                                  ;				BP has switch bits set (ORing only)	;
 28434                                  ;			Bit 2H of BH set if ? or * in token		;
 28435                                  ;				if * found element ? filled		;
 28436                                  ;			Bit 4H of BH set if path sep in token		;
 28437                                  ;			Bit 80H of BH set if the special delimiter	;
 28438                                  ;			   was skipped at the start of this token	;
 28439                                  ;		Token buffer always starts d: for non switch tokens	;
 28440                                  ;	CARRY SET							;
 28441                                  ;	    if CR on input						;
 28442                                  ;		token buffer not altered				;
 28443                                  ;									;
 28444                                  ;	DOES NOT RETURN ON BAD PATH, OR TRAILING SWITCH CHAR ERROR	;
 28445                                  ; MODIFIES:								;
 28446                                  ;	CX, SI, AX, BH, DX and the Carry Flag				;
 28447                                  ;									;
 28448                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------;
 28449                                  
 28450                                  ; Modifications to cparse: recognition of right and left parentheses
 28451                                  ; as integral tokens, and removal of automatic upper-case conversion code.
 28452                                  ;
 28453                                  ; Both modifications were installed in the course of adding a coherent
 28454                                  ; command-line parser to COMMAND.COM which builds a UNIX-style argv[]/argc
 28455                                  ; structure for command-line arguments. This parser relies on cparse to
 28456                                  ; recognize individual tokens.
 28457                                  ;
 28458                                  ; To process for-loops correctly, parentheses must therefore be
 28459                                  ; recognized as tokens. The upper-case conversion code was removed so
 28460                                  ; that commands (such as for and echo) would be able to use the "original"
 28461                                  ; text of the command line.
 28462                                  ;
 28463                                  ; Note also the modification to prevent the automatic conversion of colons
 28464                                  ; into spaces WITHIN THE SOURCE TEXT!
 28465                                  ;
 28466                                  ; Also note that BP is also clobbered if cparse recognizes any switches
 28467                                  ; on the command line.
 28468                                  ;
 28469                                  ; Alan L, OS/MSDOS				    14 August 1983
 28470                                  
 28471                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28472                                  
 28473                                  ; COMEQU.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 28474                                  
 28475                                  ;FSWITCH	EQU	8000h
 28476                                  ;FBADSWITCH	EQU	4000h
 28477                                  
 28478                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 COMMAND.COM (1987) Transient portion offset 3334h
 28479                                  
 28480                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 28481

 28748                                  	;or	bp,FBADSWITCH ; 4000h
 28749 00004315 81CD0040                	or	bp,4000h
 28750 00004319 EBCE                    	jmp	short cperror		; Trailing switch character error
 28751                                  					;   BP = fSwitch but no switch
 28752                                  					;   bit is set (unknown switch)
 28753                                  Store_swt:
 28754 0000431B E82B00                  	call	move_char		; store the character
 28755                                  
 28756                                  ; This upconv call must stay. It is used to identify copy-switches
 28757                                  ; on the command line, and won't store anything into the output buffer.
 28758                                  
 28759                                  	;call	UPCONV_MAPCALL ; MSDOS 3.3 (Retro DOS 3.0)
 28760                                  	; 28/03/2023
 28761 0000431E E8D1E0                  	call	UPCONV 	; MSDOS 6.0 & MSDOS 5.0 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 28762                                  	
 28763 00004321 06                      	push	es
 28764 00004322 57                      	push	di
 28765 00004323 51                      	push	cx
 28766 00004324 0E                      	push	cs
 28767 00004325 07                      	pop	es
 28768                                  	; 28/03/2023
 28769                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 28770                                  	;mov	di,SWITCH_LIST ; "VBAPW"
 28771                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28772 00004326 BF[8B84]                	mov	di,switch_list ; "?VBAPW"
 28773                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 28774                                  	;mov	cx,SWCOUNT ; 5
 28775                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28776 00004329 B90600                  	mov	cx,6  ; SWCOUNT = 6
 28777                                  	;or	bp,FBADSWITCH  ; 4000h
 28778 0000432C 81CD0040                	or	bp,4000h
 28779 00004330 F2AE                    	repne	scasb
 28780 00004332 750B                    	jnz	short out_tokenp
 28781                                  	;and	bp,~FBADSWITCH ; 0BFFFh
 28782 00004334 81E5FFBF                	and	bp,0BFFFh
 28783 00004338 B80100                  	mov	ax,1
 28784 0000433B D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 28785 0000433D 09C5                    	or	bp,ax
 28786                                  out_tokenp:
 28787 0000433F 59                      	pop	cx
 28788 00004340 5F                      	pop	di
 28789 00004341 07                      	pop	es
 28790                                  out_token:
 28791 00004342 B000                    	mov	al,0			; null at the end
 28792 00004344 AA                      	stosb
 28793 00004345 5F                      	pop	di			; restore token buffer pointer	
 28794 00004346 9D                      	popf
 28795 00004347 F8                      	clc				; clear carry flag
 28796 00004348 C3                      	retn
 28797                                  
 28798                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 28799                                  
 28800                                  	; 28/03/2023
 28801                                  move_char:
 28802 00004349 AA                      	stosb				; store char in token buffer
 28803 0000434A 41                      	inc	cx			; increment char count
 28804 0000434B FE06[F88D]              	inc	byte [ELCNT]		; increment element count for * substi
 28805 0000434F C3                      	retn

 28819                                  $P_DBSP1	   equ	20h ; DB_SP_HI	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS blank
 28820                                  $P_DBSP2	   equ	20h ; DB_SP_LO	;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS blank
 28821                                  $P_Period	   equ	"."             ;AN020;
 28822                                  $P_Slash	   equ	"/"             ;AN020;
 28823                                  $P_Space	   equ	" "             ;AN000; SBCS blank
 28824                                  $P_Comma	   equ	","             ;AN000;
 28825                                  $P_Switch	   equ	"/"             ;AN000;
 28826                                  $P_Keyword	   equ	"="             ;AN000;
 28827                                  $P_Colon	   equ	":"             ;AN000;
 28828                                  $P_Plus 	   equ	"+"             ;AN000;
 28829                                  $P_Minus	   equ	"-"             ;AN000;
 28830                                  $P_Rparen	   equ	")"             ;AN000;
 28831                                  $P_Lparen	   equ	"("             ;AN000;

 28833                                  $P_DQuote	   equ	'"'             ;AN000;
