 28839                                  
 28840                                  $P_DOSTBL_File	   equ	4		;AN000; get file uppercase table
 28841                                  $P_DOSTBL_Char	   equ	2		;AN000; get character uppercase table
 28842                                  
 28843                                  $P_error_filespec  equ  1
 28844                                  
 28845                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28846                                  ; PARMS LABEL	BYTE
 28847                                  ;	DW	PARMSX
 28848                                  ;	DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 28849                                  ;	DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 28850                                  ;	DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 28851                                  ;				; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 28852                                  ;				; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 28853                                  ;	DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 28854                                  ;	DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 28855                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28856                                  
 28857                                  struc $P_PARMS_BLK			;AN000;
 28858 00000000 ????                    .$P_PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 28859 00000002 ??                      .$P_Num_Extra:	     resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 28860 00000003 ??                      .$P_Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 28861                                  endstruc 				;AN000;
 28862                                  
 28863                                  $P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 28864                                  $P_I_Use_Default   equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 28865                                  $P_I_Have_Delim    equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 28866                                  $P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 28867                                  
 28868                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28869                                  ; PARMSX LABEL	BYTE
 28870                                  ;	DB	minp,maxp		; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 28871                                  ;	DW	CONTROL 		; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 28872                                  ;	:				; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 28873                                  ;	DB	maxs			; # OF SWITCHES
 28874                                  ;	DW	CONTROL 		; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 28875                                  ;	:				; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 28876                                  ;	DB	maxk			; # OF KEYWORD
 28877                                  ;	DW	CONTROL 		; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 28878                                  ;	:				; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 28879                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28880                                  
 28881                                  struc $P_PARMSX_BLK			;AN000;
 28882 00000000 ??                      .$P_MinP: 	 resb 1	 ; 27/04/2023	;AN000; Minimum positional number
 28883 00000001 ??                      .$P_MaxP: 	 resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 28884 00000002 ??                      .$P_1st_Control: resb 1			;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 28885                                  endstruc				;AN000;
 28886                                  
 28887                                  ; 31/03/2023
 28888                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28889                                  ; << Control field definition >>
 28890                                  ;
 28891                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 28892                                  ;	   DW MATCH_FLAGS	; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 28893                                  ;				; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 28894                                  ;				; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 28895                                  ;				; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 28896                                  ;				; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28897                                  ;				; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28898                                  ;				; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28899                                  ;				; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28900                                  ;				; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28901                                  ;				; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28902                                  ;				; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 28903                                  ;				; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 28904                                  ;				; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 28905                                  ;	   DW FUNCTION_FLAGS
 28906                                  ;				; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 28907                                  ;				; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 28908                                  ;				; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 28909                                  ; (tm10)			; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 28910                                  ;
 28911                                  ;	   DW RESULT		; RESULT BUFFER
 28912                                  ;	   DW VALUES		; VALUE LISTS
 28913                                  ;	   DB nid		; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 28914                                  ;	   DB "...",0		; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 28915                                  ;	   :
 28916                                  ;
 28917                                  ;Note:
 28918                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 28919                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 28920                                  ;
 28921                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 28922                                  ;
 28923                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 28924                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 28925                                  ;
 28926                                  ;
 28927                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 28928                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 28929                                  ;
 28930                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 28931                                  ;
 28932                                  ;
 28933                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 28934                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 28935                                  ;
 28936                                  ;		DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 28937                                  ;		DB   '/A',0
 28938                                  ;
 28939                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 28940                                  ;
 28941                                  ;		DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 28942                                  ;		DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 28943                                  ;
 28944                                  ;
 28945                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 28946                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 28947                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 28948                                  ;
 28949                                  ;
 28950                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 28951                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 28952                                  ;
 28953                                  ;		DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 28954                                  ;		DB    '/A',0
 28955                                  ;		DB    '/B',0
 28956                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28957                                  
 28958                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 28959                                  
 28960                                  $P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 28961                                  $P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 28962                                  $P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 28963                                  $P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 28964                                  $P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 28965                                  $P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 28966                                  $P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 28967                                  $P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 28968                                  $P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 28969                                  $P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 28970                                  $P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 28971                                  $P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 28972                                  
 28973                                  ;**** Function flags
 28974                                  
 28975                                  $P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 28976                                  $P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 28977                                  $P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 28978                                  $P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 28979                                  
 28980                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 28981                                  struc $P_CONTROL_BLK
 28982 00000000 ????                    .$P_Match_Flag:	   resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 28983 00000002 ????                    .$P_Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 28984 00000004 ????                    .$P_Result_Buf:	   resw 1		;AN000; Result buffer address
 28985 00000006 ????                    .$P_Value_List:	   resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 28986 00000008 ??                      .$P_nid:	   resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 28987 00000009 ??                      .$P_KEYorSW:	   resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 28988                                  endstruc
 28989                                  
 28990                                  ; 31/03/2023
 28991                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28992                                  ;
 28993                                  ;VALUES LABEL	BYTE
 28994                                  ;	DB	nval		; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 28995                                  ;	+-
 28996                                  ;	| DB	nrng		; NUMBER OF RANGES
 28997                                  ;	| +DB	ITEM_TAG	; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 28998                                  ;	| +DD	X,Y		; RANGE OF VALUES
 28999                                  ;	|	:
 29000                                  ;	| DB	nnval		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 29001                                  ;	| +DB	ITEM_TAG	; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 29002                                  ;	| +DD	VALUE		; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 29003                                  ;	|	:
 29004                                  ;	| DB	nstrval 	; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 29005                                  ;	| +DB	ITEM_TAG	; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 29006                                  ;	| +DW	STRING		; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 29007                                  ;	+-	:
 29008                                  ;
 29009                                  ;STRING DB	"...",0		; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 29010                                  ;
 29011                                  ;Note:
 29012                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 29013                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 29014                                  ;
 29015                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 29016                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 29017                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 29018                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29019                                  
 29020                                  $P_nval_None	equ 0		;AN000; no value list ID
 29021                                  $P_nval_Range	equ 1		;AN000; range list ID
 29022                                  $P_nval_Value	equ 2		;AN000; value list ID
 29023                                  $P_nval_String	equ 3		;AN000; string list ID
 29024                                  $P_Len_Range	equ 9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 29025                                  $P_Len_Value	equ 5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 29026                                  $P_Len_String	equ 3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 29027                                  $P_No_nrng	equ 0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 29028                                  
 29029                                  struc $P_VAL_LIST
 29030 00000000 ??                      .$P_NumofList:	resb 1		;AN000; number of following choice
 29031 00000001 ????                    .$P_Val_XL:	resw 1		;AN000; lower word of value
 29032 00000003 ????                    .$P_Val_XH:	resw 1		;AN000; higher word of value
 29033 00000005 ????                    .$P_Val_YL:	resw 1		;AN000; lower word of another value
 29034 00000007 ????                    .$P_Val_YH:	resw 1		;AN000; higher word of another value
 29035                                  endstruc
 29036                                  
 29037                                  ; 31/03/2023
 29038                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29039                                  ;
 29040                                  ;RESULT LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 29041                                  ;	DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 29042                                  ;					;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 29043                                  ;					;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 29044                                  ;					;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 29045                                  ;					;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 29046                                  ;					;	9=QUOTED STRING
 29047                                  ;	DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 29048                                  ;
 29049                                  ;	dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 29050                                  ;
 29051                                  ;       +-
 29052                                  ;       | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 29053                                  ;       | or
 29054                                  ;       |	DW i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 29055                                  ;       |				; (ES presents Segment address)
 29056                                  ;       | or
 29057                                  ;       |	DD STRING		; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 29058                                  ;       | or
 29059                                  ;       |	DB drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 29060                                  ;       | or
 29061                                  ;       |	DW YEAR	   		;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 29062                                  ;       |	DB MONTH   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 29063                                  ;       |	DB DATE	   ;(1-31)	 0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 29064                                  ;       | or
 29065                                  ;       |	DB HOUR	   ;(0-23)	 IN CASE OF TIME
 29066                                  ;       |	DB MINUTES    ;(0-59)	 Note: Range check is not performed .
 29067                                  ;       |	DB SECONDS    ;(0-59)	 0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 29068                                  ;       |	DB HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 29069                                  ;       +-
 29070                                  ;
 29071                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 29072                                  ;      list.
 29073                                  ;
 29074                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 29075                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it. For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 29076                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 29077                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29078                                  
 29079                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 29080                                  struc $P_RESULT_BLK;

 29083 00000002 ????                    .$P_SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 29084 00000004 ????????                .$P_Picked_Val:	 resb 4		;AN000; value
 29085                                  endstruc

 29088

 29094                                  $P_File_Spec	 equ 5		;AN000; File Spec
 29095                                  $P_Drive	 equ 6		;AN000; Drive
 29096                                  $P_Date_F	 equ 7		;AN000; Date
 29097                                  $P_Time_F	 equ 8		;AN000; Time

 29103                                  ;
 29104                                  ; following return code will be returned in the AX register.
 29105

 29108                                  $P_Op_Missing	 equ 2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 29109                                  $P_Not_In_SW	 equ 3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 29110                                  $P_Not_In_Key	 equ 4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 29111                                  $P_Out_Of_Range  equ 6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 29112                                  $P_Not_In_Val	 equ 7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 29113                                  $P_Not_In_Str	 equ 8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 29114                                  $P_Syntax	 equ 9		;AN000; Syntax error
 29115                                  $P_RC_EOL	 equ -1		;AN000; End of command line
 29116                                  
 29117                                  ;in second byte of $P_Flags, referenced as $P_Flags2:
 29118                                  $P_equ		 equ 01h	;AN000; "=" packed in string buffet
 29119                                  $P_Neg		 equ 02h	;AN000; Negative value
 29120                                  $P_Time12	 equ 04h	;AN000; set when PM is specified
 29121                                  $P_Key_Cmp	 equ 08h	;AN000; set when keyword compare
 29122                                  $P_SW_Cmp	 equ 10h	;AN000; set when switch compare
 29123                                  $P_Extra	 equ 20h	;AN000; set when extra delimiter found
 29124                                  $P_SW		 equ 40h	;AN000; set when switch found (tm08)
 29125                                  $P_Signed	 equ 80h	;AN000; signed numeric specified
 29126

 29128                                  $P_Make_Lower	 equ 20h	;AN000; make lower case character
 29129                                  $P_Make_Upper	 equ 0FFh-$P_Make_Lower ;AN000; make upper case character

 29177                                  ;***********************************************************************
 29178                                  ; SysParse;
 29179                                  ;
 29180                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 29181                                  ;
 29182                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 29183                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 29184                                  ;	  psdata_seg -> psdata.inc
 29185                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 29186                                  ;
 29187                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 29188                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 29189                                  ;		 is in DS.
 29190                                  ;
 29191                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 29192                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 29193                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 29194                                  ;
 29195                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 29196                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 29197                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 29198                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 29199                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 29200                                  ;
 29201                                  ; Use:	$P_Skip_Delim, $P_Chk_EOL, $P_Chk_Delim, $P_Chk_DBCS
 29202                                  ;	$P_Chk_Swtch, $P_Chk_Pos_Control, $P_Chk_Key_Control
 29203                                  ;	$P_Chk_Sw_Control, $P_Fill_Result
 29204                                  ;
 29205                                  ; Vars: $P_Ordinal(RW), $P_RC(RW), $P_SI_Save(RW), $P_DX(R), $P_Terminator(R)
 29206                                  ;	$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), $P_Flags(RW), $P_Found_SYNONYM(R), $P_Save_EOB(W)
 29207                                  ;
 29208                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 29209                                  ;
 29210                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 29211                                  ;  4/28/87 : $P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 29212                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 29213                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 29214                                  ;  6/12/87 : $P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 29215                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 29216                                  ;  6/12/87 : $P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 29217                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC

 29220                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 29221                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 29222                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add $P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 29223                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 29224                                  ;	     (tm08)

 29242                                  ;

 29245                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 29246                                  ;	     affected: $P_Chk_SW_Control.
 29247                                  ;

 29249                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 29250                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 29251                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 29252                                  ;
 29253                                  ;
 29254                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 29255                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC $P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 29256                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 29257                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 29258                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change $P_Chk_Switch to allow
 29259                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 29260                                  ;
 29261                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 29262                                  ;	     In PROC $P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 29263                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 29264                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 29265                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 29266                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 29267                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 29268                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 29269                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 29270                                  ;
 29271                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 29272                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 29273                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 29274                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 29275                                  ;	     segment.
 29276                                  ;

 29830                                  ; $P_Fill_Result

 29832                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 29833                                  ;
 29834                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag

 29840                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has secondsn,

 30289                                  ; $P_Value / $P_SValue

 30955                                  ; $P_Get_DecNum:
 30956                                  ;
 30957                                  ; Function:  Read a chcrater code from psdata_seg:SI until specified delimiter
 30958                                  ;	     or NULL encountered. And make a decimal number.
 30959                                  ;
 30960                                  ; Input:     psdata_seg:SI -> $P_STRING_BUF
 30961                                  ;
 30962                                  ; Output:    BL = delimiter code or NULL
 30963                                  ;	     AX = Decimal number
 30964                                  ;	     SI advanced to the next number
 30965                                  ;	     CY = 1 : Syntax error, AL = Latest examineed number
 30966                                  ;
 30967                                  ; Use:	$P_0099
 30968                                  ;***********************************************************************
 30969                                  
 30970                                  	; 03/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM

 30977 00004A7C 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?

 30996                                  	;jmp	short $P_Neither_Delims ;AN023;
 30997

 30999                                  ;Regardless of the date delimiter character specified in the country
 31000                                  ;dependent information, check for the presence of any one of these

 31004                                  
 31005 00004A97 3C2F                    	cmp	al,$P_Slash ; '/'	;AN020;is this a date delimiter character?

 31007                                  
 31008                                  $P_Do_Time_Delim1:  ; 03/04/2023

 31011

 31013 00004A9F E804FE                  	call	$P_0099 		;AN000; convert it to binary
 31014 00004AA2 721C                    	jc	short $P_GetNum_Exit	;AN000; if error exit
 31015                                  
 31016 00004AA4 B400                    	mov	ah,0			;AN000;
 31017 00004AA6 91                      	xchg	ax,cx			;AN000;

 31022

 31029

 31035 00004ABA EB04                    	jmp	short $P_GetNum_Exit	;AN000;
 31036

 31659                                  ; $P_Chk_Switch;
 31660                                  ;
 31661                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 31662                                  ;	    $P_STRING_BUF
 31663                                  ;
 31664                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 31665                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within $P_String_Buf
 31666                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 31667                                  ;
 31668                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 31669                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 31670                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 31671                                  ;
 31672                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 31673                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 31674                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 31675                                  ;
 31676                                  ; Vars:  $P_Terminator(W)
 31677                                  ;
 31678                                  ; Use:	 $P_0099
 31679                                  ;***********************************************************************
 31680                                  
 31681                                  	; 06/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 31682

 31684                                  	; 18/04/2023
 31685 00004D8D 8D2E[2286]              	lea	bp,$P_STRING_BUF	;AN020;AC034; BP=OFFSET of $P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 31686

 31688 00004D93 7418                    	je	short $P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 31689                                  
 31690 00004D95 3C2F                    	cmp     al,$P_Switch ; '/'	;AN000;
 31691 00004D97 7512                    	jne	short $P_STRUC_L5	;AN000;
 31692                                  
 31693 00004D99 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash, now see if might be in date string
 31694 00004D9A 50                      	push	ax			;AN020;save input char
 31695 00004D9B 2E8A47FF                	mov	al,[cs:bx-1]		;AN026;AL=char before the current char
 31696 00004D9F E804FB                  	call	$P_0099 		;AN020;return carry set if not numeric
 31697 00004DA2 7205                    	jc	short $P_STRUC_L7	;AN000;
 31698                                  
 31699 00004DA4 8A04                    	mov	al,[si]			;AN020;AL=char after the current char

 31701                                  $P_STRUC_L7:				;AN000;
 31702 00004DA9 58                      	pop	ax			;AN020;restore AL to input char
 31703                                  	;jmp	short $P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 31704                                  	; 18/04/2023
 31705 00004DAA C3                      	retn
 31706

 31708 00004DAB F8                      	clc				;AN020;not a slash

 31711 00004DAC C3                      	retn
 31712

 31728                                  ; $P_Chk_DBCS:

 31731                                  ;

 31774                                  $P_DBCS02:				;AN000;

 31776 00004DE5 2E891E[1686]            	mov	[cs:$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 31777                                  $P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 31778 00004DEA 2E8B36[1486]            	mov	si,[cs:$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 31779 00004DEF 2E8E1E[1686]            	mov	ds,[cs:$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 31780                                  $P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 31781 00004DF4 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0 		;AN000; zero vector ?
 31782 00004DF7 7410                    	je	short $P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 31783 00004DF9 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 31784 00004DFB 7208                    	jb	short $P_DBCS01		;AN000; Check if AL is in
 31785 00004DFD 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 31786 00004E00 7703                    	ja	short $P_DBCS01		;AN000;      the vector
 31787 00004E02 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 31788 00004E03 EB04                    	jmp	short $P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 31789                                  $P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 31790 00004E05 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 31791 00004E06 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 31792                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 31793 00004E07 EBEB                    	jmp	short $P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 31794                                  
 31795                                  $P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 31796                                  	; 18/04/2023
 31797                                  	; cf=0
 31798                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 31799                                  $P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 31800 00004E09 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 31801 00004E0A 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 31802 00004E0B 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 31803 00004E0C C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 31838                                  ;============================================================================
 31839                                  ; NPRINTF.ASM, PRINTF.ASM, MSDOS 3.3, 1987
 31840                                  ;============================================================================
 31841                                  ; 30/09/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 31842                                  
 31843                                  ; BREAK	<Message Printing Routine>
 31844                                  
 31845                                  ;
 31846                                  ;	MSDOS V3.00 PRINT
 31847                                  ;
 31848                                  ;	Message Printing Routine
 31849                                  ;
 31850                                  
 31851                                  ;PRINTF.ASM (MSDOS 3.3, LIBC)
 31852                                  ;
 31853                                  ;TITLE   PRINTF ROUTINE FOR MS-DOS
 31854                                  ;
 31855                                  ; PRINTF(Control String, arg1, arg2,...,argn-1,argn)
 31856                                  ;
 31857                                  ; Characters are output to PFHandle according to the
 31858                                  ; specifications contained in the Control String.
 31859                                  ;
 31860                                  ; The conversion characters are as follow:
 31861                                  ;
 31862                                  ;               %c - output the next argument as a character
 31863                                  ;               %s - output the next argument as a string
 31864                                  ;               %x - output the next argument as a hexidecimal number
 31865                                  ;                    using abcedf
 31866                                  ;               %X - output the next argument as a hexidecimal number
 31867                                  ;                    using ABCDEF
 31868                                  ;               %d - output the next argument as a decimal number
 31869                                  ;
 31870                                  ;
 31871                                  ; Other format specifiers that may precede the conversion character are:
 31872                                  ;
 31873                                  ;               - (minus sign) - causes the field to be left-adjusted
 31874                                  ;               + (plus sign)  - causes the field to be right-adjusted (default)
 31875                                  ;               n - digit specifing the minimum field width (default to 1)
 31876                                  ;               L - specifing a long integer
 31877                                  ;
 31878                                  ;   On entry to PRINTF the stack contains the return address and a pointer
 31879                                  ;   to an argument list.
 31880                                  ;
 31881                                  ;   ____________________
 31882                                  ;   |   Ret Addr       |      <= SP
 31883                                  ;   --------------------
 31884                                  ;   |  Ptr to Arg List |
 31885                                  ;   --------------------
 31886                                  ;
 31887                                  ;   And the argument list contains the following:
 31888                                  ;
 31889                                  ;       String_ptr                  (a pointer to the control string)
 31890                                  ;       Arg 1
 31891                                  ;       Arg 2
 31892                                  ;         .
 31893                                  ;         .
 31894                                  ;         .
 31895                                  ;       Arg n-1
 31896                                  ;       Arg n
 31897                                  ;
 31898                                  ;   If the argument is a %s or %c the arg contains a pointer to the string
 31899                                  ;   or character.
 31900                                  ;
 31901                                  ;   The arguments are used in one-to-one correspondence to % specifiers.
 31902                                  
 31903                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 COMMAND.COM (1987) Transient portion offset 34E0h
 31904                                  
 31905                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 31906                                  
 31907                                  PRINTF_INIT:
 31908                                  	call	STD_PRINTF
 31909                                  	retf
 31910                                  
 31911                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 31912                                  
 31913                                  PRINTF_CRLF:
 31914                                  	call	STD_PRINTF
 31915                                  	;call	CRLF2
 31916                                  	;retn
 31917                                  	; 07/04/2023
 31918                                  	jmp	CRLF2
 31919                                  
 31920                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 31921                                  
 31922                                  STD_EPRINTF:
 31923                                  	mov	word [cs:PRINTF_HANDLE],2
 31924                                  	jmp	short new_printf
 31925                                  
 31926                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 31927                                  
 31928                                  STD_PRINTF:
 31929                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 COMMAND.COM (1987) Transient portion offset 34F4h
 31930                                  
 31931                                  	mov	word [cs:PRINTF_HANDLE],1
 31932                                  NEW_PRINTF:				;Save the callers' registers
 31933                                  	cld
 31934                                  	push	dx
 31935                                  	push	bp
 31936                                  	mov	bp,sp
 31937                                  	push	cx
 31938                                  	push	bx
 31939                                  	push	ax
 31940                                  	push	di
 31941                                  	push	si
 31942                                  	push	es
 31943                                  	push	ds
 31944                                  	push	cs
 31945                                  	pop	es		;ES points to Printf segment
 31946                                  	mov	di,PRINTF_BUF	;DI points to the output buffer
 31947                                  	mov	bp,[bp+2]  ; dx ;BP points to the argument list
 31948                                  	;mov	si,[ds:bp+0]	;SI points to the control string
 31949                                  	mov	si,[ds:bp] ; bp
 31950                                  	add	bp,2
 31951                                  	xor	bx,bx
 31952                                  	call	CLEAR_FLAGS	; initialize the world
 31953                                  
 31954                                  GET_CHAR:
 31955                                  	lodsb			;Get a character
 31956                                  	cmp	al,'%'		;Is it a conversion specifier?
 31957                                  	jz	short CONV_CHAR	;Yes - find out which one
 31958                                  	or	al,al		;Is it the end of the control string?
 31959                                  	jz	short PRINTF_DONE ;Yes - then we're done
 31960                                  PRINTF_PERCENT:				
 31961                                  	call	OUTCHR		;Otherwise store the character
 31962                                  	jmp	short GET_CHAR	;And go get another
 31963                                  
 31964                                  PRINTF_DONE:
 31965                                  	call	FLUSH
 31966                                  	pop	ds
 31967                                  	pop	es
 31968                                  	pop	si
 31969                                  	pop	di
 31970                                  	pop	ax
 31971                                  	pop	bx
 31972                                  	pop	cx
 31973                                  	pop	bp
 31974                                  	pop	dx
 31975                                  	retn
 31976                                  
 31977                                  CONV_CHAR:
 31978                                  	mov	byte [cs:PRINTF_LEFT],0
 31979                                  
 31980                                  NXT_CONV_CHAR:	
 31981                                  	;Look for any format specifiers preceeding the conversion character
 31982                                  	lodsb
 31983                                  	cmp	al,'%'			;Just print the %
 31984                                  	jz	short PRINTF_PERCENT
 31985                                  	cmp	al,[cs:CHAR_SUB] ; "-"	;Right justify the field	
 31986                                  	jz	short LEFT_ADJ
 31987                                  	cmp	al,[cs:PLUS_CHR] ; "+"	;Left justify the field
 31988                                  	jz	short CONV_CHAR
 31989                                  	cmp	al,[cs:CHAR_L]	 ; "L"	;Is it a long integer
 31990                                  	jz	short LONG_INT
 31991                                  	cmp	al,[cs:char_l]	 ; "l"		
 31992                                  	jz	short LONG_INT
 31993                                  	cmp	al,'0'			;Is it a precision specification
 31994                                  	jb	short LOOK_CONV_CHAR
 31995                                  	cmp	al,'9'
 31996                                  	ja	short LOOK_CONV_CHAR
 31997                                  	cmp	al,'0'
 31998                                  	jnz	short NOT_PAD
 31999                                  	cmp	word [cs:PRINTF_WIDTH],0
 32000                                  	jnz	short NOT_PAD
 32001                                  	mov	ah,'0'
 32002                                  	mov	[cs:PAD_CHAR],ah
 32003                                  NOT_PAD:					;Adjust decimal place on precision
 32004                                  	push	ax
 32005                                  	mov	ax,[cs:PRINTF_WIDTH]
 32006                                  	mov	cx,10
 32007                                  	mul	cx
 32008                                  	pop	dx
 32009                                  	xor	dh,dh
 32010                                  	sub	dl,'0'
 32011                                  	add	ax,dx
 32012                                  	mov	[cs:PRINTF_WIDTH],ax	;And save the total
 32013                                  	jmp	short NXT_CONV_CHAR
 32014                                  
 32015                                  LEFT_ADJ:
 32016                                  	mov	byte [cs:PRINTF_LEFT],1
 32017                                  	jmp	short NXT_CONV_CHAR
 32018                                  
 32019                                  LONG_INT:
 32020                                  	or	byte [cs:PRINTF_LONG],1
 32021                                  	jmp	short NXT_CONV_CHAR
 32022                                  
 32023                                  LOOK_CONV_CHAR:
 32024                                  	and	al,0DFh
 32025                                  	cmp	al,[cs:CHAR_X]	 ; "X"
 32026                                  	jz	short HEX_UP
 32027                                  	cmp	al,[cs:CHAR_D]	 ; "D"
 32028                                  	jz	short DECIMAL
 32029                                  	cmp	al,[cs:CHAR_C]	 ; "C"
 32030                                  	jz	short C_PUT_CHAR
 32031                                  	cmp	al,[cs:CHAR_S]	 ; "S"
 32032                                  	jz	short S_PUT_STRG
 32033                                  	call	CLEAR_FLAGS
 32034                                  	jmp	GET_CHAR
 32035                                  
 32036                                  HEX_UP:
 32037                                  	mov	word [cs:PRINTF_BASE],16 ;Hex conversion
 32038                                  	jmp	short CONV_TO_NUM
 32039                                  DECIMAL:
 32040                                  	mov	word [cs:PRINTF_BASE],10 ;Decimal conversion
 32041                                  	jmp	short CONV_TO_NUM
 32042                                  
 32043                                  C_PUT_CHAR:
 32044                                  	call	NEXT_CHRS
 32045                                  	mov	al,dl
 32046                                  	call	OUTCHR
 32047                                  	call	CLEAR_FLAGS
 32048                                  	jmp	GET_CHAR
 32049                                  
 32050                                  S_PUT_STRG:
 32051                                  	push	si			;Save pointer to control string
 32052                                  	call	NEXT_CHRS
 32053                                  	mov	si,dx
 32054                                  S_PUT_1:
 32055                                  	mov	cx,[cs:PRINTF_WIDTH]
 32056                                  	or	cx,cx
 32057                                  	jz	short S_PUT_2
 32058                                  	cmp	byte [cs:PRINTF_LEFT],0
 32059                                  	jnz	short S_PUT_2
 32060                                  	call	PAD_STRING
 32061                                  S_PUT_2:
 32062                                  	push	si
 32063                                  S_PUT_3:
 32064                                  	lodsb
 32065                                  	or	al,al
 32066                                  	jz	short S_PUT_4
 32067                                  	call	OUTCHR			;Put it into our buffer
 32068                                  	jmp	short S_PUT_3
 32069                                  S_PUT_4:
 32070                                  	pop	si
 32071                                  	cmp	byte [cs:PRINTF_LEFT],0
 32072                                  	jz	short C_S_END
 32073                                  	mov	cx,[cs:PRINTF_WIDTH]
 32074                                  	or	cx,cx
 32075                                  	jz	short C_S_END
 32076                                  	call	PAD_STRING
 32077                                  C_S_END:
 32078                                  	pop	si			;Restore control string pointer
 32079                                  	call	CLEAR_FLAGS
 32080                                  	jmp	GET_CHAR		;Go get another character	
 32081                                  
 32082                                  
 32083                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32084                                  
 32085                                  PAD_STRING:
 32086                                  	xor	dx,dx
 32087                                  	push	si
 32088                                  
 32089                                  COUNT_LOOP:
 32090                                  	lodsb
 32091                                  	or	al,al
 32092                                  	jz	short COUNT_DONE
 32093                                  	inc	dx
 32094                                  	jmp	short COUNT_LOOP
 32095                                  
 32096                                  COUNT_DONE:
 32097                                  	pop	si
 32098                                  	sub	cx,dx
 32099                                  	jbe	short COUNT_RET
 32100                                  	call	PAD
 32101                                  
 32102                                  COUNT_RET:
 32103                                  	retn
 32104                                  
 32105                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32106                                  
 32107                                  CONV_TO_NUM:
 32108                                  	call	NEXT_CHRS
 32109                                  	mov	ax,dx
 32110                                  	xor	dx,dx
 32111                                  	cmp	byte [cs:PRINTF_LONG],0 
 32112                                  			;Is this is a short or long integer?
 32113                                  	jz	short NOT_LONG_INT
 32114                                  	call	NEXT_CHRS
 32115                                  
 32116                                  NOT_LONG_INT:
 32117                                  	push	bx
 32118                                  	push	si
 32119                                  	mov	si,[cs:PRINTF_BASE]
 32120                                  	mov	cx,[cs:PRINTF_WIDTH]
 32121                                  	call	PNUM
 32122                                  	pop	si
 32123                                  	pop	bx
 32124                                  	call	PAD
 32125                                  	call	CLEAR_FLAGS
 32126                                  	jmp	GET_CHAR
 32127                                  
 32128                                  
 32129                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32130                                  
 32131                                  PNUM:
 32132                                  	dec	cx
 32133                                  	push	ax
 32134                                  	mov	ax,dx
 32135                                  	xor	dx,dx
 32136                                  	div	si
 32137                                  	mov	bx,ax
 32138                                  	pop	ax
 32139                                  	div	si
 32140                                  	xchg	bx,dx
 32141                                  	push	ax
 32142                                  	or	ax,dx
 32143                                  	pop	ax
 32144                                  	jz	short DO_PAD
 32145                                  	push	bx
 32146                                  	call	PNUM
 32147                                  	pop	bx
 32148                                  	jmp	short REM
 32149                                  
 32150                                  DO_PAD:
 32151                                  	cmp	byte [cs:PRINTF_LEFT],0
 32152                                  	jnz	short REM
 32153                                  	call	PAD
 32154                                  REM:
 32155                                  	cmp	bl,10
 32156                                  	jb	short NOT_HEX
 32157                                  	add	bx,6
 32158                                  NOT_HEX:
 32159                                  	mov	al,byte [cs:PRINTF_TABLE+bx] ; "0123456789ABCDEF"
 32160                                  	push	cx
 32161                                  	call	OUTCHR
 32162                                  	pop	cx
 32163                                  	retn
 32164                                  
 32165                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32166                                  
 32167                                  PAD:
 32168                                  	or	cx,cx
 32169                                  	jle	short PAD_DONE
 32170                                  	mov	al,[cs:PAD_CHAR]
 32171                                  PAD_LOOP:
 32172                                  	push	cx
 32173                                  	call	OUTCHR
 32174                                  	pop	cx
 32175                                  	loop	PAD_LOOP
 32176                                  PAD_DONE:
 32177                                  	retn
 32178                                  
 32179                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32180                                  
 32181                                  OUTCHR:
 32182                                  	stosb
 32183                                  	cmp	di,PRINTF_BUF_END ; SRCXNAME
 32184                                  	je	short FLUSH
 32185                                  OUTCHR_RETN:
 32186                                  	retn
 32187                                  
 32188                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32189                                  
 32190                                  FLUSH:
 32191                                  	mov	cx,PRINTF_BUF
 32192                                  	xchg	cx,di
 32193                                  	sub	cx,di
 32194                                  	jz	short OUTCHR_RETN
 32195                                  WRITE_CHARS:
 32196                                  	push	bx
 32197                                  	mov	bx,[cs:PRINTF_HANDLE]
 32198                                  	push	ds
 32199                                  	push	cs
 32200                                  	pop	ds
 32201                                  	mov	dx,PRINTF_BUF
 32202                                  	mov	ah,Write ; 40h
 32203                                  	int	21h		; DOS -	2+ - WRITE TO FILE WITH	HANDLE
 32204                                  				; BX = file handle, CX = number	of bytes to write,
 32205                                  				; DS:DX -> buffer
 32206                                  	jnb	short FOOB2_1
 32207                                  	call	GET_EXT_ERR_NUMBER
 32208                                  	cmp	ax,6
 32209                                  	jz	short FOOB2_4
 32210                                  	jmp	short FOOB2_2
 32211                                  
 32212                                  FOOB2_1:
 32213                                  	cmp	cx,ax
 32214                                  	jz	short FOOB2_4
 32215                                  FOOB2_2:
 32216                                  	mov	bx,dx
 32217                                  	add	bx,ax
 32218                                  	cmp	byte [bx],1Ah
 32219                                  	jz	short FOOB2_4
 32220                                  	pop	ds
 32221                                  	pop	bx
 32222                                  	mov	es,[cs:RESSEG]
 32223                                  	mov	dx,NOSPACEPTR
 32224                                  	test	byte [es:PIPEFLAG],0FFh
 32225                                  	jz	short PRINT_ERR_EXIT
 32226                                  	call	PIPEOFF
 32227                                  	mov	dx,PIPEEMESPTR
 32228                                  PRINT_ERR_EXIT:	
 32229                                  	jmp	CERROR
 32230                                  
 32231                                  FOOB2_4:
 32232                                  	pop	ds
 32233                                  	pop	bx
 32234                                  	retn
 32235                                  
 32236                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32237                                  
 32238                                  NEXT_CHRS:
 32239                                  	push	si		;Save pointer to control string
 32240                                  	mov	si,bx		;Get index into argument list
 32241                                  	add	bx,2		;Increment the index
 32242                                  	mov	si,[ds:bp+si]	; Get pointer to next argument
 32243                                  	mov	dx,[si]		; Get (address of the) next argument			
 32244                                  	pop	si
 32245                                  	retn
 32246                                  
 32247                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 32248                                  
 32249                                  CLEAR_FLAGS:
 32250                                  	xor	ax,ax
 32251                                  	mov	[cs:PRINTF_LEFT],al	;Reset justifing flag
 32252                                  	mov	[cs:PRINTF_LONG],al	;Reset long flag
 32253                                  	mov	[cs:PRINTF_WIDTH],ax	;Reinitialize width to 0
 32254                                  	mov	al,' '			
 32255                                  	mov	[cs:PAD_CHAR],al 	;Reset padding character
 32256                                  	retn
 32257

 32305                                  ;****************************************************************
 32306                                  ;*
 32307                                  ;* ROUTINE:	STD_PRINTF/STD_EPRINTF
 32308                                  ;*
 32309                                  ;* FUNCTION:	Set up to print out a message using SYSDISPMSG.
 32310                                  ;*		Set up substitutions if utility message.  Make
 32311                                  ;*		sure any changes to message variables in TDATA
 32312                                  ;*		are reset to avoid reloading the transient.
 32313                                  ;*
 32314                                  ;* INPUT:	Msg_Disp_Class	-  set to message class
 32315                                  ;*		Msg_Cont_Flag	-  set to control flags
 32316                                  ;*		DS	points to transient segment
 32317                                  ;*
 32318                                  ;*		if utility message:
 32319                                  ;*		DX	points to a block with message number
 32320                                  ;*			(word), number of substitutions (byte),
 32321                                  ;*			followed by substitution list if there
 32322                                  ;*			are substitutions.  If substitutions
 32323                                  ;*			are not in transient segment they must
 32324                                  ;*			be set.
 32325                                  ;*		else
 32326                                  ;*		AX	set to message number
 32327                                  ;*
 32328                                  ;* OUTPUT:	none
 32329                                  ;*
 32330                                  ;****************************************************************
 32331                                  
 32332                                  std_eprintf:
 32333 00004E1B C706[EC87]0200          	mov	word [PRINTF_HANDLE],2 		;AC000;Print to STDERR
 32334 00004E21 EB06                    	jmp	short new_printf		;AC000;
 32335                                  
 32336                                  	; 07/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 32337                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM (1991) Transient portion offset 5012h
 32338                                  
 32339                                  std_printf:

 32550                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32551                                  ; MODULE NAME: MSGSERV.SAL
 32552                                  ;
 32553                                  ; DESCRIPTIVE NAME: Message Services SALUT file
 32554                                  ;
 32555                                  ; FUNCTION: This module incorporates all the messages services and
 32556                                  ;	    is called upon at build time to INCLUDE the code requested
 32557                                  ;	    by a utility. Code is requested using the macro MSG_SERVICES.
 32558                                  ;
 32559                                  ; ENTRY POINT: Since this a collection of subroutines, entry point is at
 32560                                  ;	    requested procedure.
 32561                                  ;
 32562                                  ; INPUT: Since this a collection of subroutines, input is dependent on
 32563                                  ;	    function requested.
 32564                                  ;
 32565                                  ; EXIT-NORMAL: In all cases, CARRY FLAG = 0
 32566                                  ;
 32567                                  ; EXIT-ERROR: In all cases, CARRY FLAG = 1
 32568                                  ;
 32569                                  ; INTERNAL REFERENCES: (list of included subroutines)
 32570                                  ;
 32571                                  ;	- SYSLOADMSG
 32572                                  ;	- SYSDISPMSG
 32573                                  ;	- SYSGETMSG
 32574                                  ;
 32575                                  ; EXTERNAL REFERENCES: None
 32576                                  ;
 32577                                  ; NOTES: At build time, some modules must be included. These are only included
 32578                                  ;	 once using assembler switches. Other logic is included at the request
 32579                                  ;	 of the utility.
 32580                                  ;
 32581                                  ;	 COMR and COMT are assembler switches to conditionally assemble code
 32582                                  ;	 for RESIDENT COMMAND.COM and TRANSIENT COMMAND.COM to reduce resident
 32583                                  ;	 storage and multiple EQUates.
 32584                                  ;
 32585                                  ; REVISION HISTORY: Created MAY 1987
 32586                                  ;
 32587                                  ;     Label: DOS - - Message Retriever
 32588                                  ;	     (c) Copyright 1988 Microsoft
 32589                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32590                                  
 32591                                  ;	Revision History
 32592                                  ;	================
 32593                                  ;
 32594                                  ;	M007	SR	08/24/90	Fixed bug #1818 -- changed
 32595                                  ;				$M_DISPLAY_H_STRING to properly
 32596                                  ;				handle Ctrl-Z being passed
 32597                                  ;
 32598                                  ;	M013	SR	9/12/90	Make SETSTDIO flag false so that all
 32599                                  ;				these routines are no longer assembled.
 32600                                  ;
 32601                                  ;	M016	SR	10/14/90	Bug #3380. Changed SYSLOADMSG so that
 32602                                  ;				CR-LF string also gets reinitialized
 32603                                  ;				on every cycle.

 32715                                  
 32716                                  	; 07/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 32717                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5107h
 32718                                  
 32719                                  SYSLOADMSG:
 32720 00004F10 50                      	push	ax				;;AN000;
 32721 00004F11 53                      	push	bx				;;AN000;
 32722 00004F12 52                      	push	dx				;;AN000;
 32723 00004F13 06                      	push	es				;;AN000;
 32724 00004F14 57                      	push	di				;;AN000;
 32725 00004F15 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx				;;AN000;  Reset to zero
 32726 00004F17 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx				;;AN000;
 32727 00004F19 31FF                    	xor	di,di				;;AN000;
 32728 00004F1B B82E12                  	mov	ax,122Eh ; DOS_GET_EXT_PARSE_ADD ;;AN000;; 2FH Interface
 32729 00004F1E B200                    	mov	dl,0 ; DOS_GET_EXTENDED		;;AN000;; Where are the Extended errors in COMMAND.COM
 32730 00004F20 CD2F                    	int	2Fh				;;AN000;; Private interface
 32731                                  		; Multiplex - DOS 3+ internal - GET OR SET ERROR TABLE ADDRESSES
 32732                                  		; DL = subfunction - get standard DOS error table (errors 00h-12h,50h-5Bh)
 32733                                  		; Return: ES:DI -> error table
 32734                                  	
 32735 00004F22 8C06[F186]              	mov	[$M_RT+$M_RES_ADDRS.$M_EXT_COMMAND+2],es
 32736                                  	;mov	[$M_RT+10],es			;;AN000;; Move into first avaliable table location
 32737 00004F26 893E[EF86]              	mov	[$M_RT+$M_RES_ADDRS.$M_EXT_COMMAND],di

 33281                                  ;;
 33282                                  ;;  Proc Name:	SYSDISPMSG
 33283                                  ;;
 33284                                  ;;  Function:	The DISPLAY service will output a defined message to a handle
 33285                                  ;;		requested by the caller. It also provides function to display
 33286                                  ;;		messages when handles are not applicable (ie. DOS function calls
 33287                                  ;;		00h to 0Ah) Replaceable parameters are allowed and are
 33288                                  ;;		defined previous to entry.
 33289                                  ;;
 33290                                  ;;		It is assumes that a PRELOAD function has already determined
 33291                                  ;;		the addressibilty internally to the message retriever services.
 33292                                  ;;  Inputs:
 33293                                  ;;
 33294                                  ;;  Outputs:
 33295                                  ;;
 33296                                  ;;  Psuedocode:
 33297                                  ;;		Save registers needed later
 33298                                  ;;		Get address of the message requested
 33299                                  ;;		IF Message number exists THEN
 33300                                  ;;		  IF replacable parameters were specified THEN
 33301                                  ;;		     Display message with replacable parms
 33302                                  ;;		  ELSE
 33303                                  ;;		     Display string without replacable parms
 33304                                  ;;		  ENDIF
 33305                                  ;;		  IF character input was requested THEN
 33306                                  ;;		     Wait for character input
 33307                                  ;;		  ENDIF
 33308                                  ;;		  Clear CARRY FLAG
 33309                                  ;;		ELSE
 33310                                  ;;		   Set CARRY FLAG
 33311                                  ;;		ENDIF
 33312                                  ;;		Return
 33313                                  ;;
 33314                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 33315                                  
 33316                                  	; 08/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM

 33556                                  ;;	EXIT:	cx = number of chars to be displayed
 33557                                  ;;

 33559                                  
 33560                                  	; 08/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM

 33621                                  		; DOS - 2+ - WRITE TO FILE WITH HANDLE
 33622                                  		; BX = file handle, CX = number of bytes to writ
 33623                                  
 33624 000051C8 1F                      	pop	ds			;;AN000;; Set DS to segment of message text
 33625 000051C9 50                      	push	ax			;;AN000;;
 33626 000051CA 268A05                  	mov	al,[es:di] 		;;AN000;; Get the character
 33627 000051CD E85800                  	CALL    $M_IS_IT_DBCS		;;AN000;; Is this the first byte of a DB character
 33628 000051D0 58                      	pop	ax			;;AN000;;
 33629 000051D1 1E                      	push	ds			;;AN000;;

 33631 000051D3 1F                      	pop	ds			;;AN000;; Set DS to segment of message text
 33632 000051D4 7306                    	jnc	short $MIF129
 33633

 33635 000051D7 B440                    	mov	ah,40h ; DOS_WRITE_HANDLE ;;AN000;; DOS function to write to a handle

 33637 000051DA CD21                    	int	21h			;;AN000;; Write character
 33638                                  		; DOS - 2+ - WRITE TO FILE WITH HANDLE
 33639                                  		; BX = file handle, CX = number of bytes to write, 
 33640                                  $MIF129:
 33641                                  ;SR;
 33642                                  ; If the single char happened to be a Ctrl-Z, the dos write would return
 33643                                  ;0 chars written making the caller think there was an error writing. To 
 33644                                  ;avoid this, we check if the single char was a Ctrl-Z and if so, return that
 33645                                  ;the char was written, thus fooling the caller.
 33646                                  
 33647 000051DC 9C                      	pushf				;save flags

 33649 000051E1 7502                    	jne	short m_popf_j		;no, continue

 33652                                  m_popf_j:
 33653                                  	; 08/04/2023
 33654                                  	;$M_POPF  ; macro in 'sysmsg.inc' (MSDOS 6.0)
 33655 000051E5 EB01                    	jmp	short m_popf		;restore flags
 33656                                  
 33657                                  ; 07/04/2023
 33658                                  ; ---------------------------
 33659                                  ; MSDOS 6.0, SYSMSG.INC, 1991
 33660                                  ; ---------------------------
 33661                                  	; $M_POPF macro
 33662                                  	;jmp	short $+3
 33663                                  intret:
 33664 000051E7 CF                      	iret
 33665                                  m_popf:
 33666 000051E8 0E                      	push	cs
 33667 000051E9 E8FBFF                  	call	intret
 33668                                  	;;; end macro	
 33669                                  ; ---------------------------
 33670                                  
 33671 000051EC EB18                    	jmp	short $MEN128
 33672                                  
 33673                                  $MIF128:
 33674                                  ;SR;
 33675                                  ; Prescan the string looking for Ctrl-Z. We terminate the message the moment 
 33676                                  ;we hit a Ctrl-Z. cx will contain the number of characters to be printed.
 33677                                  
 33678 000051EE 55                      	push	bp			; M007
 33679 000051EF 51                      	push	cx
 33680 000051F0 E8A6FF                  	call	scan_ctrlz		;cx = count without Ctrl-Z
 33681 000051F3 89CD                    	mov	bp,cx			;store no ^Z count in bp ;M007
 33682 000051F5 59                      	pop	cx			;get old count back ;M007
 33683                                  	
 33684 000051F6 CD21                    	int	21h			;;AN000;; Write String at DS:SI to handle
 33685                                  	;jnc	short chk_count		;no error, adjust return count
 33686                                  	;jmp	short m_cnt_ok		;error, return with carry set;M007
 33687                                  	; 08/04/2023
 33688 000051F8 720B                    	jc	short m_cnt_ok 
 33689                                  ;M007
 33690                                  ; If we are writing to con and there is a Ctrl-Z in the string, the
 33691                                  ;return count will be much less and if this returns to the caller we can get
 33692                                  ;spurious error messages. We check here if the count returned is same as
 33693                                  ;original count or same as the count if we stop at Ctrl-Z. In the second
 33694                                  ;case, we fake it as if all bytes have been written. If the return count
 33695                                  ;does not match either count, then we had some other disk error (such as
 33696                                  ;insufficient disk space) and we pass it through
 33697                                  
 33698                                  chk_count:
 33699 000051FA 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax			;have all bytes been written?;M007
 33700 000051FC 7407                    	je	short m_cnt_ok		;there was an error writing ;M007
 33701 000051FE 39C5                    	cmp	bp,ax			;count = Ctrl-Z count? ;M007
 33702 00005200 F8                      	clc				;no error either way ;M007
 33703 00005201 7502                    	jne	short m_cnt_ok		;no, pass it through ;M007
 33704 00005203 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			;return old count ;M007
 33705                                  m_cnt_ok:				; M007
 33706 00005205 5D                      	pop	bp			; M007
 33707                                  $MEN128:
 33708 00005206 1F                      	pop	ds			;;AN000;;
 33709                                  ;$MIF127: ; 08/04/2023
 33710 00005207 C3                      	retn
