 33921                                  ;;	PROC NAME: $M_DISPLAY_MESSAGE
 33922                                  ;;
 33923                                  ;;	FUNCTION:  Will display or write entire message (with replacable parameters)
 33924                                  ;;	INPUTS:    ES:DI points to beginning of message
 33925                                  ;;		   DS:SI points to first sublist structure in chain
 33926                                  ;;		   BX contains the handle to write to (if applicable)
 33927                                  ;;		   CX contains the length of string to write (before substitutions)
 33928                                  ;;		   BP contains the count of replacables

 33931                                  ;;	REGS USED: All
 33932                                  ;;
 33933                                  ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 33934                                  
 33935                                  	; 10/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 33936                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:54DBh
 33937

 33939                                  ; $DO						;;AN000;; Note: DS:SI -> message
 33940                                  $MDO165:

 33942 0000529C 09C9                    	or	cx,cx				;;AN000;; Are we finished the message yet?
 33943                                  ;; $IF NZ					;;AN000;; No
 33944 0000529E 7421                    	jz	short $MIF166			;;AN000;; Yes

 33946 000052A2 B000                    	mov	al,0				;;AN004;;
 33947                                  ;; $DO						;;AN000;; Scan through string until %
 33948                                  $MDO167:

 33950                                  ;; $LEAVE E,AND					;;AN000;; No

 33952 000052A9 26386501                	cmp	byte [es:di+1],ah		;;AN000;; Is the next character also a %
 33953                                  ;; $LEAVE NE,AND				;;AN000;; No
 33954 000052AD 7404                    	je	short $MLL168
 33955

 33957                                  ;; $LEAVE NE					;;AN000;; No, GREAT found it
 33958 000052B1 750E                    	jne	short MEN167
 33959                                  $MLL168:
 33960 000052B3 268A05                  	mov	al,[es:di]			;;AN004;; Yes, (to any of the above)
 33961 000052B6 E86FFF                  	call	$M_IS_IT_DBCS			;;AN004;; Is this character the first part of a DBCS?
 33962                                  ;;; $IF C					;;AN004;; Yes

 33965                                  ;;; $ENDIF					;;AN004;;

 33968 000052BD 42                      	inc	dx				;;AN000;; Size = Size + 1

 33973                                  ;; $ENDIF					;;AN000;;
 33974                                  $MIF166:

 33976 000052C2 87CA                    	xchg	cx,dx				;;AN000;; Get size of message to display (tot sz in DX)

 33980 000052C8 4D                      	dec	bp				;;AN000;; Decrement number of replacables

 34913                                  ;;	INPUTS: DS:SI points at corresponding SUBLIST
 34914                                  ;;		ES:DI points at VALUE from SUBLIST

 34916                                  ;;		 Top of stack  --> Last character
 34917                                  ;;					. . .
 34918                                  ;;		 Bot of stack  --> First character

 35092                                  
 35093                                  ;============================================================================
 35094                                  ; LOADHIGH.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 35095                                  ;============================================================================
 35096                                  ; 12/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35097                                  
 35098                                  ; This is a new module added to support loading programs into UMBs provided
 35099                                  ; by DOS 5.0. 
 35100                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35101                                  ; Usage:
 35102                                  ;
 35103                                  ; LOADHIGH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] <filespec>
 35104                                  ;
 35105                                  ; <filespec> has to be a filename that is not wildcarded.
 35106                                  
 35107                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35108                                  ;
 35109                                  ;	Revision History
 35110                                  ;	================
 35111                                  ;
 35112                                  ;	M009	SR	08/01/90	Set flags to indicate that we are
 35113                                  ;				loading and high and also remember
 35114                                  ;				current UMB state.
 35115                                  ;
 35116                                  ;	M016	SR	08/09/90	Give special error message on attempt
 35117                                  ;				to loadhigh batch files and invalid
 35118                                  ;				filename on Loadhigh command line.
 35119                                  ;
 35120                                  ;	M039	SR	11/19/90	Bug #4270. Copy all the whitespaces
 35121                                  ;				after the program name also as part
 35122                                  ;				of the command line being passed to
 35123                                  ;				the program to be invoked.
 35124                                  ;
 35125                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35126                                  
 35127                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35128                                  ;
 35129                                  ;	include highload.inc		; Grab code for ParseVar and such
 35130                                  
 35131                                  iCmdLine	equ	81h		; PSP:81h points to command-line
 35132                                  
 35133                                  ;
 35134                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35135                                  
 35136                                  ;****	LoadHigh -- Main routine for Loadhigh command
 35137                                  ;
 35138                                  ;	ENTRY	Command line tail is at PSP:iCmdLine terminated by 0dh
 35139                                  ;		CS = DS = SS = TRANGROUP
 35140                                  ;
 35141                                  ;	EXIT	None
 35142                                  ;
 35143                                  ;	USED	ax, bx, cx, dx, si, di, es
 35144                                  ;
 35145                                  ;	ERROR EXITS
 35146                                  ;		Message pointers are setup at the error locations and then
 35147                                  ;	we jump back to CERROR which is the transient error recycle point.
 35148                                  ;	Apart from parse errors, the other errors handled are too many
 35149                                  ;	switches anf invalid filenames.
 35150                                  ;
 35151                                  ;	EFFECTS
 35152                                  ;		The allocation strategy and the state of the arena chain are
 35153                                  ;	put in the requested state according to the given options. If a 
 35154                                  ;	filename is also given, it is executed as well.
 35155                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35156                                  
 35157                                  	; 13/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35158                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5927h
 35159                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only ! (MSDOS 6.0 code is different)
 35160                                  LoadHigh:
 35161 0000567E 1E                      	push	ds
 35162 0000567F 07                      	pop	es
 35163                                  
 35164 00005680 E86B00                  	call	SkipLhDelims
 35165                                  
 35166                                  ;Get command tail to be passed to the program. This includes any whitespace
 35167                                  ;chars between the program name and its parameters as well.
 35168                                  ;On return, ds:si points at the start of the command tail.
 35169

 35174

 35176

 35179                                  
 35180                                  ;Set allocation strategy to HighFirst and link in UMBs for exec. This will
 35181                                  ;be reset after return from the Exec
 35182                                  ;We will also set a resident flag to indicate that UMBs were activated for
 35183                                  ;the Exec. On return from the Exec, this flag will be used to deactivate UMBs
 35184

 35186

 35195                                  					
 35196                                  ;*** 	ParseLhCmd - parses any command-line options
 35197                                  ;
 35198                                  ;	ENTRY	None
 35199                                  ;
 35200                                  ;	EXIT	Carry clear -- command line parsed successfully
 35201                                  ;		Carry set -- appropriate error message setup
 35202                                  ;
 35203                                  ;	USED	ax, si
 35204                                  ;
 35205                                  ;	EFFECTS
 35206                                  ;		Options set up (see highvar.inc)
 35207                                  ;		Filename to be executed setup
 35208                                  ;
 35209                                  ;	ParseLhCmd calls InitVar to initialize data filled in by ParseVar,
 35210                                  ;	then calls ParseVar itself to actually parse the commmand-line.  On
 35211                                  ;	return from ParseVar, DS:SI will point to the beginning of the child
 35212                                  ;	module's name on the command-line; thus it calls LhCopyFilename to
 35213                                  ;	prepare the command-line for that program.
 35214                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35215                                  
 35216                                  	; 13/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35217                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5944h

 35219                                  ParseLhCmd:

 35222

 35225 000056A7 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx

 35236                                  	;;jmp	short PLhCmd2
 35237                                  	;retn
 35238                                  	; 14/04/2023
 35239 000056B8 EB02                    	jmp	short LhCopyFilename

 35278                                  ;***	LhCopyFilename -- copy filename from command line to buffer
 35279                                  ;
 35280                                  ;	ENTRY	ds:si points at primary argument (filename)
 35281                                  ;
 35282                                  ;	EXIT	Carry set -- filename has wildcards.  In this event, DX will
 35283                                  ;				already contain an appropriate error number.
 35284                                  ;		Carry clear -- filename has been copied as needed; DS:SI
 35285                                  ;				points to first character (most likely space)
 35286                                  ;				after filename.
 35287                                  ;
 35288                                  ;	USED	ax, si
 35289                                  ;
 35290                                  ;	EFFECTS
 35291                                  ;		ExecPath contains the filename
 35292                                  ;
 35293                                  ; If there are any wildcards in the filename, then we have an error
 35294                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35295                                  
 35296                                  	; 13/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35297                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5984h
 35298                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only ! (MSDOS 6.0 code is different)

 35305                                  lhcpfn1:

 35369                                  ;
 35370                                  ;	ENTRY	{es/ds}:si = points just after the end of the child program
 35371                                  ;
 35372                                  ;	EXIT	None

 35375                                  ;

 35378                                  ;	moved to the top of the command line buffer (at TRANGROUP:81h)
 35379                                  ;	and a new command line length is put in
 35380                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 35390                                  SetCmdL1:

 35400                                  SetCmdL2:

 35481                                  ;***	SetupPath -- Do path search for the file to be executed
 35482                                  ;
 35483                                  ;	ENTRY	None
 35484                                  ;
 35485                                  ;	EXIT	Carry set if file not found or not executable file
 35486                                  ;
 35487                                  ;	EFFECTS
 35488                                  ;		ExecPath contains the full path of the file to be executed
 35489                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35490                                  
 35491                                  	; 14/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 (& v4.1) COMMAND.COM
 35492                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:5A0Fh
 35493                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM only ! (MSDOS 6.0 code is different)
 35494                                  SetupPath:
 35495                                  
 35496                                  ;Juggle around the argv pointers to make argv[1] into argv[0]. This is 
 35497                                  ;because the path search routine that we are about to invoke expects the
 35498                                  ;filename to search for to be argv[0].
 35499                                  ;
 35500                                  ;If our new argv[0] starts with a switcharacter, it's an option... skip right
 35501                                  ;over it by doing the whole move again (smaller, of course, this time).
 35502                                  
 35503                                  
 35504                                  	;mov	ax,arg.argvcnt		;total number of arguments
 35505                                  	; 14/04/2023
 35506                                  	;mov	ax,[ARG_ARGVCNT]
 35507 0000575C A1[0F91]                	mov	ax,[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt]
 35508                                  
 35509 0000575F 48                      	dec	ax			;less one - skip "LoadHigh"
 35510                                  	;mov	bx,SIZE Argv_ele
 35511 00005760 BB0B00                  	mov	bx,ARGV_ELE.SIZE ; 11
 35512                                  	;mov	bx,11
 35513 00005763 F7E3                    	mul	bx			;dx:ax = size of argument lists
 35514                                  
 35515                                  	; 14/04/2023
 35516 00005765 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax			;size to move
 35517                                  
 35518                                  	;mov	di,offset TRANGROUP:Arg	;Copy TO argv[0]
 35519                                  	;mov	di,ARG_ARGV ;mov di,[ARG+ARG_UNIT.argv] ; mov di,[ARG]
 35520 00005767 BF[4F8E]                	mov	di,ARG	
 35521 0000576A 89FE                    	mov	si,di			;
 35522                                  	;add	si,SIZE Argv_ele	;Copy FROM argv[1]
 35523 0000576C 83C60B                  	add	si,ARGV_ELE.SIZE ; 11
 35524                                  	
 35525                                  	; 14/04/2023
 35526                                  	;mov	cx,ax
 35527                                  
 35528 0000576F FC                      	cld
 35529 00005770 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			;Move the argument list
 35530                                  	
 35531                                  	;dec	arg.argvcnt		;Fake one less argument, and
 35532                                  	;dec	word [ARG_ARGVCNT]
 35533 00005772 FF0E[0F91]              	dec	word [ARG+ARG_UNIT.argvcnt]
 35534                                  	
 35535                                  ; Done moving... argv[0] is now the child program's name, and [1] its first arg
 35536                                  
 35537 00005776 E817DA                  	call	path_search		;look in the path
 35538                                  
 35539                                  ;ax = 0, no file found
 35540                                  ;ax < 4, batch file found -- cant be executed
 35541                                  ;ax = 4,8 => .com or .exe file found
 35542                                  
 35543 00005779 09C0                    	or	ax,ax			;any file found?
 35544 0000577B 740B                    	jz	short no_exec_file	;no, error
 35545                                  
 35546 0000577D 83F804                  	cmp	ax,4			;executable file?
 35547                                  	;jl	short no_exec_bat	;no, indicate fail ; M016
 35548                                  	;clc
 35549                                  	;retn
 35550                                  	; 14/04/2023
 35551 00005780 7201                    	jb	short no_exec_bat
 35552 00005782 C3                      	retn 
 35553                                  
 35554                                  no_exec_bat:
 35555 00005783 BA[BC81]                	mov	dx,NoExecBat_Ptr	;Setup message ptr ; M016
 35556 00005786 EB06                    	jmp	short lhsp_errret	;return error; M016
 35557                                  
 35558                                  no_exec_file:
 35559 00005788 B80200                  	mov	ax,ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND ; 2
 35560 0000578B E88DFF                  	call	LhSetupErrMsg		;setup error message
 35561                                  lhsp_errret:				; M016
 35562 0000578E F9                      	stc
 35563 0000578F C3                      	retn

 37340                                  ; TITLE	COMMAND Transient Initialized DATA
 37341                                  
 37342                                  ;The TRANDATA segment contains data that is assumed to have predefined
 37343                                  ;initial values at the beginning of each command cycle. It is
 37344                                  ;included in the transient checksum area. If values in TRANDATA
 37345                                  ;change, the transient will be reloaded for the next command cycle.
 37346                                  
 37347                                  align 16
 37348                                  		; MSDOS 3.3 COMMAND.COM (1987) Transient portion offset 3730h
 37349                                  
 37350                                  PRINTF_TABLE:	db '0123456789ABCDEF'
 37351                                  _3740h:		db '%S',0
 37352                                  ARG_BUF_PTR:	dw _3740h
 37353                                  		dw _3747h
 37354                                  _3747h:		dw ARG_BUF ; _43E8h
 37355                                  _3749h:		db '%S ',0
 37356                                  STRINGBUF1PTR:	dw _3749h
 37357                                  		dw STRING_PTR_1 ; _4468h
 37358                                  _3751h:		db '%9ld',0

 38040                                  AttrLtrs:
 38041 00008491 524853764441            	db	"RHSvDA"		; attribute letters for DIR
 38042                                  
 38043                                  ;	Attribute letters in AttrLtrs must appear in the order that
 38044                                  ;	attribute bits occur in the attribute byte returned by
 38045                                  ;	directory searches, starting with bit 0.
 38046                                  ;	The volume label attribute is lowercased to keep it from
 38047                                  ;	being matched (by an uppercase comparison).
 38048                                  
 38049                                  OrderLtrs:

 38051                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 COMMAND.COM
 38052                                  	;db	"NEDSGC"		; sort order letters for DIR
 38053                                  
 38054                                  ;	Sort order letters stand for file name, extension,
 38055                                  ;	date/time, size, grouped (directory files before others),
 38056                                  ;	and compression ratio. DIR routines rely on the specific

 38318                                  ; PARSE BLOCK FOR DIR
 38319                                  
 38320                                  ; The following parse control block is used for the DIR internal command.
 38321                                  ; This command has one optional file specification and several optional
 38322                                  ; switches. Switches, switch values, and the filespec are returned in 
 38323                                  ; PARSE1_OUTPUT.
 38324                                  ;
 38325                                  ; Switches are /a[value], /-a, /o[value], /-o, /s, /-s, /?, /b, /-b,
 38326                                  ; /w, /-w, /p, and /-p. The string values for /a and /o are optional,
 38327                                  ; do not require colons, and are not checked against a value list.
 38328                                  ;
 38329                                  ; Switch /h has been removed from the DIR command	;M008
 38330                                  ; Switch /? is no longer handled internally		;M008
 38331                                  ;
 38332                                  ; A list of pointers to all the switch synonyms is provided here to
 38333                                  ; help identify which switch has been matched.
 38334                                  
 38335                                  	; 15/04/2023 - Retro DOS v4.0 COMMAND.COM
 38336                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 COMMAND.COM - TRANGROUP:8815h

 38344 00008565 02                      	db	2			; 2 kinds of switches
 38345 00008566 [6B85]                  	dw	DIR_SW_VALUED

 38347 0000856A 00                      	db	0			; no keywords

 38687                                  ;TITLE	COMMAND Transient Uninitialized DATA
 38688                                  
 38689                                  ;The TRANSPACE segment contains variable data that is considered
 38690                                  ;volatile between command cycles, and therefore is not included in the
 38691                                  ;transient checksum area. Contents of these variables MUST be
 38692                                  ;initialized before use, and must not be relied upon from command
 38693                                  ;cycle to command cycle.
 38694                                  ;
 38695                                  ;No constant data values should be stored here.

 39073                                  
 39074                                  ;The TRANSPACE segment contains variable data that is considered
 39075                                  ;volatile between command cycles, and therefore is not included in the
 39076                                  ;transient checksum area. Contents of these variables MUST be
 39077                                  ;initialized before use, and must not be relied upon from command
 39078                                  ;cycle to command cycle.

 39087

 39089 00008845 00<rep 57h>             TRGXNAME: times	DIRSTRLEN+20 db 0 ; 87	; buffer for name translate
 39090 0000889C 00<rep 83h>             UCOMBUF:  times COMBUFLEN+3  db 0 ; 131	; Raw console buffer
 39091 0000891F 00<rep 83h>             COMBUF:	  times COMBUFLEN+3  db 0 ; 131	; Cooked console buffer
 39092 000089A2 00<rep 46h>             USERDIR1: times	DIRSTRLEN+3  db 0 ; 70  ; Storage for users current directory
 39093 000089E8 00<rep 83h>             EXECPATH: times COMBUFLEN+3  db 0 ; 131 ; Path for external command

 39099 00008AC0 0000                    RESSEG:	dw 0			; MYSEG     (dw 0) 	 	
 39100 00008AC2 0000                    TPA:	dw 0			; LTPA	    (dw 0)	
 39101                                  SWITCHAR:

 39103                                  DIRCHAR:
 39104 00008AC5 00                      	db 0			; RDIRCHAR  (db '/')
 39105                                  EXEC_ADDR:
 39106 00008AC6 00000000                	dd 0			; 	    (dw EXT_EXEC)	 
 39107                                  				; MYSEG1    (dw 0)	
 39108                                  RCH_ADDR:
 39109 00008ACA 00000000                	dd 0			;	    (dw TREMCHECK) 	
 39110                                  				; MYSEG2    (dw 0)	
 39111 00008ACE 0000                    	dw 0			; RESTEST   (dw 0)
